updates.update_content: We thank everyone being So patient with us. We are working hard on getting this book done as fast as possible. Heres a few ink pages along with some colors to give you all a sneak. i dint want to give to much away 😉. Please keep being patient, Chrus and Beejay are putting together some Incredible work. Thanks

Hey everyone. Thanks again for being patient. We are working hard trying to make this a great all around read for everyone. As Chris and Beejay are hard at work getting pages knocked out, I’ve been working on getting all the stretch goals stuff ordered. Things are going great so far and are picking up a little so just be patient a little longer. Thanks everyone :) here are a couple of screenshots of some of the art and colors.
Wes

Hey everyone, thanks for being patient. We are still moving forward. Everyone has been busy working on this book. Things are taking a little bit longer then we hoped for but It’s going to be  worth it. It’s going to be a great book so just hang tight for a little longer.

Just stopping in to give a little update. COVID is taking its toll for sure but we’re still pushing. Here’s a little teaser pic of some colors that Beejay started. We still have work to do and I appreciate everyones patience. I can’t wait to get this out to all of you! Any questions feel free to reach out to me.

Just wanted to stop by and let everyone know that we are working right along. Here’s a little teaser page that was sent to Beejay to have colored. Can’t wait to show you guys more. Be safe out there. Talk to you all soon.

Dragonfly was fully funded and it was all of you that made it happen. Dragonfly, John, and Ketch will get to live on and tell new stories. You all are amazing. Now the work continues with us as we continue to work on this book. I’ll be keeping you all updated along the way. From the bottom of my heart, thank you all again.

Can’t say thanks enough for everyone’s love and support. You all rock. We are one track to unlocking the short story of Plak and Ploo. I hope everyone enjoys the rest of today and keep sharing if you can :) Also a few buddies that have Kickstarters going. Russell Nohelty has one that’s down to the last 30+ hours. He’s got some great rewards left. check out his stuff at https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/russellnohelty/ichabod-jones-volume-1-2-a-lovecraftian-dark-fantasy-comic/posts/2970682

We just unlocked #2. Everyone who back $10 or more will get 11x17 artist proof prints in black and white of all 4 Dragonfly covers for free! So now we are moving towards the blank covers stretch goal at $8500. We still have time so keep sharing. Just added now but if we hit 9k we’ll be adding a short story of Plak and Ploo from the Dragonfly series drawn by BeeJay. Thanks again everyone for your support.

Thanks for all the love and support for week 1. We hit our goal! Now we are working towards the stretch goals. Keep an eye out on fb and instagram in the next few weeks. We will be doing auctions to help us reach those stretch goals.

campaign.story:
Exclusive Pavement vinyl stretch goal reached!!!
  Between Pavement and Stars EP on vinyl! This is exclusive to Kickstarter! We have not made any physical pressings of this EP, ever.

  It is available to all backers as an add-on item. Since we reached that goal, we have Add-ons available so anyone can add that and other items they have been asking for. Check the updates for the link to the form
Pavement Re-release Mock-up final art may vary
We Are Five Iron Frenzy!
First of all, thank you for checking out our Kickstarter Page!
For Press, Promotion, or booking please contact us at band@fiveironfrenzy.com 
For Kickstarter concerns or questions please contact us here
If you don't know us, we hail from the land of ice and snow Denver, Colorado. If you do know us, thanks sticking with us for the past 7 years following the release of Engines of a Million Plots. With that project, we reunited after a 9 year hiatus. Having that support through Kickstarter and rocking out with us at our shows has been the highlight of our lives! 
We now have new dream! Releasing another full length album, Until This Shakes Apart and you can be a part of this effort!
Once again we are asking you to pledge to our Kickstarter campaign so together we can make the album of our Dreams! With the state of the world today, we have a few things to say.
Until This Shakes Apart will be made on our own without support from a major record label. Your contributions will be used to facilitate the production of the album by paying for recording time, mix/master, manufacturing, as well as some travel expenses.
 Keep up with our ventures at www.FiveIronFrenzy.com and www.facebook.com/5ironFrenzy 
Keep checking back, we will be adding new pledge items and stretch goals throughout the month. 
Pro Tip - If you want to pledge more than once, you can add a period to your Gmail email and create another Kickstarter account (exam.ple@gmail.com, ex.ample@gmail.com) It will all go to your same inbox.
Photo by Elle Jaye
 If you have suggestions that you would like to see as a pledge item, please send a message. We will see if we can make it happen.
Photo by Melinda DiMauro Photography
Reese as Abraham Logan attacking an injured soldier (Brad)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The work on this album has been in progress for years now, and we're excited to start to see it come together. We still have some recording and production in the works. Then we move to manufacturing as well as making and fulfilling all the pledge items. Please be patient, every step in this process takes time. 

We want to get this to you and make it the best it can be!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
If we reach the next stretch goal of 7,500, Jeff is crazy enough to draw sketch cards for all you pledgers.  
Meet Riley. She can take on a bolt of lightning, end up in the wrong place at the wrong time, and finally land herself in a bizarre jungle adventure.  Welcome to The Way-Out Life of Riley, where she confronts them all in the goofiest and most heroic, Riley sort of way. 
One of the many promotional sketches by Jeff Shultz
Jeffs pencils from an upcoming story



 WHO WE ARE: THE CREATORS 
Jeff Shultz is well known for his incredible volume of work on Archie’s Betty and Veronica, along with others, including Peanuts, Looney Tunes and Tom and Jerry.
Rich Maurizio has been involved with an assortment of classic characters, including Tom and Jerry, Looney Tunes, Animaniacs and Underdog, as well as producing comics based on classic TV shows: The Munsters, I Dream of Jeannie and Mister Magoo’s Christmas Carol.
Both Jeff and Rich realized they wanted to develop their own creator owned projects. Jeff said “I have these ten pages of a story I did about a girl named Riley. Rich looked at the pages, thought they were great, and said ” Okay, let’s do this.”
We’ll share the writing and art. Jeff does pencils and Rich will do most of the inks.
With both being huge fans of the silver age teen humor books, we thought the best way to approach this was to write the series in that style
We wanted to take the characters on unusual adventures. We're writing our stories where the characters could be old-time detectives in one story, and in the next be something from mythology. 
We then brought on Glenn Whitmore to color the covers and stories. Glenn has contributed colors to DC’s Superman and the infamous Death of Superman series, along with Archie, Super Suckers and others for Sitcomics, and Die Kitty Die for Astro Comics. 
OUR CAST OF CHARACTERS
 OUR GOAL  
Our goal is to produce the series through the imprint Funny Book Institute (FBI) and then compile the first three 32 pg issues into a trade paperback with an all new story.  We believe we can  meet and surpass this realistic goal, with remaining funds put towards covering production costs and funding of the book. We'll be introducing some exciting stretch goals once we meet our initial objective. 
 We intend on launching another campaign for the Way Out Life of Riley after the first issue. We’ll keep producing Riley books and other creative titles as long as we meet our goals.
CONTRIBUTOR 
And speaking of being a  contributor, you will receive a book along with some incredible perks, including original Archie covers from Jeff’s personal collection. We’ll be doing limited art pieces, sketch covers, signed editions, and will offer a stunning set of Space Girl prints signed by Jeff. We are firm believers in all ages comics, and we love and believe that there can be all forms of genres in this industry.  
Set of two very familiar space girls by Jeff Shultz. These two prints measure 11 x 17 and come signed. This is one of the many perks for this campaign.
Art by Jeff Shultz
Original art covers signed and illustrated by Jeff Shultz for the low price of $200 each.
          Covers listed in rewards  Betty &  Archie, Pizza Delivery
.  
   Covers listed in rewards Betty Running, Jughead bowling.
Art by Rich Maurizio
WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you can’t make a contribution, please share this campaign on social media and let people know about our venture. 
Thank you and let the fun begin!
WERE FUNDED!!!! THANK YOU ONTO STRETCH GOALS
Our 5K stretch goal: a stunning print of ? and Riley for everyone and it will ship with the book. The print will be signed by both Jeff and Rich. Onto 7k it will be a treat.
 THE ORIGINAL ARTWORK FOR THIS PRINT IS AVAILABLE AS A REWARD
SKETCH CARD
 Every pledger will get a sketch card illustrated and signed by Jeff.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
At this stage the story is fully written, with most of the artwork completed. Plus, we are now in the process of writing the second issue.

Producing, publishing and distributing books is what we do. For years we have been involved in all aspects of comics. Our track record speaks for itself. We have put in a lot of painstaking hours into this project and feel it was well worth it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE: READY FOR SHIPPING THIS MONTH.
updates.update_content:
HI
Just wanted to give you an update on things... We are going to the printer next week and everyone will have the books in December. 
We are pretty proud of the book and can't wait for our readers to see it.

Hi all, 
Here's an update 
Everything is on schedule.
The book is being colored and we are working on the editorial pages.

I’ve heard rumors that if we reach 7,500 we would be giving a hand drawn sketch card to everyone who backs our book. I just have to say- - it’s true! A big thanks to all who’ve pledged so far. I’m finishing the last story right now, so tell your friends and neighbors (and even their pets) because it’s gonna be a hoot!                                         Jeff

campaign.story:
Why we've come to Kickstarter...
Hello Everyone!  Dave Garcia  and Monica Sharp here, and welcome to our “The Chronicles of Panda Khan: Chapter 1" campaign. 
Two years ago, our friend, artist Mickey Clausen of San Diego, suggested it was time to bring back our sf/fantasy Panda Khan series, only this time as full color comics. He volunteered to re-ink all the issues (and remove all the zip a tone), computer color them and re-letter them, so we happily agreed. 
While doing all this work, Mickey put us together with his good friend Jon Bryans over at Gaelstone Media, and after signing with them, we now have a Panda Khan Animated cartoon in development. Visit Panda Khan the Animated Series page on Facebook for more info.       
 So, with the renewed interest in Panda Khan, and because many of you might have missed our original black and white “The Chronicles of Panda Khan” series from back in the mid 80’s, we wanted to make sure you had a chance at grabbing a copy of this exciting series for yourselves only this time in FULL COLOR.
What you get in Chapter 1 ...
The story opens with geneticists manning a research station on the distant planet Da Tu in charge of repopulating Earth Colonies with endangered and extinct animals, long absent on the planet Earth. But this one outpost is led by scientists who have taken their assignment a few steps further. P'an Ku, the project director, is teaching his panda bears sign language. And his rival, Shibo, has diabolical plans for all the animals being cloned and restored. The AI computer has developed a personality as a minor deity and is teaching the pandas mythology while building his own underground hive worker army.
To celebrate the return of Panda Khan to comics we are reprinting the original black and white series from 1986, in FULL COLOR. Chapter One will be a 48 page graphic novel, reprinting the 1st issue of Panda Khan and will also contain an 8 page story, “Dragon's Hide”, of a young Panda Khan, which was originally printed as a back up story in “Usagi Yojimbo #21" published in 1990.
As a special bonus we have added an 8 page origin story of an all new ARCH NEMESIS for Panda Khan. This will be his 1st appearance in the Panda Khan universe. You will be able to get a first glimpse of his new ARCH NEMESIS when we reveal two "Virgin" covers, one by Dave Garcia and one by Mickey Clausen.
UPDATE: for those ordering a physical copy of the new trade, please choose which of the following prints you want: https://www.facebook.com/originalpandakhan/posts/1597120927124246
 Creative Team...      
 DAVE GARCIA has been the Co-creator, artist, and cover artist on Panda Khan since its inception. Dave has drawn for various publishers throughout the years, working on the TMNT Adventures for Archie Comics, and 20 years as an artist on the hilariously goofy superhero, THE TICK, and TICK spin-offs. Dave is also the creator, writer and artist on “Shadow of the West”
MONICA SHARP has been the co-creator, writer, and editor on Panda Khan since its inception. She cowrote the  Tick's ally "Paul the Samurai"mini series for NEC Press She is also the editor on “Shadow of the West” 
MICKEY CLAUSEN is a photographer, artist, and comic book colorist who has worked for Image Comics, IDW, Boom Studios, DWP, Mattel, Dungeons and Dragon’s, BlueWater Comics, Silverline Comics, and various others. Currently working on “GODAI 5” the comic book series that he has Co-created with his 12 year old granddaughter Gianna McElroy.
WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?
Every penny raised goes towards making "The Chronicles of Panda Khan: Chapter 1" a reality. That covers everything from the creative talent, graphic design, printing, supplies, fees and taxes. In other words, everything that it takes to make this happen is where the bulk of the money is going! A portion of the money will go to fulfilling all the cool rewards we are offering and a percentage will go to taxes, Kickstarter fees and credit card processing fees. Any profit will go toward funding future chapters of The Chronicles of Panda Khan. 
 NEW COLORED ART 
 Reward Tiers... 
 Shipping is *not included* in the rewards prices and will be charged by Backerkit when the books and prints go out to backers. You choose only the rewards you want and skip any tiers that you choose. If we receive enough pledges past our basic $4000 funding goal, stretch goal freebies are unlocked at various $ amts. 
Cover A trade edition




STRETCH GOALS...
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
When it comes to timely shipping and fulfillment, any project could have obstacles. However, the creative production of The Chronicles of Panda Khan” Chapter 1, is completely on track for delivery in late September 2020.

Shipping is not included and will be charged by Backerkit when the books and prints go out to backers.

Our printing partners are secured, our budgets are complete, our shipping supplies are ready to order, and our manpower is lined up.

We will make sure all your rewards are delivered as promised, packed securely.

You can count on this: whether we have hiccups or not, we will be in communication with you during the entire process and update you in a timely manner. We want to assure you that, beyond making the coolest products possible, and the printing, packing and shipping of those items in a top notch manner is equally important to us. Panda Khan is a project of love.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Packages are still going out. We hope you're watching the development of PANDA KHAN THE ANIMATED SERIES through its facebook page. You can always

However some people are still waiting. I (Monica)  have been waiting for Dave to finish all the art commissions so I could avoid avoid multiple trips to the post office, which is ten miles from our farm. However, starting today, I am mailing out the finished ones. However, there are about 20 people that we don't have mailing addresses for. We have emailed them and sent out backer surveys  but no response. So if you haven't heard from us or received your item, please contact us at at pandakhancomics.com. Colorist Mickey Clausen at Mindwinder Studios sent out notices for shipping costs so check your spam or trash folders.

Dave and Mickey will be signing the books for people who asked. We used a different printer for the prints so we're expecting them soon. Email pandakhancomics@gmail.com if you have any questions. We apologize for the delay and wish everyone a happy and healthy 2021.__Monica

Some of you may know that our dear friend, Leah Dunsmore Underhill, died unexpectedly on September 2nd in the ICU at Palomar Medical Center. Her husband, Rod Underhill had been our close friend, and legal advisor since 1982 or 83, until he died of cancer in August of 2018, and his family was our family. 
Leah and Rod’s two children called Monica and said, “Aunt Monica, can you come to the hospital? The doctors say Mom is dying.” and she jumped in her truck and immediately drove to the hospital but Leah passed away from a massive infection that spread after her operation from appendicitis twenty minutes before Monica arrived. The children were devastated. The family has been buried under crushing medical debts since they were hit in their car by another driver about 10 yrs ago, which broke the son’s leg, broke Leah’s back and crushed her legs, and shattered Rod’s pelvis into 17 little fragments.

updates.update_userinfo: Dave and I became new parents... sort of.
Printer just sent us the trade!
updates.update_content: Kickstarter sent us this message. It takes up to 14 days for them to process pledges at the end of a successful campaign. Thank you again for pledging and make sure we have your correct mailing address to send your items.

project_data.project_name: The Chronicles Of Panda Khan: Chapter 1

campaign.story:
The Story
 Chapter One: The Beginning
Patient 27 was locked away at the Grove Mental Institution and forgotten about for more than 10 long years. But with the arrival of Dr. Ashley Reese things change. Patient 27 begins to remember who he once was in what seems like another life. But there is more to Patient 27 than anyone knows, he is incredibly strong and nothing seems to bale to harm him. Together Dr. Reese and Patient 27 begin to unlock the doors to his dark past and soon discover some secrets should stay hidden. 
Chapter Two: The Chase
Patient 27 (Tim) and Reese begin a quest to discover his true identity. Before too long they are caught in the crosshairs of Watts and the agents of Project Sampson. Separated, Reese learns the dark truth about Tim from his former student Marco. Tim’s superhuman endurance and strength come from an experiment to save his life, but that salvation cost Tim everything.
Chapter Three: The Final Chapter
With the release of From Blood: Chapter Three the story is now complete. This third issue contains an epic climax that sees Patient 27 finally facing death. Dr. Reese has fallen in love with this mysterious man, but time is running out to tell him as Project Sampson is bearing down on them. Marco finally reveals the secret he’s been hiding all these years, he has much to atone for … if he can live long enough to do so.
 The Collection
Together all three chapters of From Blood clock in at just over 70 pages of non stop action and intrigue. This series was created by James Whynot & Zach Bassett with a story by Whynot, Bassett and Martin Pierro. The pencils for this epic series were provided by Zach Bassett with inks by James Whynot and Kenneth Leinaar and colors by Victorino Muyo Jr.
All three issues are available in this Kickstarter campaign, with their standard covers and their highly limited Blood Foil covers. If you have already purchased Chapter One & Two there are tiers for you just to get that final chapter.
Stretch Goals
Thank you to everyone who backed this project and got us fully funded in 5 days! It is so greatly appreciated. Without hesitation we set the first Stretch Goal at $1,800 … and quickly passed that, so now everyone who pledged for a "physical reward" (anything non-digital) will receive a brand new From Blood Bookmark. featuring the awesome cover artwork from Chapter Three. 
 Our next Stretch Goal was at the $2,000 level and is a very special reward indeed. Zach Bassett (writer/artist) and Martin Pierro (writer) will sit down and record an Audio Commentary for the entire series - three chapter = three commentaries. They will go step by step explaining their choices for each major turn in the story, giving a behind the scenes look at the creative process. This bonus reward has been unlocked.
 Our third Stretch Goal will be unlocked if/when we cross the $2,500 mark and this one will add value to the third and final chapter of From Blood. We will add more pages to that third chapter in the form of an art gallery featuring never before seen artwork from and inspired by this epic series. But this will only happen if the campaign passes the $2,500 mark. 
 "A WILD ADVENTURE" - Travis Gibb
Comic book author (Broke Down and 4 Dead Bodies) Travis Gibb recently reviewed issues 1 & 2 of From Blood saying that  "the book is a wild adventure, if you like old school action star movies ... this is the book for you." -  Read his full review by clicking -HERE!
Take a peak behind the cover of Chapter Three ...
From Blood: Chapter Three - Pages 13 & 14
As with the previous issues, at the launch of this Kickstarter all of the production work is finished for this final chapter. Meaning once this campaign is complete we will send the files off to the printer and quickly get the final product delivered to you. Both the Chapter One campaign and the Chapter Two campaign were fulfilled on schedule, this campaign will be no different.
PLAY

The Team  
NEW REWARD TIER FOR RETAILERS! 
As the campaign is nearing its end we are offering an incredible deal for our retailer friends. You can score 15 sets of this incredible series before it is available through any other distribution channel. We’re talking a $195 retail value at half of the cover price - $97.00. We are offering these sets to retailers at pretty much what the printing cost is, to do what we can to support our struggling retailer partners as they are finally able to welcome customers back into their stores. To show our support, we will aggressively promote any retailer that backs at this reward tier through our social media outlets to try and drive as much business as we can through their doors. As an added bonus if any comic store in the state of Florida backs this project at this reward tier - writer/publisher Martin Pierro will come and do a signing in that shop.
The Rewards
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the THIRD issue of From Blood that we are funding through Kickstarter, the first two were both successes and delivered to all the backers right on schedule. As all the work was done on this issue before the launch of this campaign, there is very little risk on your part.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Kickstarter People,
Don’t miss out on a chance to own some original Zach Bassett artwork on a blank sketch cover! The campaign for The Good, The Bad, and The Prehistoric is winding down … but there are still THREE chances to score a blank sketch cover featuring a Zach Bassett sketch of YOUR choice* for only $60.00.
Check out some of the work he’s done in the past …

Hey everybody - I just wanted to let you know about something new!

From Blood co-conspirators Zach Bassett and myself have teamed up for a brand new adventure - The Good, The Bad, and The Prehistoric! We will be launching The Good, The Bad, and The Prehistoric March 16th on Kickstarter! It’s an exciting story about the old west … but not as you know it. In our story dinosaurs and men exists side by side in the wild untamed frontier. In this time bending tale, horses and other beasts of burden have been replaced by dinosaurs and the indigenous people are now represented by mysterious cavemen.

I hope everyone enjoyed reading From Blood as much as we enjoyed making it. We still have plans for that series so keep your eyes peeled for a From Blood announcement coming in 2021. In the meantime … let’s look to the immediate future.  

We will be launching the Deep Space Tragedy Black Light Free Fall Collectors Boxed Set on Kickstarter January 12th and I do hope that you will consider backing this campaign. Deep Space Tragedy is the story of a teenage robot rock band on the run! For the FIRST TIME, the entire series, along with all four "Transformers Variants" will be available in a special collectors box. Each issue in the series is thicker and richer than the previous one, culminating in a triple-sized final issue. The series totals 125 pages of pure robot rock n’ roll action!

Hello,
I just wanted to let you know that my new book Decisions: A Minor Variation is now live on Kickstarter!

Hello,
The books have arrived and they are already gone! We quickly packed up the books and shipped them all out. I also released the digital files via e-mail (if you didn’t receive your email let me know). 
Almost everyone should have their books by Friday or Monday at the absolute latest. The only ones that will take a little longer are the international orders (they have been shipped but I have no idea when they will arrive) and the four original art tiers (those will be shipped from Texas by Zach and that will take a little longer). Once you receive your books I encourage you to post about them on social media and tag us in the post as we love seeing the books in reader’s hands.

Hello,
After a few delays, all the copies of From Blood: Chapter Three have finally arrived from the printer and they look amazing! I did a live unboxing video … check that out!

Hey folks,
There seems to be a slight delay in getting the books from the printer (had something to do with the foil covers) - I'll let you know more when I find out. In the meantime I have some good news ... we might still be waiting for the books ... but the From Blood: Chapter Three bookmarks have arrived. This means that we are getting even closer to Kickstarter reward fulfillment. Here's a video of me unboxing the bookmarks ... I couldn't wait ...

Good Morning,
All of the rewards surveys have been sent. Please fill yours out as soon as possible, so we can get the files prepped and ready for the printer. We won’t release the digital versions until the book has been printed.
As it stands right now, as long as we can have all the surveys completed by week’s end - we should be able to have the books at the printer by June 24th, meaning fulfillment could start as soon as July 1st.

campaign.story:
A Vampire’s mortal servant comes to the sleepy college town of Denton Tx, to investigate what is lurking in the town’s shadows
Instead she finds a curious team of cheerleaders with the abilities and courage to fight those monsters in the dark.
Will they join together to fight this unknown threat? Will it be enough to save the town of Denton?
Main Cover
Abuse and Revenge is a vicious cycle with no real victors.  When the women of Dusk and Cheerleader Karate School start to investigate the supernatural disappearances affecting Denton, TX, they put all their lives in grave peril.
A 22 Page Crossover Full Color Comic by Dusk Comics and Taurian Films

David Doub and BJ Lewis are residents of Denton Tx and both big fans of comics.  In true comics style they thought it would be amazing to do a proper crossover/team up with their characters like they always saw in comics when they were growing up.
Come enjoy the fun and excitement of an old school superhero team up with the dark styling of Dusk and Cheerleader Karate School. 
Dusk - Born from David Doub's love of Vampire Fiction and the 1980's Black and White Comics boom comes Dusk.  
As a battered wife, Eve's only concern was to keep her marriage together. But when she is kidnapped into the sordid supernatural world of vampires and foul magic, Eve finds she doesn't want to leave. Her mysterious benefactor, the Vampire Lord Ash, wish her to have a normal life but Eve chooses to stay in the service of Ash. Dusk is the stories about Eve and her challenges living in the darkness. Dusk is a supernatural action/drama story done in a dynamic blending of the sequential art styles of American Comics and Japanese Manga.
Cheerleader Karate School - BJ Lewis' Perky Chicks with Roundhouse Kicks, is meant to be a blend of shows like Supernatural, Pretty Cure, Dragon Ball Z, and Sailor Moon. 


Photo Cover Variant
"Total Rad Comics" Cover Variant
 Please note that the art for the rewards are not final and are subject to and likely to change.




Madness Heart Press is a Texas-based boutique publisher of dark literature and speculative fiction. Started in 2019 by John & Desiree Baltisberger, Madness Heart Press has grown to publish amazing books of horror, modern folktales, and doom-laden poetry. Encompassing a blog, two podcasts, several books and an online presence Madness Heart Press promises southern hospitality with a hint of mind rending madness. Two of their books from the UPD series, a supernatural crime procedural based in Texas are on offer here. John Baltisberger, known as the Kaiju Poet, continues to write kaiju and Jewish themed horror and offers not only his books but access to the Obliterate the Globe project.
Totally Rad Comics your one stop shop for 80s adult action from sexy clowns to slasher killers we have something for everyone! With over 6 titles and 70 variant covers and more to come the possibilities are endless.

The book has been fully drawn so we just need to color and letter the book. Dusk Comics and Taurian Films has completed many successful projects so there is plenty of experience to get this project done on time and done right.

Coloring - 1300
Printing - 300
Prints - 100

Fees and Buffer - 150

Total - 2300

updates.update_userinfo: PDF Is Sent. Files Going to the Printers!
updates.update_content:
Hello,
Check you inbox because the PDF has been sent out to everyone.

Also we are getting the files to the printers this week and will be shipping the books as soon as we can.  Considering we are getting close to the holidays, there may be a slight delay in Shipping but we're working on our end to get it in your hands has fast as you can.

I do apologize for the delay.  We had planned to get to the book out by October but due to us trying to make the book the best we can, it has slipped to Nov.   There is literally one last tweak to make and we'll be done.  We'll send out the PDFs ASAP and then get the books off to the printer.

Just waiting on one last art tweak and we hope to have you the PDF this week or next.  And then we'll be working with the Printer to try and get you the book out this month (next month at worse case).

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

campaign.story:
Now's your chance to get entertainment that you can enjoy without leaving your home! 
In addition to funding these books for print, I wanted to use this Kickstarter to help fight the pandemic by offering 10% to a charity. I then found out that direct donations of funds from a Kickstarter are against their rules. Ugh! https://www.kickstarter.com/rules. I'd still very much like to help though, so instead I'll be putting links on the Tinto Press website to the CDP COVID Response Fund. Anyone making a donation will get a 30% discount on books from the Tinto store. Thanks for your understanding.
This Kickstarter will go towards covering the cost of print production. With your support, we can make this a successful venture and continue to provide quality comics with depth, meaning, and value!
Tinto Press is a Denver-based publisher of independent comics and graphic novels. We’re interested in literary comics with an eye to good storytelling and a focus on reality-based genres. If you haven't heard of Tinto Press books, you can check them out at https://TintoPress.com. 
So let me tell you about the new line of books we’re funding with this Kickstarter.
The Cats of Ostia Antica by Julian Brier 
Download the FREE sampler here, and see the animated cover here.
The Cats of Ostia Antica
An old Italian fellow’s fantastic journey to the afterlife as he’s escorted by spirits that take the form of cats. This is a silent comic; that is, it has no word balloons or captions yet it manages to tell the story with extreme clarity and really heightens the spooky quality. It’s 110 pages of full-color spectacle and the scale and grandeur of the images grow with each panel. 
 Goiter#5 by Josh Pettinger
Download the FREE sampler here. and see the Animated cover here.
Goiter #5
This book is perfect for Tinto Press and I’m really excited to be bringing it to you. It’s quirky, incredibly unique, and the stories and art are great. Josh is a master at making the ordinary seem weird and uncomfortable as well as funny. If you enjoy books from artists like Seth, Box Brown or Chris Ware, you’re going to love this book. It’s a 36-page comic we’re putting out there in the hopes that we can produce it as a regular, ongoing series.
 So, Buttons #11 by Jonathan Baylis
So, Buttons #11 This an example of an earlier issue.
this is an example from an earlier issue
this is an example from an earlier issue
Following in the footsteps of Harvey Pekar, Jonathan writes comics about real life that are both funny and relatable. This ongoing series carves out soulful slices of his reality and remarks compellingly on bits of culture, Also in the spirit of Pekar, he’s employed some great artists to bring his stories to life: Fred Hembeck, T.J. Kirsch, and Summer Pierre just to name a few.
 The HairPair by Charlie LaGreca Velasco 
The Hair Pair
Charlie is a seasoned comics professional who has worked for major companies like DC, Nicolodean, and Lego. Hair Pair is the hit kids comic he created for Disney Adventures Magazine and will be collected here for the first time. It’s two hamsters, working it out in their habitrail world. The cute factor is off the charts on this one and there’s a Bert and Ernie quality to it that’s fun for adults as well as kids. If you’re familiar with Charlie’s work, or you’re into adorable fuzzy animals, you don’t want to miss out on this one. It's currently 48 pages of full color with the potential for more content when we hit our goals.
Downtown: A Portrait of the Denver Skyline, by Karl Christian Krumpholz
 Download the FREE sampler here, and see the animated cover here.
Downtown (Not Final Cover)
Karl creates visually stunning documentation of life in the big city with his ongoing comic, 30 Miles of Crazy. This has made him an expert in the zeitgeist of Denver neighborhoods. In this follow-up to his last Tinto Book, An Introduction To Alcohol, Karl collects his beautiful drawings of landmark buildings. Home to some of the most interesting and historically significant architecture in the US, Karl has interpreted the Mile-High structures, in his own inimitable style and with a detail and personality that reflect his intense interest in urban landscape. A must-have for anyone interested in charming metropolitan architecture.
Special Theth: Tomorrow Forever Reward
Josh Bayer's new book Tomorrow Forever has been delivered after a long wait for the printers and is now available! The book retails for $25 but for this fundraiser, Josh has agreed to make it a reward for a $20 Backer level! 
What's a dream worth? It's the early '90s during a cold Columbus, Ohio winter. Tomorrow Forever is the story of "Teth": a young, punk cartoonist and his struggle to create work of value in the face of poverty, self-doubt and obsessive thoughts. 
This book will ship immediately after the Kickstarter in April 2020. 

 STRETCH GOALS:
These are production upgrades that will kick in when we hit goals beyond our initial funding goal. You will not need to increase your individual backer amounts but will reap the benefits as more people come on board. So tell your friends!
Stretch Goal Upgrades
at $9,000 The Cats of Ostia Antica to a hardcover book.
at $10,000 Goiter and So, Buttons Paper Upgrade
at $11,000 DownTown hardcover upgrade.
at $12,000 HairPair content addition
at $13,000 DownTown Larger size.
So please check out our rewards section and help fund this new line of Tinto Press books. After you’ve become a backer, consider sharing this on social media so we can hit our goals more quickly and get our rewards out to you sooner.  Thanks! 
-Ted Intorcio, Owner, Tinto Press.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I understand that in the midst of the pandemic, there is economic unrest and buying comics is not a necessity. If, however, you can afford to throw a few bucks at this campaign, I feel confident that you will be satisfied with the results. There is a possibility of delays brought about by the coronavirus, though we are shooting for a release of September for all of the books. Also, So, Buttons #11 is still being drawn and edited and so the images above for that section are examples from earlier issues to give you a sense of the work. Remember to wash your hands before and after handling your comics! #StayHealthy
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Library Gift
support.descp:
Not a comics lover? No worries! At this level, I will send an appropriate number of comics to a library! It might be the Shulz Library at the Center for Cartoon Studies, it might be the Library of Congress, or it might be the Denver Public Library. or Denver Zine Library!
If you give $5, I'll send one comic, but after that, we'll do the same wholesale rate we do for libraries. So, if you back at $20, a library will get $40 in comics.

updates.update_content: Hey, Everyone! We're still plugging away on fulfillment of Goiter and The Cats of Ostia Antica, and still waiting on Queen City, The Hairpair and, So Buttons finals. Karl Christian Krumpholz is making steady progress and we're very close to having a finished cover with a final interior for it in the can. Hairpair extra content has been provided and Charlie LaGreca is making final edits. Jonathan Baylis is working away despite Covid setbacks. Stay tuned! I will be sending out links to digital versions in the next few days. Thanks everyone! Happy holidays!

updates.update_userinfo: The Cats of Ostia Antica is Here! Fullfillment has begun!
updates.update_content: Hey everyone! Sorry for this somewhat tardy update. I wanted to wait till post-election to break the news. So depending on your politics, more good news!! Other updates. Goiter #5: We have sent out 99 percent of Goiter #5 fulfillment so if you do not have your copy, please email ted@tintopress.com for an update. Karl Christian Krumpholz' Queen City'( title updated from Downtown) Is complete and we're currently deep in edits and proofreading. We're also very close with So Buttons and The Hair Pair. Stay tuned!

updates.update_userinfo: Fullfilling Goiter, waiting from the printer on Cats of Ostia Antica
updates.update_content:
Hello, everyone! I have some good news! Goiter is here and fulfillment has begun! 
Now for the less great news. We're waiting for Cats of Ostia Antica from the printer. It's very difficult to gauge when the books will be here but we hold out hope that it will be soon. 
The other books are coming along and I am receiving regular updates from the creators on progress, which is significant. Stay tuned.

Hey, everyone, hope your September is going well! Due to pandemic issues, which have slowed delivery from China printers and prevented some of the artists from finishing their work before the September deadline, we've had to postpone fulfillment on the books for one month till October 15. Apologies for this setback, we're all trying to get it done since we're as excited as you to get them out to you! Please bear with us. Keep reading for a breakdown of progress on each book.
Cats of Ostia Antica(J. Brier)- I'm told it's on it's way to us from the printer. I'm hoping they arrive within the next couple of weeks

updates.update_userinfo: Trying to keep to our release date!
updates.update_content: Checking in with our artists!

Soon, you’ll receive an email from us with a special link to your BackerKit survey. It’s important to respond to your survey as quickly as you can since we need this information to fulfill your rewards.
You don’t need to create a BackerKit account to fill out your survey. When you receive the email with the survey, click the survey link to respond. Answer the questions about your reward preferences, provide shipping information, and purchase add-on items if you like. You don’t have access to this survey link yet, but it will be available soon via email!
Still a half hour to get your pledge in!  Let's keep it rolling!

Wow. We've hit our 3rd stretch goal! I'm truly amazed we got there! With just under two hours to go! Thanks, everyone! I'm so proud of the work these guys are doing and very excited to be taking part in bringing them to you. The minutes are slipping by for anyone who has not yet had the opportunity to pledge. Now's your chance!

We're closing in on the end of our 2020 Kickstarter with a mere $300 short of our second stretch goal, At $9700 with 48 hours to go! Let's see if we can make that final hurdle! Please share this with your friends and all push hard for these last 2 days. Thanks, everyone!
-Ted Intorcio

campaign.story:
We've got Fernando's final art for his new "Kitty "cover:
You can get these 2 covers as prints too: 
AND HERE'S TODAY'S ORIGINAL ART AVAILABLE FOR ADD ON!
 GET A DAN/FERNANDO JAM PIECE! You can add it on, and twll us which characters you'd like!

OUR LATEST ADD-ONS:
Get 3 characters of your choice in a SODA MASH UP for $200!
Get your own SODA MASH UP for $200... or buy one of these!
A happy threesome!
"KITTY'S COSMIC FASHION SHOW" is now FUNDED! You may now add it to your pledge!
JETTA is now FUNDED! You may add JETTA to your pledge!
You may now add JETTA to your pledge!
You may now add on the DKD slipcase too:




Kitty Ravencraft is back!  The last time we saw her, she survived death in DKD: HEAVEN & HELL! And as she was celebrating surviving the clutches of death once again, a strange alien force abducted Kitty, leaving us all to wonder what was going to happen to our poor Kitty once again!
Now we'll find out where Kitty has been whisked away to, in the all new DIE KITTY DIE: STARSTRUCK! We'll meet the forces that abducted her, and we'll see the part they played in her past! And of course, there's plenty of action...and romance! If you like science fiction, you'll love our new series! If if you DON'T love science fiction, we think you'll love it!

Check out J Bone's beautiful cover for our trade!
But of course, many of Kitty's old crowd returns! Little Satan, Derek, Katty, and of course everyone's favorite kid corpse, Dippy the Dead Kid are back! We'll see Kitty trying to get back to Earth, but there are forces in the galaxy trying to get rid of her. And the same forces on Earth that want to see the end of Kitty too. How will Kitty survive battling the UNIVERSE? She's a survivor, but this is ridiculous!! 
After 3 successful DKD series, we are determined to keep the fun going! And we think this is the most fun series yet! And we are still inspired to have a series that reminds us of the fun comics we liked to read as kids.  She's survived her earthly enemies and even the afterlife! What forces in the Universe will try and bring her down?  Well, there's more fun and satire than ever!  Our kickstarter backers have been a close knit family to us, and we value your input too!  We hope we can count on our very loyal and generous fans to make this the best DKD series ever!
We hope to follow the basic model of our first three series,  with a four issue storyline that we will initially release as individual PDF issues. As before, each individual issue will feature twenty pages of original story and art plus fashion pages, funny ad pages, pin-ups, variant covers and other added material. We will be handling a lot of the writing and drawing ourselves but much of this additional material will be completed by some of our talented friends and colleagues in the comic industry. Later, these issues will be collected into one softcover trade paperback and as per our last campaigns. Our goal is to collect enough funding to be able to make the softcover trade into a hardcover with a dust jacket.We've been lucky enough to achieve this goal in all 3 of our previous campaigns!
Once again, we are planning on a number of stretch goals to make this project better and better. We are hoping to add bonus material such as an additional exclusive story by the Andrew Pepoy, and beautiful spreads  by the awesome J Bone. J. Bone will also be handling the art for our trade collection ! We'll also be featuring the talents of Glenn Whitmore , Scott Mcrae and Bill Golliher too! In addition to these fun additions, we've got some really cool stuff planned! If other goals are met, we hope to do a JETTA : the Space Girl one-shot, that would be available digitally and in print! We'll also be "adding on" extras along the way, that you can add to your pledge . 


A main stretch goal will be a beautiful slipcase that holds the first 3 DKD hardcovers. You can order the whole triology with the slipcase, or if you already own the first 3 books, you can just order the slipcase separately. It's a great way to display your DKD books on your shelf. 
This beautiful slipcase will be available if we hit our 35k goal! It holds the first 3 hardcover editions!

Throughout the campaign, we'll be  listing all kinds of cool things you can add to your rewards. Just add the amount of what you' d like to your total like in the illustration below:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Since our first incredibly successful Kickstarter campaign 5 years ago, Die Kitty Die has enjoyed a lot of good luck. The reception to our first Die Kitty Die book has been hugely successful even being picked up in comic shops to expand our audience. We'd like to point out to everyone that despite this great good fortune, producing Kitty still falls to us. We still produce the series through our own imprint, Astrocomix. We creatively control everything. This is what brings us to Kickstarter. We can't do it alone. As you might imagine producing four complete issues of original story and art takes a lot of manpower and resources. We have our impressively talented team of inkers, letterers, colorists and others that we must hire and pay. We also have other costs such as printing, shipping and many other miscellaneous expenses that we need to cover ourselves. In fact, this time we'll be hiring outside fulfillment, so that the packages are sent out without delay so you get them promptly. We can't do this without the very generous help of our very kind and loyal fans and supporters. We were deeply appreciative and touched by the phenomenal amount of support we were shown throughout our first campaign and even afterwards. Making an independent creator-owned and driven project like Die Kitty Die has been our dream since long before either of us ever got into this business. We couldn't make that dream happen without your help.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Thanks to all of our backers,  who have been so patient in the mailing of rewards for the DIE KITTY DIE: STARSTRUCK campaign! Needless to say , the past year has been challenging for all of us! We've had issues with the postal system for sure. We've had international packages arrive faster than local packages! As well as some domestic packages arriving in 3 days, and some taking 2 months! Fortunately, this seems to be getting better now!
We had some setbacks in our printing schedules due to Covid, especially in the 3 extra months we had to wait for our single issues to get printed. And lastly, we finally got our postcard sets in hand several weeks ago!

updates.update_userinfo: MORE PACKAGES GOING OUT AS WE GET OUR FINAL ITEMS BACK FROM THE PRINTERS!
updates.update_content:
Thanks for your patience everybody! We continue to send out more packages as we work on your commissions. About 100 packages have gone out so far. And we're waiting on our FINAL printed items, our three 32 page comics that were funded through the kickstarter including JETTA. A lot of you ordered these, so these will complete a LOT of packages. 
The digital downloads for the three specials are available NOW, and I've been sending out those codes,  along with the rest of the digital catalog for those backers who purchased that.

updates.update_userinfo: CALENDARS ARE SHIPPING , SLIPCASES ARE HERE... BOOKS COMING SOON!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everybody!

Just an update to let you know that most of the calendars have shipped! If you don't get yours by December 1, let us know! 

Also, the slipcases are here, and they look great!

updates.update_userinfo: Hardcover Update , plus Slipcases and MORE!!
updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone! Things are moving along with DIE KITTY DIE: STARSTRUCK!
We just got the final sample for our slipcase! It looks great! We should have them in stock in about 6 weeks!

updates.update_userinfo: DKD: STARSTRUCK #2 is here! And our calendars have arrived!!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone! DKD: STARSTRUCK #2 is here! All our backers will be getting their download codes to get your issue! We hope you enjoy it! 
Also, our great DIE KITTY DIE 2021 calendars are here!

updates.update_userinfo: LAST CALL FOR SURVEYS! PLUS: ISSUE #1 AVAILABLE JULY 1!!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone! The campaign is over, but we're busier than ever! We're gathering your surveys, and the sooner we get them all we can tally up the rewards to send. And the commissions to work on! So, if you haven't sent yours in, please do so!
Issue #1 of DIE KITTY DIE :STARSTRUCK will be ready for you digitally on July 1! You will receive your free download code then! 
The other rewards like the calendar and slipcover are all in the process of being put together, and getting prepared for the printer. There have been some delays due to COVID-19, but things seem to be moving a little faster now.

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys Going Out Soon! And You Can Still ADD-ON These Items...
updates.update_content:
Yes, we're preparing the surveys ( they seem to take longer to prepare every year!) , so those will be out soon! In the meantime, here is a list of items that you can still add on through PayPal, separate from the surveys. All you have to do is pick the items you want, and send payment to :
danparentdraw@gmail.com
ITEMS AVAILABLE TO ADD-ON( Prices include shipping):

Thanks everybody! We funded DIE KITTY DIE: STARSTRUCK! because of all of YOU!
But we didn't just fund it! We had our most successful campaign EVER!
And we did during a very challenging time. We weren't sure how we would fare considering the current pandemic situation. So the fact that you supported us is not taken lightly, and makes us even more determined to work hard and make this the best DKD series to date!

updates.update_userinfo: WE HIT 60K ! That Means a FREEBIE for Everyone!
updates.update_content: Thanks to our backers to making this our best campaign ever! With 12 hours to go we've hit 60K! We didn't have time to prepare a stretch goal, so we're going to give everybody a FREE DIE KITTY DIE COLORING BOOK! It's our way of saying thanks! (This is for those with physical rewards. I'm working on getting a PDF version for our digital backers)

campaign.story:
The From Blood story begins …
From Blood: Chapter One is the story of a superpowered mental patient, known only as patient 27. For years he has kept silent … a hulking indestructible mountain of a man, but after a visit from Doctor Reese ... the door has been opened and all hell breaks loose. This first chapter sets the stage and ramps up the action as the mysterious Patient 27 goes on a rampage through the Grove Mental hospital. Together Doctor Reese and 27 will face death in the epic climax of the first chapter.
NOW the From Blood story continues …
Escaping the Grove Mental Institute was only the beginning for Patient 27. Separated from Doctor Reese, 27 is taken in by a sinister group looking to exploit his strength and invulnerability. But Doctor Reese is not alone, she encounters a mysterious man from 27s past … who just might hold the key to his future. It’s an action packed race towards destiny in this exciting second chapter. 
We are seeking funding for From Blood Chapter Two a 24 page comic written by Zach Bassett, myself and James Whynot with art by Zach and inks by Kenneth Leinaar. Rounding out the creative is E.T. Dollman on letters and Victorino Mendoza Muyo Jr. providing the colors.
If you missed out on chapter one … we have reward tiers to get you caught up on all of the action. Including limited "blood foil" editions of both From Blood: Chapter One & From Blood: Chapter Two.
Take a peek behind the cover ...
From Blood: Chapter Two - Page 4
From Blood: Chapter Two - Page 5
From Blood: Chapter Two - Page 6
As with the previous issues, at the launch of this Kickstarter all of the production work is finished for this second issue. Meaning once this campaign is complete we will send the files off to the printer and quickly get the final product delivered to you.
Meet the From Blood Creative Team
NEW Benchmark Goal! 
 We are setting a benchmark goal for From Blood: Chapters One & Two on Kickstarter. We are now offering up a “special benchmark reward”, when the campaign gets to 50 backers. Once it crosses that benchmark - EVERYONE who backed the project will receive a digital copy of the Cosmic Sampler 2020 Edition and all backers with physical rewards will receive a FREE copy of Deep Space Tragedy issue 1 with your rewards.
NEW REWARD TIER!
From Zach Bassett’s personal collection of artwork … he is releasing the art used to create the From Blood: Chapter One Kickstarter variant. This piece is massive, larger than normal cover art, it features his original pencil artwork of Doctor Reese sitting in a chair reading a comic. Not only will you get the original art, with this reward tier you will be getting a copy of the ultra-rare From Blood: Chapter One Kickstarter edition (only 25 were printed) and a copy of Chapter Two along with the digital files and any bonus or stretch goal rewards as well.
The Rewards
The Money
Just as we did with issue 1, we are running this campaign very tightly and are only seeking funds to print this issue, package it and deliver it to our backers.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the second issue of From Blood that we are funding through Kickstarter, the first issue was a smash success and delivered to all the backers right on schedule. As all the work was done on this issue before the launch of this campaign, there is very little risk on your part.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everybody - I just wanted to let you know about something new!

Zach Bassett and myself have teamed up for a brand new adventure - The Good, The Bad, and The Prehistoric - now funding on kickstarter! It’s an exciting story about the old west … but not as you know it. In our story dinosaurs and men exists side by side in the wild untamed frontier. In this time bending tale, horses and other beasts of burden have been replaced by dinosaurs and the indigenous people are now represented by mysterious cavemen.

Hello There,
My new Kickstarter for Decisions: A Minor Variation recently crossed the 50% funded line, I’m still on track to just hit my goal … but the sooner I reach that goal the sooner I can unlock some awesome stretch goals. Decisions: A Minor Variation features TWO supernatural slice-of-life stories with an edge ... and BOTH have been written by me. Please check out this new Kickstarter and help me cross the finish line sooner rather than later.

updates.update_userinfo: From Blood Chapter Three - Final Days
updates.update_content:
Hey Folks,
If you backed From Blood: Chapters 1 & 2, there is still time to grab Chapter 3 in the From Blood: The Complete Series Kickstarter! As I write this, the campaign only has THREE days left. We had a few backers drop out meaning we are further away from hitting that third stretch goal, a reward tier that will see more pages added to Chapter Three in the form of a gallery. So we could sure use your support. You can score Chapter Three as a digital comic or a physical comic.

Thank you for supporting From Blood: Chapters One & Two on Kickstarter! Now, the final chapter is complete, and the full series will be available for the FIRST TIME in color. There will be reward tiers for the whole series, but for YOU there will be tiers for just Chapter Three. This epic final From Blood Kickstarter launches on Tuesday, May 12th, 2020, we hope that you will join us for the end of the story.
CLICK HERE TO GET A REMINDER AT LAUNCH

Hey everybody - I have some good news,
Zach sent out the final rewards today (original art and sketch covers) so with that - From Blood: Chapter Two is finished. I want to take a second to once again thank everyone who made this possible … there would be no book without the support of our backers and the comic book community as a whole. I hope that everyone who has already received their copy (digital or physical) has had a chance to read it and that you enjoyed the direction the story took. As you’ll note the book wraps up the narrative nicely filling in many of the gaps … but there is still more to the story … that’s right there is still one more chapter left in the From Blood saga.

Hello,
This week the books and the bookmarks arrived, so I immediately got to work on packing up the books and shipping them out. The first wave went out yesterday (Thursday - 4/9/20), the second wave will ship out on Monday with the third and final wave shipping soon after (I’m waiting on more packaging material to arrive). I expect all the rewards to be in backers hands well before the end of the month.

updates.update_userinfo: Roll Presses and a New Kickstarter from our Friends!
updates.update_content:
Hello Everybody,
After reviewing the From Blood: Chapter Two digital-proof, I have given the word for the printer to roll presses. So it won’t be long before the books are in our hands.
I will keep you up to date on the process as fulfillment gets closer.
Now for something completely different …

updates.update_userinfo: Strange Days … But We Are Moving Forward …
updates.update_content: So with all the craziness going on in the world … you might think we have forgotten about this project … not at all. Everything is moving forward as scheduled (for now), the payment from Kickstarter just came through and we are prepping the files to be sent to the printer, who has assured me that they are still churning out comics and will be able to produce our books on time. Naturally if something happens and they are forced to stop production … that could become an issue … but for now … we march forward.

Thank you to everyone who supported From Blood: Chapter Two … the backers and everyone who shared this project on social media. I couldn’t have done it without everyone’s support.
What happens next?
Well ... the surveys have just been sent out to all of our backers. Please fill these out as soon as possible, I am assembling the print files and I need to know how you would like your name listed on the thank you page in both the printed and digital editions of the book.

campaign.story:
What if you strongly felt that someone outside your family was a threat, and you did something to stop them?
Would that make you a hero? Or a racist?
And, if somebody stopped you, what would that make them? 
Hey everyone! R. Alan here, giving you the low-down on Anguish Garden, and what we're trying to do with this campaign. Hopefully, you dug our video. It's a good intro to our story, but here's the basics:
WHAT IT IS:
A Western, set in the near future, told in 70 pages. 
It will be printed as a soft-cover book. This is book 1 of 3.
Written by R. Alan, featuring layout art by Kevin Caron, pencil/ink art by Dailen Ogden, and coloring by Sarah Menzel Trapl.

WHAT IT'S ABOUT:
After a failed alien invasion, Zola tracks people infected by an incurable virus, and sends them to a quarantine called Anguish Garden. But when a war veteran sabotages her efforts, Zola has to find out why.
You can read a free 7 page preview HERE, or by clicking the picture below.
 In this story, we're exploring a character who believes she's doing something heroic. She's trying to save healthy humans, so she hunts "infected" people who show no symptoms, based solely on the word of government-appointed doctors. 
This is similar to some people raised within White supremacy, who believe that most other human beings are a threat that they need to be saved from. 
ABOUT ME:
I wrote a graphic novel called The Burning Metronome, and I write a weekly newspaper comic called What'd I Miss? 
I'm a professor for Regis University's Creative Writing MFA Program, teaching graphic novel writing. 
I host a podcast, focusing on unheard voices in the geek world, called Mother F**ker In A Cape.
MY GOALS:
TO PAY 3 ARTISTS FOR 7 MONTHS OF WORK
TO CREATE A BEAUTIFUL BOOK
PRINT IT
DISTRIBUTE IT
Printing 1000 of these books will cost about $8000. The remaining amount is to pay 3 artists for 7 months of work, and to cover expenses associated with finishing & distributing the book (Kickstarter fees, shipping, taxes, rewards, etc.).
WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU:
Make a pledge.
Share this Kickstarter, and encourage your friends to pledge.
Enjoy your rewards!
====================================================
Now I'm going to tell you why this book is important to me:
I read a book, Rising Out of Hatred: The Awakening of a Former White Nationalist, which was about a young man's journey out of White supremacy. I've often said that when it comes to "isms" (racism, sexism, ageism), they all come from one of two things:
1. A failure to see the other person's humanity
2. A refusal to see the other person's humanity
For people who refuse, they've made a choice, and probably can't be reached. But for people who are simply  failing, art can be a powerful way to learn about others' humanity.
In this story, I wanted to explore what it's like for a person who thinks they're doing the right thing - protecting their family and the people around them. What would it be like to discover that your own biases and prejudices are making YOU the monster - that you've imagined these threats and hurt people because of it?
That's the story underneath the story, so to speak. 
On the exterior, Zola's just a bad-ass with a pistol, who enforces the law, so that's going to make for some exciting action moments. You'll see one of those in the 7 page preview that we've finished.
So, despite the heavy underlying themes, this is made to be a fun read, and I'm thrilled about the artists who are working with me on it. You can learn more about them in the 3 minute video!
Thank you so much,
R. Alan
Music for video: https://www.bensound.com/royalty-free-music
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This first book is already completely written, with about 1/7 of the art completed. So, we just need the time to complete it, and the means to print it. We have a clearly defined production schedule, and I'll be posting updates as we complete chapters. We have an option of a local printer, or one overseas. The latter will be less expensive, but involves about $1000 in shipping. So, that may bring its own difficulties, such as delays in shipping, etc. But we'll be certain to keep you all posted if there are any such difficulties.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
It's a Christmas miracle! I made a video to celebrate!
PLAY

Hi, everyone! I got an update about our books from the printer:

"Alan, we are waiting for them to get released by customs. The ports are all kind of backed up right now due to congestion, equipment shortages and staff shortages due to COVID."

I sent the print files off at the beginning of October, and I've never had it take more than a few weeks to get my books back. Obviously, this is an usual time, but

Hello, friends! Hope Election Day anxiety isn't overwhelming you. It's been awhile, and I wanted to share some happy things with you:
========================
1. I gave a TEDxTalk in August, and it was just posted last Friday!

It had 15,000 views in its first 6 hours! You can watch it HERE.  In it, I talk about how art has fueled the world's revolutions, and why it's important, whether you make a living at it or not!

Hello, everyone, just a quick update:

I wanted to let you know that I've approved the printed proof of Anguish Garden! 
You can see it in the video below:

updates.update_userinfo: My TEDTalk, and R.I.P. Chadwick Boseman
updates.update_content:
Hello, everyone-
Today's a day of mixed emotions.
I want to let you know that the  Anguish Garden  books are going to the printer next week! So, that's exciting. Also, the new  Anguish Garden  shirts are in:
These shirts, featuring beautiful art by Dailen Ogden & Sarah Menzel Trapl, were printed by the fine people at , & will be available on soon!

Hello, folks-
Hope you're doing well, in these days of pandemic and protests. So, here's a cool update:
All the art for Anguish Garden is completed!
It's being lettered and laid out now!
Then we're shipping it off to the printer!

Hello, everyone-  
So listen - I apologize that it's been so long since you've heard from me. I've been distracted by things like a global pandemic, and history's largest civil rights protest. Crazy times, right?  
Obviously, it's been a lot, but in the midst of this all, I want to thank you all again for supporting this book, Anguish Garden. It's so important to me, and I want you to know that about half of the art for the book is complete now.

Well, it's amazing how the entire world has changed since we began this Kickstarter campaign.
Tonight is the last night of it, and I just wanted to thank all of you for supporting this vision, and making it happen. In the midst of this culture-shaking pandemic, where we're all working to survive and take care of those we love, it's vital to hold onto the things that inspire us all to move towards something better.

updates.update_userinfo: Fully funded! You beautiful people made it happen!

campaign.story:
10 Writer/Artist teams tell the story of 5 unusual heroes and 1 great adventure! Our  100- plus page graphic novel features writers and artists of Batman, Spider-man, Superman, The Avengers, The Punisher, The X-men, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, and so much more. (Check out our list of talent!)
What if everyone dressed the same, acted the same, and thought the same? Wouldn't the world be a better place with no arguments, no differing opinions, and no more war?
THE HEALING, an increasingly powerful cult set on world domination, is led by a charismatic masked man. They promise to solve everyone's problems and make the world a better place.
Five new heroes, whose powers are more of a curse than a gift, must stop The Healing before it is too late.
Sunshine - Marie Brogden can fly and she's super strong but she is incredibly lonely. She has to keep her distance from others to protect them from her cancer-causing radioactivity.
Babyface - Seth Brogden, the sensational Sunshine's brother, is a big powerful Boy Scout. He uses his super strength to help the weak. Fantastic but, sadly, he needs help himself ... with his drinking problem.
The Bokor - Luc Turcotte can create portals to travel instantly anywhere he wants to go and conjure shadowy figures to frighten evil-doers. Dealing with powerful personal loss, he uses macabre imagery from his Haitian heritage and reinvented himself as a Vodou sorcerer.
The Hactivist - Elijah Greybar is a brilliant man with no super powers of his own. He is extremely gifted with computers and technology. He is cautiously concerned about these unusual super-heroes. Does power corrupt absolutely?
Major Malfunction - Talk about getting the short end of the stick! Algernon Smalls can't enjoy the amenities of the modern world because his mere presence makes anything electronic or mechanical break down and stop working.
THE HEALING is a comic book project that is our love letter to the superhero genre. We've assembled some of the strongest talents to tell this amazing story. Each chapter features the work of a top independent writer and a legendary artist and tells an unforgettable epic.
Now is your chance to help us tell this fabulous story. You have an opportunity to enjoy a totally new adventure from the very beginning. By pre-ordering with us on Kickstarter you get in on the ground floor and can get this book in a variety of collectible formats.

 THE REWARDS



THE CREATIVE TEAM (Disclaimer: Because this is a work in progress some creators may change before project is complete!)

campaign.story:
Welcome friend, to my latest and possibly greatest Kickstarter campaign. 
It's a bold statement, but this one is different for many reasons. I've done many Kickstarters and I've tried to give my backers something new and better each time. With this one though, I really am offering a thing that I never have done previously. 
It's color. Recently, I tried to sit down and figure out how many pages of comic art that I've done in my career. The best, closest I could come up with is somewhere around 6000 pages. In that body of work, only a very, very few pages were published in color and certainly nothing within the past 20-25 years. 
Anyhow, these 2 comics are my first color self-published works. The coloring in these books is petty amazing, and has been in process for the past 2 years- in preparation for this campaign. The colorist, Dmitry Bobrovnik, I owe a huge debt of gratitude, for actually sticking with and finishing all 240 pages of art and doing it all on spec. Now it's time to get him paid. 
Let me introduce you to the members of The Box City Wallops.
This is an early cover image for the TPB. I'm not gonna use this one- I've decided on something different.
Wayne is the big brother, and the muscle of the group. He has a serious nature, and some people might even call him moody, yet there is a side to him that enjoys one-liners and sarcastic quips. His abilities include smashing and crushing, stomping, etc.
Next is middle sister Nola Root. Tough, stern- she is the product of her military training. Her preferred weapon is a sword yet she is proficient in all manner of weaponry as well as various martial arts and hand to hand combat. She struggles occasionally in her new role as protector and her past continues to haunt her.
Last- baby brother Zaso. A technical genius, his favorite tool is the mysterious N-Box, a device he himself constructed. With the appearance of a cell phone, the N-Box has a multitude of capabilities, many of which are known only to its creator.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Wallops are not "exposure enhanced" superheroes, or individuals who have gotten their powers through artificial means, as is the norm in the world of this comic. Rather they are of an alien race where all DNA is mixed naturally within the mother, to produce offspring of varying physical characteristics and abilities. This race is known as the Mergenetix- or Merge. In this race, what is normal and expected is that siblings will share no (or very little) likeness to one another.
Presently on Earth, the Wallops have the role as guardians and defenders of Box City and its residents. In the scenario I have put forth in this comic, teams of superheroes are hired and compensated for their services. Also- cities have one dedicated team that represents that particular market. Modeled loosely after sports teams one could think of it as that- however there is no inter-team league or competition between teams. For example in this first story arc we have our guys- The Box City Wallops and the neighboring city's Miracle City Killocrats.
The Book(s).
The Box City Wallops actually began life in 2016, and was originally a self-published, Kickstarter exclusive, black and white comic. There were 2 issues (1 and 2) and for those of you that backed that campaign, those same 2 issues are reprinted in this volume, although of course now in color. At that time, my intention was to print all the issues singly, but when that didn't work out I reevaluated my idea and decided that a color trade paperback would be the way to go. 
To be clear, there will be 2 books I'm making available here. The first book will be the trade paperback. It will be 210 pages and will combine the first 7 issues of The Box City Wallops in one volume. 
Cover image for the BCW trade paperback.
The second book presented here will be a 48 page bonus story- The Happiness Creature. Also color, this bonus comic will be available with 5 covers created exclusively for this project and offered only here. Please be aware here that I consider my cover the main cover and in addition to that there will also be the 4 variants- total 5. 
My cover for the 48 page solo color comic.
Shawn McManus's variant cover for the solo book- awesome!
The beautiful and sexy Nola Root is figured prominently on Mike Dooney's variant cover- wow!
The amazing Kevin Eastman contributed this dark and striking variant cover. Colors by Steve Lavigne.
Last but not Least, the super-talented Ben Bishop contributed this cheery and upbeat cover image of the Wallops enjoying the company of the Happiness Creature.
4 randomly selected pages from the solo 48 page issue offered with this Kickstarter- THE HAPPINESS CREATURE. Colors by Dmitry Bobrovnik.
Original Art Rewards
Original art 01: Box City Wallops group shot. The drawing measures 12w x 11h inches.
Original art 02: Wallops jumping group shot. The image measures 14w x 17h inches.
Original art 03: This image was the original to BCW number 1. It was printed (along with issue 2) in a previous Kickstarter. The art measures 13w x 16h inches.
Original art 04: This was going to be the cover for this campaign's solo issue- The Happiness Creature. Obviously, I changed my mind and went with something else. It measures 11w x 15.5h inches.
Original art 05: This was going to be a cover- like an Ultimate cover. I change my mind often when I do covers, and that was the case here. The image measures 17w x 11.25h inches.
Original art 06: Once again, a cover that was not used. Still, a cool drawing showing the Wallops in action. Please know that this is drawn on 2 separate sheets and is not one continuous image (note the line). The art is 10w x. 15h inches (x2).
Original art 07: I don't recall what I did this for other than the fun of drawing my characters. The image measures 17w x 14h inches.
Original art 08: Another wacky drawing, but this one's got a motorcycle in it so it makes it extra cool IMO. The art measures 17w x 14h inches.
Original art 09: I love this image- I don't know quite why but sometimes when you finish a drawing it speaks to you in a special way, and this one does for me. It is also the cover image for the trade paperback offered here. I'm gonna price it crazy for those reasons. It measures 10.5w x 15.5h inches.
 As is my usual practice when I do a Kickstarter, the art is all done. The files for the colored pages have just been sent to me a few days ago and they are awesome, so that part is done as well. There should be no long delays waiting for the hard work to be finished- only the period it takes to wrap up the pre-production and the time to actually get it printed. In my hope that the campaign will be successful, I've begun designing the interiors of the book and trying to get all my ducks in a row. Again, if you decide to help fund this project, please know that it won't be a long wait between the close of the campaign and when I can get books in people's hands. 
Comics are the most perfect form of storytelling- combining words and sequential art. They are not just for nerds and geeks and kids. They are totally legit and I'm an extremely lucky person to have worked in this field for so long. Thanks for checking out my campaign and I appreciate your support.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my sixth Kickstarter campaign. I'm a little different than some folks running Kickstarters, in that I always already have the work done and everything basically ready to go, once the campaign is over. This time is no different, other than some of the pre-production stuff and formatting the pages for the printer. This also means that, if the project is successful and meets its funding goal, books will be in the backer's hands in a few short months. Back with confidence!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
