campaign.story:
*** We've funded many stretch goals. Check this latest update for a recap: http://kck.st/2suppWE AND this last minute one http://kck.st/2sn9zhU***
Missed our Kickstarter? Visit our store to see all of what we have to offer. Items funded in this Kickstarter will eventually make their way there. :)
Welcome to Ménage à 3’s third Kickstarter!
After funding volume 6 & 7 with two previous Kickstarters, we decided to use it again to fund volume 8, and make previous volumes ALSO available! Ménage à 3 is self-published under the brand name Pixie Trix Comix, a name used for all projects linked in some form or another to Gisèle Lagacé (me!). I collaborate with many talented folks, whom you can read about in the "about" section of the Pixie Trix Comix website. My personal Kickstarter account for projects backed and whatnot is here.

SOCIAL MEDIA
Pixie Trix Comix: Facebook / Twitter
Gisele Lagace: Facebook / Twitter
What is Ménage à 3?
Ménage à 3 is a long-form online comic strip co-written by Gisèle Lagacé (me) and David Lumsdon, and drawn by me. It's a sexy, HBO-style romantic comedy set in Montreal. It follows the lives of Gary, a shy 30-year-old comic-book geek, and his way-sexier-than-he-is roommates—adventurous punk rock chick (and bisexual) Zii, and DiDi, a sweet, naïve woman with amazon-like strength. Once Zii becomes Gary’s “wing-girl,” all three of them are set to have wild adventures with a lot of sex appeal, a lot of laughs, and a little bit of heart.  
Ménage à 3, Volume 8, collects the 8th year of the webcomic. Strips included are #1051 (July 21, 2015) to #1200 (July 30, 2016). The book, like all our volumes, will also include a 5-to-6 page, print-exclusive bonus story. This year, our bonus story will be a fun Barbarella-like story (you know, that film with Jane Fonda?) featuring most of the cast of Ma3. Imagine this story coming from the mind of Yuki. She's the warrior princess, who fights evil alongside her squadron of sexy girls (Zii, DiDi, Peggy, etc.) Who's the villain of this story? Sonya, of course! Who needs saving? Prince Gary, of course! Yuki has this story all planned out!

As some of you may know, we've had to restrain our art choices of late online due to advertisers not wanting us to show nudity (read: the female nipple!) With that said, we plan to fix that for the printed volume (and PDF.) I'll go in and tweak a few pages where I feel we would've normally not hidden nudity (read: the female nipple!) ;)

Here are sample comic strips found in volume 8 of Ménage à 3. Note: Strips are printed 1st half on top of 2nd half in the books.
Hold on a second...
There's more than just Ménage à 3?
As we've done in the past, we're taking this opportunity to fund the printing of more books part of the Pixie Trix Comix stable. Alongside Ménage à 3 volume 8, we are trying to raise funds to print volume 2 of Sandra On The Rocks and volume 2 of  Dangerously Chloe. Past volumes of those two series are also available in this Kickstarter. Here's some background on those...
Sandra On The Rocks is a spin-off of Ménage à 3, and is written by David Lumsdon with art by Saiful Remy Mokhtar (also known as Eisu.) It follows the life of Sandra, a struggling model’s assistant who gets a massive promotion when famous photographer Domenico decides to make her the new freckled face for his modeling agency. But Sandra has to adapt fast to Paris and the big time. Domenico’s assistant Tatiana has her on a leash (although she’d rather whip Domenico with it), and veteran model Zoé tells her to quit when she walks in the door! Can she last even a week at this job? Well... the hot baker next door might make it easier.
Here are sample comic strips found in volume 2 of Sandra On The Rocks. Note: Strips are printed 1st half on top of 2nd half in the books.
  Dangerously Chloe is a spin-off of Eerie Cuties, and is written by David Lumsdon and currently drawn by Jason Waltrip. It follows Chloe, who now attends a succubi-only school in Hell itself! She’s brought back to earth after Teddy, a geeky high school kid, mistakenly makes a pact with an ancient statue that should doom his soul to Hell. But Chloe's found a loophole: she can save him if she helps him fall in love fast. Will she succeed, and what will her teachers from Hell think of this?

Here are sample pages found in volume 2 of Dangerously Chloe:
THE GOAL
Our first goal is $39,600CAD (approx $29,340US). If we raise this amount, we plan to:
-> Print 2000-2500 copies of Ménage à 3 vol. 8 (176 pgs / 5" x 7.5")
-> Print 1000-1250 copies of Sandra On The Rocks vol. 2 (168 pgs / 5" x 7.5")
-> Print 1000-1250 copies of Dangerously Chloe vol. 2 (208 pgs / 5" x 7.125")
-> Print each book's respective card set
  (4 cards per book x 1000 approx each = roughly 12,000 card total)
-> Print each book's respective poster at roughly 800 copies each
  (3 x 800 = 2400 total)
-> Leftover money will be used to buy all the necessary packaging material, labor cost (handling,) AND shipping cost to mail the rewards.

We're asking for more than last time as we realized with our previous Kickstarters that we didn't ask for enough for everything we were trying to fund. Let's just say we ate our shirt! Twice!
We plan to print the books early July 2017 to have them in hand later that month. We'll then personally sign them, and start shipping as soon as we can (late July/early August of 2017.) Depending on the number of backers, shipping could take a month or two, but rest assured, we will deliver. :)
We'd like to bring your attention to the Canadian currency used for this Kickstarter. US residents should see the amounts in US dollars, but everyone else should see them in CAD dollars. I put in brackets what the amount roughly converts to in US dollars in case it helps you estimate it, but to be safe, please convert your total using this currency converter website.
We ship everywhere in the world! When you select a reward, shipping cost will be added for the location you’re in. The shipping cost added is included in the goal amount, so it all adds up! Since we know some backers will be new to Pixie Trix Comix, all our books will be available in this Kickstarter. Just choose the proper reward if you want more than 1 book.
PLEDGES
Normally, I'd create a graphic for every pledge we offer here, but since there are SO MANY, I've decided to simplify things for myself, and hopefully this will help you choose which pledge is right for you...
WANT ADDED STUFF? YOU CAN DO IT BY INCREASING YOUR PLEDGE.
Since we know many of you wait for our yearly Kickstarter to get some of the stuff found in our store, we're allowing you to get select items from our store via pledge increases. Since Kickstarter can't calculate the extra shipping cost these added items would incur, we've included the shipping cost to each item in the list below. What this means is that when you select a pledge, a shipping cost will be added, but that's only for that pledge in question, and the items in that pledge. If you want to customize your pledge by adding stuff, you have to increase the amount of your pledge by the amount needed for the item(s) you want. At the end of the Kickstarter, you will get a survey in which you'll let us all the stuff you've added. Make sure you've noted everything down as all you're doing for now is increasing your pledge to get what you want.
Here's a visual aid link (from our previous Kickstarter) to adding items: http://kck.st/1NZcnDT
Here's our list of stuff you can get via pledge increases
These prices include shipping to anywhere in the world. I won't be providing a graphic this year to show all items available. Please right-click our store link to either open a new tab or new window to preview all items. Again, some items aren't on this list as we have limited supplies. Also note that the items in our store are listed in US dollars without shipping added to the amount. We've tried to match these prices in CAD dollars (but, of course, we had to include shipping in this list below as Kickstarter won't let us increase the shipping cost on pledges when add-ons are added.) Rest assured that whether you're buying from our store or getting them here through the Kickstarter, you're paying about the same in the end.
PRINTED BOOKS
(with the exception of Penny & Aggie, and Cool Cat Studio)
-> For a Regular book increase by $20CAD each (approx $15US)
-> For a Collector's Edition book increase by $26CAD each (approx $19US)
-> For a Gold Edition book increase by $36CAD each (approx $27US)
Collector's and Gold Editions are only available for the 3 books we are trying to fund with this Kickstarter. If you want the postcards from past books, choose...
-> For a Postcard Edition book increase by $23CAD each (approx $17US)

Penny & Aggie & Cool Cat Studio are thicker books with more pages so...
-> For a Penny & Aggie or Cool Cat Studio book increase by $24 CAD each ($18USD)
Ménage à Zombies one shot
-> To get a physical copy of this comic, increase your pledge by $14CAD (approx. $10.50US) (Early Fall release/will ship separately)

HIGH RES PDF BOOKS (includes P&A and CCS)
-> For a PDF book increase by $7CAD each (approx $5US)
-> For Ménage à Zombies one shot increase by $3CAD (approx $2.25US)
-> For Exorsisters issue #1 increase by $3CAD (approx $2.25US)
SWAG
-> For any poster increase by $20CAD each (approx $14.75US)
NOTE: At survey time, mention which poster(s) you want, and if it's uncensored or censored (when available of course)
-> For the fridge magnets increase by $22CAD (approx $16.25US)
-> For the DiDi floaty pen increase by $15CAD (approx $11US)
-> For the guitar picks increase by $7CAD (approx $5USD)
-> For the Ma3 Cast lanyard increase by $10 CAD (approx $7.40 USD)
-> For the Zii figurine increase by $100CAD (approx $75US)
-> For the DiDi figurine increase by $100CAD (approx $75US)
-> For the Chloe figurine increase by $100CAD (approx $75US)
-> For the Gary plushy increase by $28 CAD (approx $20US)
-> For the buttons set (3) increase by $10CAD (approx $7.40US)
-> For the Pixie Trix tote bag increase by $30CAD (approx $22US)
-> For the 1.25" custom offset lapel pin of Zii & Lita increase by $10CAD (approx $7.40US) NOTE: If you have no physical rewards being sent to you, and all you get is the pin, please increase by $15CAD ($11US)
-> For the DiDi on one side and Zii on the other body pillow case, increase by $80CAD (approx. 60US)
-> For wallpapers of various sizes and resolution of the uncensored images created for this Kickstarter increase by $13CAD (approx $10US)
STRETCH GOALS
FUNDED STRETCH GOAL: $45,000CAD (approx $33,264US)
Everyone who's pledged for a physical reward will get a FREE DiDi bookmark! The image used on the bookmark is also being reused to create a 11"x17" poster which is available as an add-on. This poster is available uncensored as well (not the bookmark.) At survey time, you can tell us which version you want (censored or uncensored.) Increase your pledge by $20CAD (approx 14.75US) to get this poster. A 1.25" custom offset lapel pin of Zii & Lita is also available as an add-on. Increase your pledge by $10CAD (7.40US) to get it. Again, at the end of the campaign, we will send out a survey in which you'll indicate if you've increased your pledge to get some of these items.
FUNDED STRETCH GOAL: $50,000CAD (approx $36,945US)
Everyone who's pledged for a physical reward will get a FREE Sonya/Yuki/Kiley heart sticker! A sexy Sonya 11"x17" color poster is also now available as an add-on (censored or uncensored / at survey time, you can tell us which version you want.) To get this poster, increase your pledge by $20CAD (approx 14.75US)
FUNDED STRETCH GOAL: $55,000CAD (approx $40,785US) A 20"x59" body pillow case (100% polyester/silky feel) of DiDi on one side and Zii on the other is now available as an add-on. Final art will be in full color. To get this body pillow, increase your pledge amount by $80CAD (approx. $60US). A 11"x17" print of DiDi and Zii (side by side) is also available for a pledge increase of $20CAD (approx $14.75US) Wallpapers of various sizes and resolution of the uncensored images created for this Kickstarter are available as an add-on for $13CAD (approx $10US). Backers who will have already backed for extra posters or body pillow case will have access to these at no cost.
FUNDED STRETCH GOAL: $73,000CAD (approx. $54,260US) We're producing a 6" Chloe figurine based off the Chloe poster from our last Kickstarter! As we've done with our previous figurines, we'll use Gensen to produce it. We've been very pleased with the results up to now, and we know they'll do something real nice. Add-on cost (by pledge increase) is be the same as our previous ones ($100CAD / approx.$75US / shipping included.) We also created a reward for those wanting to pledge for the figurine only ($80CAD+$20CAD shipping.) Based on how long it took us to make the previous ones, she should be ready to ship (separately from the books, etc) in November 2017.
FUNDED STRETCH GOAL: $84,000CAD (approx. $63,543US) We're creating a Ménage à Zombies one-shot! We're gonna find out who kicks the most zombie butts! (Yuki's probably kicking something else ;) ) To get this digital one shot, increase your pledge by $3CAD (approx. $2.25US) Early Fall release.
FUNDED STRETCH GOAL: $95,000CAD (approx. $71,880US) Thank you for giving us the means to start this new project. Ian Boothby and I, and the whole creative team, can't wait to bring this new series to life. Behind the scenes will be available as Kickstarter updates to all backers, but if you'd like a high res digital copy of issue 1 once we have it complete (I'm aiming for a late August/early September release) increase your pledge by $3CAD (approx. $2.25US). Printing plans are still in the works (as we're thinking a more traditional route might be best for this project,) but you'll be in on the ground floor of this brand new series that we're all very excited to bring to you.
FUNDED STRETCH GOAL: $97,500CAD (approx. $73,743US) Our Ménage à Zombies one shot goes to print! To get a physical copy of this comic, increase your pledge by $14CAD (approx. $10.50US) and we'll ship it to you once it's printed early Fall. This pledge amount increase includes shipping to anywhere in the world. Remember, if you want the high res PDF of the issue, increase by another $3CAD (approx. $2.25US).
FUNDED STRETCH GOAL: $100,000CAD (approx. $75,320US) Everyone who's pledged for a physical reward or increased their pledge to get physical items shipped to them will receive this sticker for free! =^.^=
If we get past 105K CAD, I'll more than likely throw in a free secret surprise to all physical pledges (including PDF pledge backers who increased their pledge to get physical items.) Not sure what yet, but I'll think of something. Same for if it goes past 110K CAD. In this case, it might just be added pages to a story, but I'll see where the money might be better spent, and what I think you might enjoy the most.
Thank you again so much everyone for making this Kickstarter a success. We couldn't do it without you. Seriously. Love you, guys & gals--Gisèle :)
* * *
To all our faithful readers and supporters, thank you SO MUCH for these last 8+ years. We couldn't have done it without your support, and it's a true pleasure creating these strips for you. I'd like to also take this opportunity to let you know Sticky Dilly Buns will return this Summer, and once the Eerie Cuties website is back up & running (we've had issues after a server move,) we'll be posting 3 short stories we were to run but didn't get a chance yet.--Gisèle & The Pixie Trix Team
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Pixie Trix Comix is no stranger to making books. If all 3 books are funded in this Kickstarter, we will have 23 books in print. Pages are done, covers and postcards are being finished & colored. Shipping will start late July/early August 2017.

Pixie Trix is not responsible for import/duty fees your home country may charge. (We haven't had any reports from buyers so far, but we can't assure you 100% that it won't happen.)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Broderick is an original crime noir story done as a comic book. Jack Broderick is a violent member of the 1940’s Chicago underworld who is out for revenge after the Chicago crime syndicate tries to bump him off. It is planned to be a four issue run with the option of continuing the story in future 4-12 issue series.
Jack Broderick: Our Protagonist
The Story
Jack Broderick wakes up to find himself abandoned and alone. Head pounding from the drugs and beatings it took to get Jack all the way from Chicago to New Mexico, the phone suddenly rings. Jack answers it to find his partner in crime Nicky on the other end of the line. Nicky explains to Jack that the organization has gotten tired of Jack’s careless and overly violent way of doing things, and has decided to send him off with a bang. All Jack can do is run to the front door and watch as the bomb explodes in the distance and wait for his fate.
Jack wakes up, weak and riddled with radiation poisoning, in the army base hospital southeast of Socorro, New Mexico. With not much time left to live, and a score to settle, Jack heads back to the windy city to find the rats that did this to him and save what pieces are left of himself in the process.
Who Will Enjoy Broderick?
Fans of:
Frank Miller’s Sin City
Brian Azzarello's 100 Bullets
Richard Stark’s Parker done by Darwyn Cooke
Broderick is intended for a PG-13+ audience.
Tempted? Check out our 4 Page Preview Issue HERE!
Broderick Preview!
  Broderick Page 1
  Broderick Page 2
  Broderick Page 3
  Broderick Page 4
The Creative Team
Jay and Ron have been working on comic books since they were teenagers. Their career began while hanging out at the local comic shop and buying whatever new releases their allowance could afford. Jay was always an aspiring artist and Ron has always wanted to be a famous writer. The first story and character they ever came up with was called Afterburner. Jay drew him in different poses and Ron made up stories about his adventures in fighting crime. They even went as far as making sweatshirts with an embroidered caricature of Afterburner and wore them around their high school like the nerds they were, and still are today.
What makes Jay and Ron's work special? Well, their stories and commitment to bringing the best possible product they can to their fans. They were first published in the late 90’s with a story called "The Prophecy". In order to get that story published Jay and Ron submitted an idea with a finished script and some rough pages to a local comic publisher called Panther Comics. There was a voting period in which people could get on the website and vote for their favorite comic. In a pure surprise to Jay and Ron, they WON! It was the happiest day of their young lives and the comic book was on store shelves around Colorado.
Now, a decade and a half later, the boys are finally back with an all new story that they are super proud of and can’t wait to tell. With the help of Tony, one of the most talented up-and-coming colorists, they finally get a new story into your hands!
Why Are We Using Kickstarter?
We talked for months about what the best way to release Broderick to our fans was and, in the end, we decided on using Kickstarter. It all came down to how much we love being in our booth at conventions and getting to interface with people. It is our profound pleasure getting to meet the people who enjoy our work and hearing what we did well and what we can do to make it better. Without all of you, our artistic careers would have ended a long long time ago. Therefore, it only makes sense that we involve our fans and supporters to make this book with us.
Stretch Goals
Keep an eye here as the Kickstarter Progresses!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In our effort to be as communicative as possible, we first apologize for all the updates that will be coming your way! When the campaign closes, we will have a good portion of the drawing done (and we will share the progress with you along the way), as well as the main poster rewards: Which you will see as they are completed as well. 

We are very excited for you to share our vision and our story, so we will make sure you are a big part of our community through TOO many emails, TOO many updates, and FAR TOO MANY social media posts!!

Welcome to the Squirt Gun Studios comic book community!! 
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Comic Fans!
This is going to be our final update for Broderick Issue 1. Thank you to everyone who pledged and made this happen, we reappy appreciate your support! The Issue 2 Kickstarter is going well but we could still use a little more support before the end of the campaign. Please, if you have not yet, go on over to the other project here:  BRODERICK ISSUE 2 KICKSTARTER and pledge your support! You don't want to miss out on issue two of this amazing story.

Yesterday, we got the thumbnails for Tom Lyle's cover to the Kickstarter Exclusive edition of Broderick Issue 2.  I wanted to share the process with you as it gets completed.  It will also show you some of the process that goes into making comics, in general.  The art process starts with thumbnails.  We got two options.  We have made our decision, but you don't get to know what we have chosen until it's finished!!!
Let us know what you think, and pledge to our second issue!  Thank you!!

Hello Comic Fans!
The Kickstarter for our very popular (thanks to all of you) comic about Jack Broderick and his quest for revenge/redemption is LIVE!
Please go here:  BRODERICK ISSUE #2 KICKSTARTER to pledge and show your support.
We couldn't have made the first one such a succcess without all of you, and now we are hoping for your support again to continue bringing people this amazing story.

updates.update_userinfo: Broderick Issue #2 Official Kickstarter Launch Date
updates.update_content:
Hello Comic Fans!
Jay and I are excited to announce the launch of the Kickstarter for Broderick Issue #2!
That's right! You heard it here first; the new issue of your favorite gangster story will be out this year.

Hello Comic Fans!
Wow, it is so nice to be sending you all a message again!
You haven't heard from us in a while, but rest assured that work continues at a furious pace. Work on what you ask? Well, that is what this message is for. The first teaser for Broderick Issue #2!

Hello Comic Fans!
Today I went to the post office and shipped a stack of envelopes as tall as I am! Took them a couple of hours to work through all of those addresses but I can officially say that if we are not hand delivering your product, it is now in the mail and on its way to you! Most of you will get your schwag within the next week but our international people may have to wait two to three weeks.

Hello Comic Fans!
Well, Denver Comic Con is in the history books for another year and it was amazing! It was great seeing some of you and getting the comic into your hands. For those that could not make it, fear not, your stuff will be on its way shortly. I am waiting for the shipping envelopes to be delivered and then it will all go out in a big wave.  I will send another update when the big ship happens.

updates.update_userinfo: Proof is in the... oh, you get the joke
updates.update_content:
Hello Comic Fans!
We have the proof! We are checking it twice and making sure the printer was not naughty. Here is a picture of the inside of Jay’s car. Oh, and there might be a comic there as well.

Hello Comic Fans!
If you don't have "The Final Countdown" stuck in your head then that title didn't do it's job. Anyway, I am pleased to announce that pencils and inks for this comic have been completed! That's right, all we have now is to get the colors back from Tony and then letter and print this beast.
It is a pretty exciting time as we gear up for Denver Comic Con this year. We are hard at work on tweaks and updates for the booth as well as getting all of our product ready. Because of all this work we have decided that today will be the final "image" update. From now on I'll still keep you guys updated on where the process is but I might not post any more teaser images until we have the final book in hand.

Hello Comic Fans!
Hope all of you are having a great beginning of your week. This week, we have for you the final backer panel post.  Thanks to all of our big contributors for allowing us to put your extremely attractive faces in our comic. 
We are getting real close now. Only a couple of pages left for pencils and inks and then the colors!

campaign.story:
WEST of OZ is a comic book retelling of the L. Frank Baum's 1900 classic children's novel 'The Wonderful Wizard of OZ', with a wild west twist.
The Gale farm, Kansas
The year is 1868, and Dorothy Gale is lost in the weird and wild land of OZ. After being torn away from her family's Kansas farm by a mysterious storm, Dorothy is alone and lost in a strange land. She has to make her way along the old 'Golden Rail' to Emerald City, where she can collect the Wizard's bounty on a Wicked Witch and try to find her way home.
"The Wizard is said to be great and powerful, and he has offered a reward for the witch."
Along the way, she will cross paths with the familiar characters we all love from the original story. Issue #1 features; The Scarecrow, The Munchkins, and The Witch of the East!
The peaceful skyline of Munchkin Pueblo
Issue #1 of 9 tells the story of how Dorothy came to arrive in OZ, how she met the Scarecrow, and why they set out on the path to Emerald City.
        amazing portraits by Cat Luong
  Cover for WEST of OZ Issue #1
   WEST of OZ  -  Issue #1 of 9
The goal of this project is to create a standard 30-page full-color comic book.
This includes 22 pages of story art, 4 pages for Covers, and 4 pages that will include dedications, full title credits, and the Special Thanks section.
Original artwork by Nick Winand for WEST of OZ
All of the artwork is already 100% complete. The Colorist is toiling away at her desk on the last few pages as we speak. The lettering will be the last part of production before print, and is set to begin when the Kickstarter reaches its goal!

UPDATE: Here is a look at a few fully Colored and Lettered pages!
 
This is the first in a 9-issue comic book series. Stretch Goals and additional money will go toward funding additional issues of the comic!
WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO
Now that you have heard about the project lets talk about the money. 
Cost Projection for $2000 Goal
Target Goal! $2,000
We are asking for a minimum of $2,000 USD to complete this project. This amount will go directly toward paying

Colorist: $ 450
Letterer: $ 250
Cover Art: $ 200

The remainder will be used to pay for the cost of Printing, Kickstarter Reward Fulfillment, Kickstarter-related fees, and any remaining S&H fees, in that order.

If we reach the $2,000 goal, we will be able to make a great comic and get it out to the world to see!
  Break Even! $5000The largest Stretch Goal for the project is really the goal of any artistic project: to Break Even!

If we reach $5,000, we will have made enough to pay the creators! The creation of WEST of OZ was an artistic labor of love, and it was written, story-boarded, rewritten, drawn, and inked by Co-Creators Nick Winand and Sean Benner over a year-long period.
Artist: $2,200
Writer: $950

"What this Goal really means to us is that we get to follow the dream of making comics for a living. To be able to not only share our stories and art with everyone but to get paid for it would be a dream come true."
Cost Projection for $5000 Stretch Goal
  The Story Continues! $10,000
A dream come true! With this level of funding, we would be able to not only finish Issue #1 of WEST of OZ, but we can begin funding production of Issue #2!

When we created WEST of OZ, we created storyboards and script outlines for all 9 issues of the Series. These other issues already exist in the roughest form, and all that we need to make them as real as WEST of OZ #1 is the additional money to pay Creative talent. 

With a total Creative Cost of roughly $4,000 before taxes to develop and produce an issue, $10,000 would secure the backing we need to continue the WEST of OZ story for another installment!
If we are extremely successful, every $5,00 after the $10,000 mark will contribute toward the Creative Cost of making another issue of the 9-part Series!
With $10,000, we can show you what happens when Dorothy and Scarecrows journey into the haunted wood!
At $20,000, we could get the entire OZ gang together and steaming their way along the Golden Rail toward Emerald City!
It will cost a total of $45,000 to tell the entire 9-issue story of the WEST of OZ saga.
When we have created all 9 Issues, we hope to seek funding for the creation of a 220-page Hardcover Collectors Edition that contains all 9 Issues of the comic, the cover art, and exclusive concept art and script excerpts.



Here are some pages from a previous comic that Writer Sean Benner and Artist Nick Winand worked on together; 
"Imperial Laundry and Monster Hunting" from a Weird West anthology
  "Imperial Laundry and Monster Hunting" from a Weird West anthology
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The bulk of production is complete, and all that remains is to polish and package it into the best comic possible. There is nearly no risk the book will not be produced if we meet our goal. 

We will maintain regular communication about project goals and deadlines with Backers and keep them up-to-date through Kickstarter with Weekly Updates for the length of the Campaign, and regular updates until completion.

The only real danger is a delay related to shipping or printing, which would set the fulfillment timeline back slightly, but would not cause the project to fail.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Amazing Joy Buzzards are a rock and roll adventure band who tour around and solve mysteries much like Scooby Doo. Their manager Dalton Warner works for Creative International Artists (the CIA) and uses the band as a front for his own operations. They also have a Mexican Wrestling genie named El Campeon who lives in a magical amulet and can be summoned in times of need by shouting the words GO EL CAMPEON GO!!!
Pick up Hardcovers of 'Gladstone's School for World Conquerors' 1 & 2 and 'The New Brighton Archeological Society' 1 & 2 and fund the coloring and lettering costs for 'The Amazing Joy Buzzards and the Tunisian Lava Squirrel' issue #2.     
Gladstone's School for World Conquerors is an All-Ages series about a School for the Children of Supervillains where they go to learn the craft. You can own two beautiful Hardcover books for $40 including shipping. Gladstone's is written by myself and do-created by Artist Armand Villavert.
The New Brighton Archeological Society is an All-Ages Fantasy Series by myself and artist Matthew Weldon. You can own two beautiful Hardcover books for $40 including shipping. 
PICK UP THESE BEAUTIFUL HARDCOVERS AND SUPPORT THE CREATION OF THE AMAZING JOY BUZZARDS!!! (If you pick up the physical books you get issues 1 and 2 as PDFs as well.)
  THE AMAZING JOY BUZZARDS
    The Amazing Joy Buzzards are a rock and roll adventure band who tour around and solve mysteries much like Scooby Doo.  Their manager Dalton Warner works for Creative International Artists (the CIA) and uses the band as a front for his own operations.  They also have a Mexican Wrestling genie named El Campeon who lives in a magical amulet and can be summoned in times of need by shouting the words GO EL CAMPEON GO!!!
The world's greatest rock 'n roll adventure band are back in this digital single issue series, with girl-magnet Biff on guitar and vocals, tough guy Stevo on bass, and four-eyed genius Gabe on drums - not to mention their mythical Mexican wrestler genie, El Campeon - the Amazing Joy Buzzards hop from one fast-paced adventure to the next! 
The Amazing Joy Buzzards were created by Dan Hipp and Mark Smith in 2004. With the contract between Dan and I we both can create Joy Buzzards stories on our own. Dan Hipp is not involved in this Kickstarter. The Amazing Joy Buzzards is a great series and one I'm proud of and would like to see continue with other creative teams and side adventures to bring it back in a way that I could read and enjoy as a fan. After this 'Lost Volume' concludes I have plans to bring the Amazing Joy Buzzards back in a big way every year and complete the story. 
Unlike the first series, this LOST VOLUME is in full color. 
The Amazing Joy Buzzards and the Tunisian Lava Squirrel Issue #1 cover.
 This is a 'Lost Book' from the Amazing Joy Buzzards book that I started around 2008 with artist Cristian A. Gonzalez titled 'The Tunisian Lava Squirrel'. Mary Cagle did the colors for the first issue and most of the second issue, Ryan Schrodt is scripting the dialogue, and Patrick Brosseau is lettering. 
We are doing digital single issues on Kickstarter to pay for the rest of the colors and letters for the book. There are 100 pages that are finished for art and 40 pages have been colored. There are about 40-60 pages left for story as far a second artwork but we may bring in a guest artist with a similar style to finish the book if Cristian Gonzalez is unable to finish it. We plan to do digital issues a couple times a year to complete the book.
Anything raised over this amount will go towards the colors on the next book. We're offering digital PDF files of other books and printed copies of Gladstone's School for World Conquerors & The New Brighton Archeological Society Books in Hardcover format to raise funds to finish issue #2.
LETTERED PAGES FROM THE FIRST ISSUE (NOT IN ORDER)
               COLOR PAGES FROM ISSUE 2
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is a low risk Kickstarter. All digital and physical rewards are already created. The coloring for the second issue is finished and all that needs to be done to complete it is the lettering and making a PDF file which should take a maximum of two week's time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Incredible start! The Kid Nefarious one-shot from Gladstone's School for World Conquerors is 24% funded!!!
updates.update_content: We have printed Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Books 1, 2 and 3 in beautiful Hardcover format. If you haven't picked these up yet now is a great time (See the pictures below). We at Gladstone's have one-shots planned for all of the major characters and the first one-shot we're rolling out is the Kid Nefarious one-shot which is now 25% funded. To reach our goal of paying of our creative teams and printing and sending out the book we're trying to reach 12K in the next 3 weeks. We have reached 3K this week or 25% of our goal.  The one-shots are done by guest creative teams and we hope to do more in the future.

Wanted to share an update about Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Book 3 to tell you that it's nearly funded. We are so close to achieving ultimate victory. If you can please share the project on Twitter and Facebook so that we can make our goal. With 12 days remaining, I feel very confident that we'll make it. Thank you everyone for all of your encouragement and support.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/manekinekobooks/gladstones-school-for-world-conquerors-3

updates.update_userinfo: Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Book 3 NOW on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Gladstone's School for World Conquerors 3 continues the critically acclaimed young adult graphic novel series created by Armand Villavert and Mark Andrew Smith. Book 3 is lettered by Patrick Brosseau and colored by Jessie Lam.
Gladstone's is about a school where the children of the world's greatest supervillains go to learn the family business.
Book 3 follows our band of Villains on their Cosmic Quest as they come across Scorpio Kane and his band of mercenary villains. On this adventure they're joined by new recruits 'the Speed Specter' and 'Man O' War.'

updates.update_userinfo: The Amazing Joy Buzzards and the Curse of the Tunisian Lava Squirrel # 2 files delivered!!!
updates.update_content: I delivered the files for The Amazing Joy Buzzards and the Tunisian Lava Squirrel # 2 today and check your Kickstarter inbox for the download links. I'm also going to send the files via e-mail this week to backers as well because some people may not check Kickstarter messages or could be having a busy weekend so a reminder and a little nudge is always nice.  This issue took a little longer because I had Cristian Gonzalez who is the artist for this Amazing Joy Buzzards story do a new original cover for the digital issue. He finished it this week and it was a nice touch to the digital issue.

Wanted to give a huge THANK YOU to everyone who supported to make the Amazing Joy Buzzards 2 possible. This book has been a passion project of mine since 2007 and finishing it and doing more Amazing Joy Buzzards is something that has always been important to me. 
I know that smaller Kickstarters like these are often just as challenging as doing really big Kickstarter projects, but for me the process and the stages of doing books is important and taking care of things like coloring and lettering. All stories can be writer's children and while the Amazing Joy Buzzards were never popular, never made money for Dan the original artist to do more of, and never reached the big screen and sold for millions, continuing to do projects we love and are passionate about is just as important as working on more popular projects.

campaign.story:
Kitty Strikes a Hollywood Pose!
Kitty Ravencraft, the beautiful magical witch and star of her own comic book, returns! This time Kitty is on top of the World! Her new comic book series is a huge success and she's once again the talk of the comic shops! Naturally, Kitty's publisher wants to capitalize on her new-found popularity with a big budget blockbuster Kitty movie! To make this happen, Kitty goes off to Hollywood, but once again she finds herself in danger! Someone is out to kill Kitty and this time even the reader won't know who's doing it or why! A lot of Kitty's old crowd from Die Kitty Die like Little Satan, Maxi Millions, and of course everyone's favorite kid corpse, Dippy the Dead Kid will be back. Some will be on Kitty's side and some of course are out to get her! Plus we'll see lots of new faces joining Kitty's cast. She'll face new menaces like the unstoppable Hexecutioner and she'll be aided by new allies like the cult-favorite family of freaks, the Carneys! Die Kitty Die: Hollywood Or Bust will be Kitty's biggest... scariest... and funniest adventure yet! It will be magical. Hopefully she'll survive!
Dan's cover for DIE KITTY DIE: HOLLYWOOD or BUST ! #1
  Fernando's cover for DIE KITTY DIE : HOLLYWOOD OR BUST #1
  The Carneys are our special guest stars ! How did they find their way into Kitty's world......?
  ....it turns out Kitty and Linda/Louise go way back! Who knew?
Right from the beginning, we knew there were more stories to tell about Kitty and her comic book world. After the phenomenal response to our first incredible Kickstarter and the very passionate support we received from our very kind fans, we're back to put together a project that is not only as good as and worthy of our first book but that surpasses it with more action, more adventure, more humor, and more surprises. In the first book, Kitty took on the comic book world and she's not done with them yet. Plus now she's also leaving her mark on Hollywood and the entertainment industry. You know there will be lots of fun and satire along the way! We always have a lot of fun working on Kitty's stories. We hope we can count on our very loyal and generous fans to make this the best ride yet!
Meet Dan and Fernando, your friendly creators!
We hope to follow the basic model of our first book with a four issue storyline that we will initially release as individual PDF issues. As before, each individual issue will feature twenty pages of original story and art plus fashion pages, funny ad pages, pin-ups, variant covers and other added material. We will be handling the bulk of the writing and drawing ourselves but much of this additional material may be completed by some of our talented friends and colleagues in the comic industry. Later, these issues will be collected into one softcover trade paperback and as per our last campaign, our goal is to collect enough funding to be able to make the softcover trade into a hardcover with a dust jacket.
We're Astrocomix!
Once again, we are planning on a number of stretch goals to make this project better and better.  We are hoping to add bonus material such as an additional exclusive story by the popular, talented Gisele Lagace and fashion pages by the awesome J Bone. In addition to these fun objectives, we've gotten really ambitious this time! If other goals are met, we hope to do two additional Kitty special issues such as a Kitty Summer Special and a Kitty Holiday Special. These would be really great additions to this round of Kitty Kickstartering but we can only get there with everyone's help!
Gisele Lagace is on board to do another Kitty story!
  Wanna see more fashion pages by the awesome J. Bone? Of course you do!
  One of our stretch goals will be to fund a KITTY SUMMER SPECIAL!! Let's do it!
  Fernando's Summer Special cover... if we're lucky enough to fund it!!
  Dan's cover to the DIE KITTY DIE CHRISTMAS SPECIAL!
  Fernando's cover for the DIE KITTY DIE CHRISTMAS SPECIAL!
                 YOU CAN ALSO ADD THESE FUN ITEMS TO YOUR PLEDGE. CHECK OUT THE GRAPHIC UNDER THE ADD-ON LIST IF YOU HAVE QUESTIONS ON HOW TO DO SO
                  Our friends at Chapterhouse Comics help to distribute our books!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Since our incredibly successful Kickstarter campaign last year, Die Kitty Die has enjoyed a lot of good luck. The reception to our first Die Kitty Die book has been almost universally positive and Kitty has been picked up by Chapterhouse Comics to be published in single issues and distributed to retailers world wide! 

We'd like to point out to everyone that despite this great good fortune, producing Kitty still falls to us. This is what brings us to Kickstarter. We can't do it alone. As you might imagine producing four complete issues of original story and art takes a lot of manpower and resources. We have our impressively talented team of inkers, letterers, colorists and others that we must hire and pay. We also have other costs such as printing, shipping and many other miscellaneous expenses that we need to cover ourselves. We can't do this without the very generous help of our very kind and loyal fans and supporters. We were deeply appreciative and touched by the phenomenal amount of support we were shown throughout our first campaign and even afterwards. Making an independent creator-owned and driven project like Die Kitty Die has been our dream since long before either of us ever got into this business. We couldn't make that dream happen without your help.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Last Halloween I gave away my zombie comic books,  t-shirts, and posters along with candy and crackers to hundreds of trick or treaters of all ages.   Everyone was extremely grateful.  This upcoming Halloween C.U.D. will be distributing free mini comics to trick or treaters in our neighborhood to promote creator owned comics. Help us encourage children of all ages to read comics. 
REMEMBER COMICS ARE THE GATEWAY BOOK FOR INTELLIGENCE 
We have a dozen contributors involved in this project.  Our Kickstarter goal is set at $500, because we would like to print 1,000 comics to distribute during Halloween.
Comics Underground Distribution: what we're all about:  CUD is like an older brother that doesn't just stare down the bullies, CUD gets in their face.  Some days the bully is Diamond Comics.  Some days the bully is Wizard World.  We have challenged Diamonds government sanctioned distribution monopoly by creating our own catalog.   Together we're shattering the  Diamond monopoly.
King Chan CUD CATALOG COVER
 We pissed off the Wizard by hosting our 1st CUD COMIC CON on the same day as Wizard World in Columbus, directly across the street.  In your F#$king face Wizard.  
Jessalyn Kerr Neel (CUD Harley Quinn)
 This Halloween we are generating brand recognition,  and introducing new readers to all of our comic book contributors.   Your pledges will help print at least 5,000 mini comics,  as well as assist CUD in starring down the bullies.  For this,  we thank you. 
Kickstarter  timeline :  Sept 1st - Oct 2nd kickstarter campaign, Oct 2nd printing begins, by Oct 7th or as soon as printing is completed we will ship out mini comics, mini comics should be recieved by Oct 14th.
Joel Cramer Comics 
A Honzy-ween Story
Joel Cramer is the creator of an all-ages comic book series entitled "Adventures of Honzy and Joel". His stories feature an alternate Earth with animal people as well as humans. The Kragon Detective Agency, led by dragon/human detective duo of Honzy and Joel, protects their city (and often the world) from supervillians, alien threats, evil organizations, and much more. He has been publishing for five years now and has 12 issues available, with a thirteenth one coming soon.
For more information, please visit www.joelcramercomics.com.
Writer/artist: Joel Cramer
Joel Cramer comics
 My Gal, the Zombie created by Dan Conner 
My Gal, the Zombie created by Dan Conner
A secret mini comic from the creator of Wafflecus.....
Wafflecus created by Casey Anderson
 Zombie Overkill Death Squad 
Jump directly into the Zombie action. Kraven has a secret, he loves killing zombies because no matter what you do to them, you don't feel bad about it.
Zombie Overkill Death Squad written and created by King Chan
 Max Hunter created by Alex Lobato 
Hey! So the story is about Vincent Snow, the origins of an assassin from child hood to present day. Illustrator is P.R. Dedelis, and the team that put it all together at Gateway City.
Max Hunter created by Alex Lobato
 Fightin Iris created by Tim Pervious 
Introducing Fightin’ Iris, how the meanest boys in school spent their time. She doesn't quit or back down, even when two mighty Semi-Gods ask her and Liz Byzantine to help find the ominous Medallion of Mortality, the awful "Death Medal"!
Fightin Iris created by Tim Pervious
Liberty: Year Zero created by Travis Vengroff 
It’s been 20 years since the colony world of Atrius lost contact with humanity. Torn between wanting to continue mining operations or abandon the planet, rioting has split the colony's population.
Liberty: Year Zero created by Travis Vengroff
 The Hawk of New York created by Randyl Bishop 
"Doc tries to persuade Eric not to seek revenge and start a war between gangs by telling him the story of the Peace Pipe - a dark and mystical cautionary tale from their shared Indian heritage."
The Hawk of New York created by Randyl Bishop
   Possum at Large created by Chad Lambert,  Art by Joe Gravel 
"Possum At Large takes a trip back to the '80s for a tale of high school tomfoolery."
Possum at Large created by Chad Lambert
 Wind and Fire by Travis Ware 
Wind and Fire by Travis Ware
Early Bird Special / The Zombie Special: Zombie Overkill Death Squad created by King Chan, 28 pg B&W comic with red blood splatter and green x-rays cracking zombie skulls, ZODS t-shirt size large only, and a ZODS dogtag.
Zombie Overkill Death Squad written and created by King Chan
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are outnumbered and outgunned by a massive distribution monopoly. If Diamond is the British Empire, then CUD is the band of revolutionary rebels. We are employing strategic hit and run maneuvers staying one step ahead of the Empire. Everyone else is playing by Diamonds rules and losing badly. We say F@#k the rules. 
I have 6yrs of supervisor experience in shipping & distribution of food & beverages.
I was a Marine Corps Heavy Machinegunner. I'm going to fight in the boardroom, at comic con, and on the internet. I hate to lose and I'm passionate about what i invest my time in. 
We may be a couple of underdogs, but make no mistake, we are Lions. We operate with extreme professionalism, but at the same time we are highly aggressive in promoting creator owned comics. 
CUD doesn't believe in censoring passion & creativity for the corporate approved message. 
CUD is proud to announce our Halloween mini comics: Each bundle pack comes with 25 mini comics for trick or treaters this Halloween. Sized at 5.5 " x 8.5 " with 4 story pages. Our 1st printing quote was at $1.14 for each mini comic, multiply that by 20 comics and you have $22.80 . We have to find a way to print each unit at $0.20 . Then there is no way around the post office cost with stamps at $0.49 each.

Stand with us today by making a pledge, liking & sharing our kickstarter. 

If Diamond warehouse employees ever go on strike, 2000 comic shops will go out of business. Think about it.

Thank you
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hey everyone! Alan here, giving you the low-down on The Burning Metronome, and what we're trying to do with this campaign. Hopefully, you dug our video. It's a good intro to our story, but here's the basics:
WHAT IT IS:
A supernatural murder mystery, told in six 22 page chapters
It will be printed in a 150 page soft-cover book
Written by R. Alan Brooks, featuring pencil and ink art by Dion Harris with coloring and lettering by Matt Strackbein
It's sort of a cross between The Twilight Zone and The Usual Suspects, but here's the synopsis.
WHAT IT’S ABOUT:
Six courageous explorers find themselves trapped in another world, populated by the strangest creatures they've ever seen: human beings.
You can read our 1st issue for FREE, by clicking on this picture below.
             The Creators
So we're pretty excited about it, and I think we've got a cool creative team!
OUR PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE:
Matt is best known for writing and illustrating short stories in Dark Horse Comics' BPRD.
Alan is most notable for writing Spotless, and hosting MotherF**ker In A Cape, the comic book podcast that focuses on marginalized members of geek culture.
Dion's work can be seen in numerous video game designs, book covers and commissions.
Ok, so here's what we need your help with:
OUR GOALS:
TO CREATE A BEAUTIFUL BOOK
PRINT IT
DISTRIBUTE IT
Not the actual book; just a mock-up.
Printing 1000 of these books will cost about $6000. The remaining amount is to cover expenses associated with finishing & distributing the book (artist fees, shipping, taxes, rewards, etc.).
WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU:
Make a pledge
Share this Kickstarter, and encourage your friends to pledge
Enjoy your rewards!
====================================================
Now I'm going to tell you why this book is important to me:
I've been a comic book fan since I was 5. Back then, I'd go to comic cons, and not only would I be the only kid, I'd also be the only Black person. I couldn't even find Star Trek Vulcan ears for Black people (a story I often tell on my podcast)!
In The Burning Metronome, I have an opportunity to tell a fun, moving story that entertains, and I love that. That's kinda the most important part for a reader.
But this story also involves some elements of social commentary, which will hopefully give us all a chance to think about the issues around us. And I chose to tell this story with characters who reflect our world: women, men and people of different ethnicities, who are not defined by their race or sexuality, but are interesting characters simply because of the people they are.
We're seeing more of this in comics, and I'm happy for that. Now Dion, Matt and I want to throw our hats into the ring, to bring you a story that is important to the three of us, and close to our hearts.
I've known and worked with so many artists in the past, whether in music, comics or otherwise, and so few of them have ever finished their projects and put them out into the world. I NEED to see this project brought to life, and I look forward to your partnership with me and my collaborators to do just that.
Thank you so much,
Alan
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our book is already completely written, with about 2/6 of the art completed. So, we just need the time to complete it, and the means to print it.

We have a clearly defined production schedule, and we'll be posting updates as we complete chapters.

We have an option of a local printer, or one overseas. The latter will be less expensive, but involves about $1000 in shipping. So, that may bring its own difficulties, such as delays in shipping, etc. But we'll be certain to keep you all posted if there are any such difficulties.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
WELCOME TO THE DOPE KICKSTARTER!
Trina Robbins is an inspiration to many.  Through her work as an advocate and historian, she has become a positive force of education and enlightenment in the contemporary comics landscape.  But she is also a brilliant storyteller and illustrator (even though she has been unable to draw for several years now), and her body of work is as diverse as it is prolific.  She began as an active member of science fiction fandom in the 1950s, creating illustrations for science fiction fanzines.  In 1969, Robbins designed the costume for Vampirella for Warren Publishing.  Around this time, Robbins left New York for San Francisco, and spent the 1970s becoming an early and influential participant (and one of the few female artists) in what was then the fledgling underground comix movement.  During the early 80s, Robbins created comic book adaptations of Tanith Lee's THE SILVER METAL LOVER, and the story we are attempting to crowdfund with this Kickstarter, Sax Rohmer's DOPE.  She then went on to become the first woman to draw a WONDER WOMAN comic book for DC Comics.  In addition to her comics work, Robbins is the author of several important nonfiction books on the history of women in comics.  Trina Robbins has won an Inkpot Award, and was only the fourth woman to ever be inducted into the Will Eisner Hall of Fame.  There is no denying the impact she has had, and continues to have, in the comic book industry, and beyond!
  If this Kickstarter campaign is successful, we will publish the first ever collection of Trina Robbin's comic book adaptation of Sax Rohmer's sensational 1919 novel DOPE.  The story centers around a talented young actress, who becomes fatally ensnared in London's mysterious and glittery drug culture of the early 20th century. DOPE was both the first novel to speak openly about the world's international drug trade, and the first story to center around the death of a celebrity by drug overdose.  Robbin's comic book adaptation was first published in 1981, serialized within the pages of ECLIPSE MAGAZINE (and later, ECLIPSE MONTHLY).  The story started out in a black and white magazine, and finished up in color comic book.  Since its initial publication, it has never been collected in any form.  With the success of this Kickstarter campaign, we will produce the first ever complete collection of DOPE, in glorious black and white, on glossy 105 lb paper, at 8.25" x 11", the way it was first intended by the creator.  We can't wait to share this beautiful collection with all of you!
We are asking for $10k to produce a 96 page trade paperback graphic novel. A chunk of this money goes towards an advance for the creator. The next chunk goes towards the printing of the book (the book will have a beautiful matte cover, and thick 105lb glossy interior stock). Another large chunk goes to the pre-press artist, who must scan in all the pages from those original copies of ECLIPSE MAGAZINE and ECLIPSE MONTHLY, and clean them up.  They must also remove the colors from those last few chapters, and resize them to fit with the beginning chapters, so that our final product is a seamless 8.25 x 11 sized publication. They will also be helping with the overall design of the book itself.  And...we will need funds to compensate Harvey Award nominated creator and publishing dynamo C. Spike Trotman to write the foreword, and Eisner Award winning creator of A DISTANT SOIL, Colleen Doran, to write the afterword.  As with all our campaigns, we will also be spending a certain amount on the promotion of this Kickstarter campaign itself. In the end, I am confident that for the amount we are asking for will be enough to produce the first ever collection of this incredible story, for your reading pleasure!
For the last two years, I have been busy acquiring, editing and (working closely with production and marketing) bringing over 30 graphic novel reprint collections to market through another American publisher. One of those collections was even nominated for an Eisner award, THE PUMA BLUES by Stephen Murphy and Michael Zulli.
Recently, I decided to leave my position at that publisher, and launch my own publishing imprint...IT'S ALIVE!  I recently finished a successful Kickstarter campaign for RED RANGE by Joe R. Lansdale & Sam Glanzman, making DOPE by Trina Robbins the second book to be published under the IT'S ALIVE! imprint.
Thank you so much for checking out this campaign to publish Trina Robbins' DOPE. For this book to be published, and for my new imprint to continue it's vital mission of saving lost and forgotten comic books and graphic novels, I truly need your support! Please consider pledging, and you can also help us tremendously by telling everyone you know about the exciting stuff we are hoping to accomplish. Let's work together to publish DOPE, and keep the history of comics ALIVE!
  BELOW ARE THE FIVE ORIGINAL PAGES OF DOPE ARTWORK BY TRINA ROBBINS, WHICH ARE AVAILABLE FOR THE "EARLY BIRD SPECIAL" OF ONLY $200 EACH!  THESE WILL ONLY BE AVAILABLE FOR A FEW MORE DAYS, AT WHICH POINT THE PRICE WILL GO UP TO $300 EACH FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE CAMPAIGN.  IF YOU WANT ONE PLEASE ACT QUICKLY!  THANK YOU!
           BELOW ARE SEVERAL PIECES OF ORIGINAL ARTWORK BY TRINA ROBBINS.   IF YOU WANT ONE PLEASE ACT QUICKLY! THANK YOU!

      steve n trina sketch 9" x 12"

updates.update_userinfo: The Kickstarter has launched to publish The Lonely War of Willy Schultz by Will Franz and Sam Glanzman
updates.update_content: Big news...I have launched the Kickstarter campaign to finally complete and collect the war comics masterwork The Lonely War of Willy Schultz by Will Franz and Sam Glanzman. This is considered by many one of the most powerful, moving and even controversial comic book stories ever told! And finally, after all these years, the story will have the ending we've all been waiting for, with the help of acclaimed war comics artist Wayne Vansant. You do NOT want to miss this one! Also, there are some Early Bird Specials still available that you should jump on if you wanna save save a few bucks. But those will only be available for the next week, so jump on those ASAP. Below is the link to the campaign, along with a page from the original story that has been cleaned up for better viewing. Any questions let me know.

updates.update_userinfo: Please help us bring back COMBAT by Sam Glanzman!

updates.update_content: I need your help!  PLEASE take a few moments to visit the below Amazon link, and leave your review of Sax Rohmer's DOPE by Trina Robbins!  If we can get 50 or more reviews, Amazon will promote the book, giving it a better chance to be seen.  Right now we have NO reviews, and we are definitely not getting any attention from Amazon.  So PLEASE leave a review.  You don't have to write a lot, unless you want to.  Even just a sentence or two would be amazing!  Thank you so much for your help.  If you DO leave a review, please post on my Facebook page, or let me know of Twitter, and I will share, retweet, and spread the word!  Thanks again for all your help and support!

Just wanted to share this review of DOPE with all if you.  Enjoy!
LINK: https://comicsworthreading.com/2018/01/08/sax-rohmers-dope/
Best,
Drew Ford

updates.update_userinfo: ONLY 28 hours left to back THE SILVER METAL LOVER by Trina Robbins, Colleen Doran and Gail Simone!
updates.update_content:
Just a quick update to let you know that there are only 28 hours left to join us on this incredible journey to bring back Tanith Lee's THE SILVER METAL LOVER graphic novel by Trina Robbins, with variant cover and afterword by Colleen Doran, foreword by Gail Simone, a special essay by Tanith Lee's husband John Kaiine, and a new introduction by Trina Robbins herself! We hope you'll check out the campaign, and if you like what you see consider making a pledge. Thank you for your time!
Link to SILVER METAL LOVER campaign: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/922494658/tanith-lees-silver-metal-lover-by-trina-robbins

updates.update_userinfo: Only 10 days left to help us fund SILVER METAL LOVER by Trina Robbins!
updates.update_content: Hello Trina Robbins supporters! With only 10 days left in the SILVER METAL LOVER Kickstarter campaign, we still need another $657 to reach our funding goal. If you were planning on backing this project, but the holidays got in the way, now is the perfect time to make a pledge. Also, anyone backing or planning to back this campaign, PLEASE jump on social media and let folks know that you backed this project. Just doing that will definitely encourage more folks to talk a look! Thank you so much to those who already pledged, helping us get to this point. I am so grateful for all your pledges and support. And because we have come so far, it would be a terrible shame to miss out just because of a few hundred bucks. I hope those who haven't pledged yet will agree, and consider becoming a backer, and maybe jumping on social media and spreading the word about this campaign! Thank you so much for your time and consideration. Hope to see your name on the backer list!

Hey everyone! It's been a tough year for my imprint, and I really appreciate everyone's support, patience and understanding, as I work to get my business back on its feet. My cat Lolo and I would like to wish you all a Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays!
Best,
Drew (and Lolo)

HERE...WE...GO!!! We just launched the Kickstarter to publish Tanith Lee's THE SILVER METAL LOVER graphic novel adaptation by Trina Robbins. Cover art and afterword by Colleen Doran, Foreword by Gail Simone, and a new intro by Trina Robbins herself! It has been out of print since it's original publication in 1985! A cult classic science fiction romance, and an important early example of 'the graphic novel' as a storytelling vehicle, THE SILVER METAL LOVER is an intimate story of a young girl's first love...who just happens to be a robot! We are very honored to shine a light on the brilliant work of the late Tanith Lee. And we are thrilled to be working on our second book with the legendary Trina Robbins! Huge THANK YOU to Colleen Doran and Gail Simone for coming along for the ride! We hope you will give it a look, and consider making a pledge. IMPORTANT NOTICE: This graphic novel contains some nudity and adult situations, and is definitely NOT for kids. Thanks for taking a look!

updates.update_userinfo: The first batch of DOPE books are on their way to backers!
updates.update_content: Great news!  Thanks in large part to the funds I have been able to raise through my current GoFundMe page, I was able to purchase enough copies of DOPE to make sure every one who pledged for a copy of DOPE, gets their book!  And between yesterday and today, the first 100 copies of DOPE were shipped out to backers!  So if you pledged for a copy of DOPE, there is a good chance your copy is already on the way to your doorstep!  And don't worry, the shipping continues tomorrow, and the next day, and the next...until all 246 copies are out the door.  I am working to get all copies of DOPE to backers as quickly as possible!

I am sending out this short update to let you all know that the copies of DOPE have been purchased from IDW.  As soon as I have them in my hands I will let you know.  So yes, the good news is that the books will be shipping out soon!  Thank you all so much for your patience and understanding, while I work everything out.  If you have donated to my current GoFundMe, thank you so much.  And if you have yet to donate, and would like to help out, now would be a great time.  Thanks for everything!
Link: https://www.gofundme.com/drew-ford-needs-your-help

project_data.project_name: Sax Rohmer's DOPE adapted and illustrated by Trina Robbins

campaign.story:
Forrest J Ackerman as DR. ACULA, as painted by Sanjulian.
The year 2016 marks what would have been the late Forrest J Ackerman's 100th Birthday. Famous Monsters and its comic book publishing imprint, American Gothic Press (AGP), are celebrating Forry's centennial with an original hardcover anthology called TALES FROM THE ACKER-MANSION, to be released in October at our ALIEN CON event in Silicon Valley, CA!
Forrest J Ackerman is the founding father of the iconic Famous Monsters of Filmland magazine (est. 1958). For many people growing up in the '60s and '70s, Famous Monsters was their only insight into the world of filmmaking and special effects, and the magazine holds a very special place in the heart of many genre filmmakers and storytellers, including the likes of Steven Spielberg, John Carpenter, Tim Burton, James Cameron, Guillermo del Toro, and Stephen King.
 But Forry's legacy extends far beyond the realm of Famous Monsters magazine. Uncle Forry, as many called him, was a compassionate collector of memorabilia, and allowed all manners of people to visit his home and share his love of imagination. He was the very first cosplayer when he wore a Spaceman costume from THINGS TO COME to the 1939 World Science Fiction convention. He encouraged fandom and a love for science fiction by serving as literary agent to many of the genre greats, including Ray Bradbury and L. Ron Hubbard. He's even credited for inventing the term "Sci-Fi".
The first ever cosplay: Forrest Ackerman with Myrtle Jones in 1939.
Through his fostering of fan interaction and genre enthusiasm, Forry became the virtual godfather of current cultural geekery. Your conventions, cosplay clubs, anime news networks, and gaming tournaments all owe something to Forrest J Ackerman.
Above all, Forry appreciated good storytelling and the skills it takes to create good stories, whether that be tacking hair onto a werewolf or staying up past midnight with a pen in your hand. And to that end, we bring you TALES FROM THE ACKER-MANSION, a collection of comic stories and art pieces from contributors around the world that we feel Forry would have been proud of.
Want to know more about Forry? Click to play the short video below! 
PLAY

  Comic books have always been an important part of Famous Monsters' publishing history. When the magazine was launched in 1958, it shared the Warren magazine imprint with two other popular publications: Creepy and Eerie, both of which came to boast iconic black and white comic book tales by the likes of Frank Frazetta, Alex Toth, Wally Wood, Richard Corben, and Bernie Wrightson. In 1969, Forry and Trina Robbins created Vampirella, who remains one of the most enduring comic book characters of all time. Forry was also one of the very first guests at San Diego Comic-Con and encouraged comic book culture throughout his life. So it seems only fitting that a tribute to "Dr. Acula" include both imaginative stories and breathtaking artwork.
Famous Monsters is a big name, but we are a small company. Despite our well-known magazine and iconic logo, we are a boutique operation. Still, we manage to make an enduring magazine, cool comic books, neat merchandise, run film festivals, and now are producing a major convention in October. As we spin several creative plates in the air at the same time, we are always mindful of “Uncle Forry” and the imaginative endeavors he championed. For Forry’s centennial celebration, we thought TALES FROM THE ACKER-MANSION would be a super-cool tribute, but in order to pull it off, we need help! That’s why we are doing FM’s first-ever Kickstarter/crowdfunding effort to cushion the incredible launch costs of such a project (more details at the end under RISKS & CHALLENGES).
*Some may be aware of a previous crowdfunding effort related to the classic Famous Monsters magazine. That was not our company; rather, it was someone else’s passion project which we happily supported.
The magical thing about Forry is that he connected people from all fields and industries — be it film, music, comics, or literature. In the spirit of that connection, we have sought to make TALES FROM THE ACKER-MANSION a truly eclectic offering.
John Carpenter
JOHN CARPENTER is a legendary and award-winning filmmaker, writer, editor, and composer, having helmed such classics as HALLOWEEN, ESCAPE FROM NEW YORK, THE THING, and THEY LIVE. Nearly all of his films are now deemed "cult classics" in the horror and Sci-Fi genres. He also revolutionized the world of film scores with an electronic approach used in pieces like the haunting notes of the HALLOWEEN theme. For TALES FROM THE ACKER-MANSION, John Carpenter channels O. Henry in an original short horror folk-tale, "The Traveler's Tale". It tells the story of an old British traveler who steals a cursed bejeweled box from a Middle Eastern bazaar. Written by the Horror Master himself!
William F. Nolan
WILLIAM F. NOLAN is a prolific and celebrated science fiction writer best known for co-authoring the classic dystopian science fiction novel LOGAN'S RUN with George Clayton Johnson. Nolan is the author of more than 2000 pieces (fiction, nonfiction, articles, and books). Also an artist, Nolan was an integral part of the writing ensemble known as “The Group,” which included Ray Bradbury, Charles Beaumont, John Tomerlin, Richard Matheson, Johnson and others. His contribution for TALES FROM THE ACKER-MANSION is "the story of how Forrest J Ackerman and the robot from Fritz Lang's METROPOLIS became acquainted." 
John 5
JOHN 5 is one of the most in-demand guitarists on the music scene today, having worked with Marylin Manson, Rob Halford, David Lee Roth, and countless others as both a hired gun and permanent bandmate. He currently plays for Rob Zombie on tour and in the studio. John has also produced numerous solo records — one of which, "Careful with that Axe", shares the title of his story for TALES FROM THE ACKER-MANSION, a surreal rockstar fable about a Telecaster guitar that seems to give a young boy special powers.
Richard Christian Matheson
RICHARD CHRISTIAN MATHESON is a celebrated bestselling author and screenwriter/executive producer for television and film. He has worked with Steven Spielberg, Stephen King, Dean Koontz, Roger Corman, Bryan Singer, and many others, and had twelve films produced. Matheson’s critically-hailed short stories appear in his collections SCARS AND OTHER DISTINGUISHING MARKS, #1 bestseller DYSTOPIA, the heralded ZOOPRAXIS, and over 150 major anthologies. He is president of MATHESON ENTERTAINMENT. His short story "Barking Sands" is appearing in TALES FROM THE ACKER-MANSION as illustrated prose.
Dan DiDio
Dan DiDio was named Co-Publisher of DC Entertainment, alongside Jim Lee, in February 2010. As Co-Publisher, DiDio directs and oversees DC’s publishing business under its key three imprints – DC Comics, Vertigo, and MAD – in both print and digital formats, working alongside DCE’s editorial, art and design, production, business development and sales groups. The Co-Publishers also work in concert with DCE’s Creative Affairs and Franchise Management teams to ensure that publishing continues to create content and help drive the media businesses that use comics as their source of inspiration. DiDio has also overseen many of the comic industry’s bestselling titles and events including BLACKEST NIGHT, GREEN LANTERN, IDENTITY CRISIS, ALL STAR SUPERMAN, ALL STAR BATMAN AND ROBIN, SUPERMAN UNCHAINED, and WONDER WOMAN.
Joe R. Lansdale
Well known and loved for his Texas Mojo storytelling style, JOE R. LANSDALE is the author of more than twenty novels and two hundred short works, including The Bottoms and the “Hap and Leonard” series of novels, as well as scripts for both comics and film. Two of his stories, the cult classic “Bubba Ho-Tep” and “Incident On and Off a Mountain Road,” have been adapted for film. He has won the Edgar Award, the British Fantasy Award, the American Mystery Award, the Grinzani Prize for Literature, the International Horror Guild Award, and six Bram Stoker Awards, and in 2007 he was named a Grand Master of Horror. His short story "The Dump" is being adapted for the anthology by MARK ALAN MILLER.
But that only scratches the surface! Also included in this massive hardcover:
An apocalyptic monster truck comic from creator Cullen Bunn (HARROW COUNTY) and artist Drew Moss (TERRIBLE LIZARD)
A painted robot tale from comics writer and artist Ray Fawkes (CONSTANTINE)
A cannibal story in the style of old Creepy and Eerie from HELLRAISER: BESTIARY's Ben Meares and Christian Francis
Stories by FM Editor David Weiner and AGP Editor Holly Interlandi
An unconventional coming-of-age story by reknowned fantasy author Nancy Kilpatrick, illustrated by Drew Rausch (EDWARD SCISSORHANDS)
A Golden Age noir-style romp from Victor Gischler (X-MEN)
A Sci-Fi alien saga by Trevor Goring (WATERLOO SUNSET)
A legend about lethal knitting needles from Travis Williams and Jonathan La Mantia
Art pinups by many Famous Monsters cover artists
And more!
As the stories take form, backers will be updated with art teasers and new developments. There may even be a couple of surprises...
Contributor lineup subject to change.
In the spirit of old black-and-white monster movies, sometimes earnest simplicity is the best way to go. Rather than offer countless trinkets, keychains, mugs, and stuff that might get thrown away, we've decided to focus our backing levels on the book itself, art collectibles, and the ultimate party for Forry's birthday at ALIEN CON in Silicon Valley, October 28, 2016. AGP and Famous Monsters principals will be there to sign your book, along with special guests. There's even going to be a cosplay contest. What better way to celebrate Halloween and Forrest Ackerman's legacy in one go?
 You did it! We're making this book happen!
But it's not the end. Read on to see what items you can unlock if you convince all your friends to pledge!
 All backers will receive a free "Forry's birthday" photo print, featuring Forry hanging out with the two Rays (Bradbury and Harryhausen)!
The print features all three legends' signatures and comes straight from the Famous Monsters vault.
 All backers will receive a Forry Kickstarter commemorative button, perfect to display your loyalty!
These items will be limited and available only for backers.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The process of putting together an anthology can feel like herding cows. Feisty, undead, demonic cows.

Take the risks and costs of publishing a single book and multiply them by how many creators you have. That's where we are.

We have to note that due to unforeseen complications, the contributor lineup may not end up being exactly as it appears on this page. But in the event that one story doesn't pan out, we have more waiting in the wings to take its place.

Once we give the book up to the printer, well, that's beyond our control — which is why we're only trusting the finest and most reliable printer for this hefty tome.

Famous Monsters has been in the publishing business since 1958, so we feel confident in our abilities to last-minute manage and get material to the printer no matter what "monsters" may arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
