updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
If you pledged for a t-shirt, you may have noticed that your book has not arrived in the mail yet, and for that we sincerely apologize. There's been an unexpected delay on the t-shirts. We should be getting them in very soon, and then all items will be shipped!
Here's an idea of what your shirt looks like:
Having made a successful debut at Alien Con, TALES FROM THE ACKERMANSION now exists in physical form! It’s ALLIIIIIVE!

Greetings earthlings!
We are putting the finishing touches on this behemoth of a book for all of you, and it looks amazing. Recently we received Rob Prior's finished art for DC Comics mogul Dan DiDio's short story, "Fertile Minds", and it has us so excited that we just had to share some pages. 
A jealous farmhand murders his next door neighbor...
You guys are the beast!

updates.update_userinfo: Stretch Goal #1 Unlocked! 80 minutes to go!
updates.update_content: Hey Monsters Kids, you guys are amazing. We've unlocked our first stretch goal and there's still 80 minutes to go!

updates.update_userinfo: Home stretch! We have until midnight PST!
updates.update_content:
And hey, in case some of you were worried, not every story in ACKER-MANSION is darker than Dracula’s tomb. Some of our monsters are pretty amusing, even. We’d like to share those with you!
Nancy Kilpatrick gave us an unconventional coming of age story, and Drew Rausch added just the right amount of whimsy to give it a crazy animated feel. We dare you not to grin.

A very sincere thank you from the bottom of our hearts to all of you monster-lovers who have made this anthology happen. We are very excited!
HOWEVER... this is not the end.
We may have been funded, but we're not finished yet! Enough pledges will make room for STRETCH GOALS!
Yay, awesome, hallelujah, Monster Kids rule supreme! We made it!

updates.update_userinfo: 98% - ALMOST THERE! More interior art revealed!
updates.update_content: Wow, guys — you've almost done it! Just a few more backers and we'll be at our goal!

project_data.project_name: Famous Monsters Presents: TALES FROM THE ACKER-MANSION

campaign.story:
The Story
        (Click here for a quick link to the preview pages.)
  Riley Katz is your average millennial – living in her mom’s basement and working as a part time yoga-instructor, while her bachelor’s degree in English makes a nice coaster for the water on her nightstand. Feeling helpless and adrift, Riley’s life is about to spin even further out of control when a former classmate sends her a friend request on Facebook, asking to hang out at her hotel bar and catch up on old times.
What seemed like a simple meet up for drinks turns into a reverse-intervention. Peri Edwards has gathered the old crew of friends together dredging up memories of shrieking ambulance sirens, near-death experiences, and life-altering injuries.
After years of research, Peri’s finally come up with the answer to what happened that fateful night, and she has gathered everyone together to reveal the truth—
They have superpowers. And she's going to prove it to them.
Why Should You Help In The Element?
Superheroes.
Lady Superheroes.
Queer Lady Superheroes.
No, but really. I set out to create an origin story for a group of superheroes that was trans-inclusive, not afraid of the word "bisexual" and acknowledged asexuality, featured more than just token characters of color, addressed disability and neurodiversity, and tried to create a character driven story. 
Each Issue of In The Element focuses a different character -- 
Kendra - trans woman, martial artist, complete control freak 
Alegra - former child prodigy, over-achieving disabled lipstick lesbian
Teagan - 100% aro, 100% ace, 100% done with your shit
Peri - pansexual problem-child turned problem adult
                 --and her perspective on the night in question before culminating in issue 6
What Are The Goals We Are Reaching For?
Goal 1: Completion of Reunion Part 1
   Issue one was partially funded through a GoFundMe campaign when I was assembling pitch packets for various publishers. 
The biggest cost center is of course the art, and since Beth Varni's work is absolutely gorgeous it is totally worth every penny. Additionally, she will be doing custom portraits for some of our backers as you'll see in the rewards category, and that will also go to her.
Following that, administrative fees for the cost of running and creating and bettering the website, marketing, etc... 
Lastly, Kickstarter's fees have to be taken into account. 
All in all, it rounds to just about $2,000.
Goal 2: Reunion Part 2 - Kendra's Issue
 Goal 3: Reunion Part 3 - Alegra's Issue
 Goal 4: Reunion Part 4 - Teagan's Issue
 Goal 5: Reunion Part 5 - Peri's Issue
 Goal 6: Reunion Part 6 - The Thrilling Conclusion!
 Goal 7: Ultimate Stretch - Print run of 500 trades. 
 For each goal obtained, I will be opening up more rewards. As many of the rewards are items such as backers having their names or likenesses appear in the world of In The Element, the more issues we get funded, the more appearances we have. 
Why is it broken out this way? So that I can produce as many issues as possible. It would be heart breaking to me to set that $16,000 goal and fall just $50 short of being able to provide any new content. This way, no matter what, Beth and I will be able to provide more and more of the story. As more content comes out, more people will know about it, and we will keep coming back until this story is told. 
No matter what...
Anything we create for In The Element will be available for free at its website. I want the story itself to be free to anyone who has an internet connection.
In that regard the first 8 pages of issue one are currently available on intheelementcomic.com! 
Thank you so much for taking  your time to check out our campaign, and I hope you know that every dollar will be greatly appreciated. I look forward to putting this story out there, and I hope that if you can see a bit of yourself in this story as I have put so much of myself into it. 
I can't wait to keep you updated as we go!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Once we are funded, the script for Issue 1 is fully complete. Issue 2 has a page by page outline ready to go, and Issues 3-6 have issue outlines. Determining the pace at which writing and art can be completed may take some time, and we need to have a back-log of pages ready to go before we start posting.

At this point, December 2016 seems to be when we will start our regular posting of ITE. Ideally, a new page would come out Monday through Friday every week. This schedule would provide brand new content every weekday for about six months.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Thank you all for all your support for creating In The Element. 
From now through December 7th, we will be posting an page a day of the remastered first eight pages. Following that, we will be posting a new page every Wednesday (new comic book day!) through mid-March until we reach the end of Issue 1.
I cannot tell you how much your support has meant. And I hope that you enjoy the ride.

Alright everyone. This is it. We have Issue 1 fully funded! But don't you all want more? Like way more? We have raised money to start Issue 2, but maybe we can get all of issue two. If you've donated, share the link on Twitter, tumblr, Facebook, your social media platform of choice.
Let's see how far we can go!

Unfortunately I didn't get any questions for the AMA but I did want to announce that I am on draft three of Issue 2, because all the funds we are currently raising are going towards that. 
Let's reach for the stars!

A magical thing happened on my commute. 
I left the office with $315 dollars to go. 
I came home to find we had hit out first goal.
You are all amazing, and Beth and I could not do this without you.

updates.update_userinfo: Less than a week to go!
updates.update_content: Please check out the video here, and remember we are so close to our goal!
I am hoping to get it online Tuesday.

Hey guys! We are mid-July and with half of the month down, we have $735 to go for Issue #1! Make sure to spread the word and let your friends know! Every little bit helps!
Also, the next AMA is coming up so get your questions in!

campaign.story:
“Bloody, dirty, revenge. This isn’t your father’s talking rabbit, no this is 'Gears & Bones'. A high urban fantasy that is a mix of Final Fantasy with Conan the Barbarian (as a rabbit) making out with Princess Zelda, and with a touch of The Count of Monte Cristo.” - Andrew P. Anderson
Hi, I’m Andrew P. Anderson, and I am the writer of “Gears & Bones” here at Guardian Knight Comics. We’re here to ask for your help. One of our flagship titles “Gears & Bones” is nearing the end of its first story arc. The individual issues are coming out through Diamond Previews, but paying for a print run of a trade paperback is expensive. It’s even more expensive since this is a 76 page beast of a first volume.
“That looks WILD! Seriously, THAT'S how to open a story!”- Chuck Dixon, (Winter World, Batman, Airboy)
About Gears and Bones:
“In these pages are the blood soaked adventures of Bones, Pirate of the eight skies. Read on, if you dare, stories of murder, betrayal, mad kings and dragon gods who play the chess board of existence! Against all this, Bones fights to live free… and forge his fate. “ - The Teller
This story is something that we had to create, that we needed to. Our studio is a collection of nerds that grew up on a daily diet of awesome! All the major food groups were there.*Conan the Barbarian *Final Fantasy *The Legend of Zelda *Thundercats *The Pirates of Dark Water *Legend *The Lord of the Rings * Willow!
You put all that cool content into the young minds of future creatives and you're going to get a cool comic! And this first story arc is just the beginning. We have a ton of stories to tell, great adventures all embedded within the heart of our fandom.
So here’s the deal, The artwork is done, the last issue is being colored and lettered, and we’re currently assembling them into a trade. So hopefully there will not be any delays in getting the books to you because, well, the hard work is done. Also the first four issues have been released into stores and are available digitally already, so you can get a first hand look at exactly what we’re doing.
The Campaign
Every kickstarter backer will receive the kickstarter cover
Kickstarter Vol. 1 exclusive cover
Most of the work is finished, the artwork is done. The hard part is over. This campaign is designed to raise funds to print the trade, and ship them out to the backers that supported us.
 Meet The Team:
Our team consists of amazing people who have worked in the industry for years.
Alfredo "Apple" De La Fuente Founder of Guardian Knight Comics & creator of 'Gears & Bones'
Andrew P. Anderson the writer has previously done some work at 215ink. He enjoys long walks in his mind.
Montos, the artist for 'Gears & Bones', previously worked on Poison Elves, but has really found his “voice” on this project.
Colorist/Editor In Chief Wes Hartman has worked for all the major and indie publishers (DC, Marvel, Aspen, IDW, Antarctic Press, Zenescope, etc) for 13 years and has created and written Sky Sharks and served as writer for I Hunt Monsters & more.
Colorist Tony Galvan lends his talents to coloring as well. Tony has also done numerous webcomics has also just completed coloring Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The High School Years, Freaks and Geeks from Dark Horse.
Editor Austin Rogers previously did Engines of Doom with 215ink and various anthologies and self published work. He is now one of the writers and co-creators on Moon Streak. 
Preview Pages
           Cover Art

Vol. 1 & We Can Kick It
A day in our shoes... Come hang out with us for a day! We'll get you a 3-Day pass to our hometown show "Alamo City Comic Con" & DINNER!!! (hotel & flight NOT included) You will also recieve 1 copy of "Gears & Bones" Vol. 1, along with the digital artist edition of "Gears & Bones" and the 60 page GKC preview book digital download. You will also receive 2 digital short stories written by Andrew P. Anderson.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Hardly any, like we said the artwork is done, so the hard part is over. Now is time to raise the funds to print the trade. We’re not going to lie, we want to see this project get backed and we want these books in your hands, ours too, but mostly yours. There is very little risk to you. The book is in the final stages of assembling right now. Once the project is funded we will send it immediately to the printer and get them made. If the project is not funded we don’t get your money and we don’t make the book, or we try again later. We will be printing overseas, there’s always a chance for printing delays, but printing overseas does take a little bit longer to get the books shipped to us, 8-12 weeks as it is slow boated across the ocean, and when we get them we will send them to you. The only risk to you is if the ship sinks, then what can you do, but that doesn’t happen too often. There are no bells and whistles on the project by design, no t-shirts, posters, knick knacks, or thingamabobs, the book is what we all want and we are confident that it’s all that is needed. We did not want to slow down sending books out to you by waiting on the production of “other stuff” so as soon as they come in they go out.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

A prophet from a distant planet, heads to Earth, to return from where his family came, and to spread the truth of the Savior. His journey is cut short by a mysterious rebellion, a beautiful princess, and a damn cold space station.
Blood in the Ink-
When a down on his luck thriller and comic book writer are thrown into a crime that is similar to what he would write, things get a little weird. Trey Williams teams up with Detective Flynn to clear his name. What follows next is a wave of desperation, and courage.

So take a moment to check out the campaign and support it, backers who pledge in the first 48 hours will receive bonus digital comics in addition to the Savage Sasquanaut issue(s) you support.

As GKC supporters you may recall that Sasquanaut is the creator owned property of Wes Hartman, GKC's former editor-in-chief, and we are excited that this long awaited project is finally coming to light.  As soon as the campaign is live we will come back and share the link with you, but in the meantime check out the press release!

So just a heads up we will be launching Vol. 2 of Gears & Bones sometime this week. We will send you a message with the direct link when we launch. This Vol. will contain issues 4-6 of the final part of this epic story line.
So we have been planning the kickstarter to volume 2 and have decided it should be live around March. Stay tuned for more info and what to look forward to.

Hey everyone, books are on the way! This week we were finally able to finish packing and sending out Gears & Bones Vol. 1.  Keep an eye out for it, thank you all for your patience. Mainly thanks for the support. Making plans for another project, follow us on facebook and twitter to get updates.

Update for all you backers . The Gears & Bones Vol. 1 trades came in! We've been scrambling to pack as many of the kickstarters packages as we can and get them together for you all. ACCC starts later today and we will have KS packages for pickup at the con. If you come to ACCC and backed our kickstarter we will be able to give you your package in person. The others will go in the mail next week. See you at the show!

So we wanted to wish our "Gears & Bones" artist Montos a very happy birthday! Stay safe and have fun!
and on another note, we got in our proofs!

campaign.story:
Tiny is our comic book interpretation of the classic Thumbelina fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen. If you’re a fan of the fairy tale, we think you’ll like what we’ve done with it, changes and all. If you’re unfamiliar with the original tale, we don’t think that will matter and you’ll like it anyway. But a short summary goes like this: Tiny is the story of an unusual teen girl kidnapped from home and struggling to return home and to discover who she really is. Born small enough to fit into the palm of her mother’s hand, she desperately wants to find a place where she belongs, while fighting both to stay alive and to avoid being forced to be someone—or some thing she isn’t. She’ll meet trolls, moles, mice and insects, some of whom want to help her, some of whom wish to harm her.
We initially set out to do Tiny as a graphic novel, but after getting a chunk of the pages finished, we decided to split it up into two separate parts so that we could get the first part printed to show everyone exactly what it is we could do with this story. Here is the cover a a few pages from #1:
Tiny #1 cover
  Tiny #1 page 1
  Tiny #1 page 12
  Tiny #1 page 13
  Tiny #1 page 23
  Tiny #1 page 20
  Tiny #1 page 25
The cool news is that the first issue is complete. Twenty-six pages of story and art! Finished! We counting on that being part of our promise to you that we’re devoted to getting Tiny finished and into your hands. We still may do a collected volume later…but that’s in the future.
Art is also well underway for the second issue! Once completed, both issues will deliver a combined fifty-two beautiful pages of story and art!
Who are “we?”
Roland Mann is a writer best known for his work on Cat & Mouse, a comic which ran for nearly two years, garnered critical acclaim, was optioned by Hollywood, and led Roland to other work. Other titles Roland wrote include Rocket Ranger, Miss Fury, Planet of the Apes: Blood of the Apes, Krey and Demon’s Tails. As editor, Roland is best known for his work as a Malibu/Marvel Comics editor where he edited The Protectors line of comics and many Ultraverse titles. Roland also served as Editor and Publisher of Silverline, a line of independent comics which included such titles as Switchblade and The Scary Book. In addition to his work in comics, he teaches Creative Writing at the university level. He is also a frequent speaker at writing workshops/conferences where many find his sessions encouraging.
Roland can be found on his website where he sometimes blogs: www.rolandmann.me and he is honored when folks “like” his facebook author page at https://www.facebook.com/rolandmannAuthor. Roland earned an MFA in Writing from Spalding University, a MA in English from the University of North Alabama, and a BS in Creative Writing from the University of Southern Mississippi.
Deonna Herrold is an illustrator and student at the University of Central Florida where she is studying Visual Arts and Emerging Media Management. Upon graduation, she hopes to become an illustrator in children’s books or comics. Her biggest influences are Arthur Rackham, John Bauer and Malin Falch. Tiny is her first comic work.
Deonna Herrold
Deonna is a lady of hearts and arts and she can be found online at http://vanilladeonna.deviantart.com and you can visit her society6 shop and buy things with her art! https://society6.com/vanillakeyblade/
Roland provides the adaptation plot and script for Tiny while Deonna provides all the art.
There’s a big sampling of what you’ll see here on this page! But we do need your help. We’ve done our part in creating it—now we need help getting it into both your hands and into the hands of those who won’t see this kickstarter. We’ve done the work, so now we’re seeing if you can help us get the money to get the comic printed. And in so doing, you’ll get your very own copy of TINY! So, that’s it. And even if you can’t afford to help us out, if you like what you see, how about sharing it! We would appreciate it greatly! Thank you for taking a few minutes to give us a look.
Pledges
                            Thank you for giving our project a look. We hope you'll find a reward for you and we very much appreciate your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk may be doing astronomically better than we anticipated and then being tasked with the signing and shipping of more product than we expected! We hope that is a problem we have.
We feel the real risks are small. While one can never anticipate "life," that's always a reality. One never knows what cards life will deal you. Fortunately, we're currently both in good health physically and emotionally.
Roland was an editor at Marvel and Malibu and ran a small press company for a time, he has a long editorial history of putting comics together and getting them to market in a timely manner.

You probably already know it, but there's enough of you who support one project and aren't aware of the other that I have to send this update to all the past kickstarters...so my apologies to those of you who get this more than once...
We're in the home stretch with a little more than a day left to back SILVERLINE DOUBLE FEATURE: TWILIGHT GRIMM #2 and FRIAR RUSH #2 (you can also get the first issues if you missed them--you'll do that via the ADD-ONS).

Hey y’all!
Just wanted to let you know that I have another kickstarter running: Cat & Mouse #3 + Trumps Book 1 needs YOU to help make them a reality! I’m really excited about both of them and hope you will check them out. There is a lot of original art pages and very reasonable prices.
Here are the two Kickstarter Exclusive Covers:

Hey everyone. Roland here. I hope you all thoroughly enjoyed Tiny! I'm still working to convince Deonna to do some more comic stuff with me. Can't quite convince her just yet. It's not like she's doing other comic work...I think she's just wrapped up in non-comic art. I tend to believe that should she decide to do a comic again, she'd let me know so we can work together.
ANYWAY...this post isn't about that. It's to let you know that I have launched another kickstarter (I know, about time, right?). In a nutshell, this is a reboot of the series I did in the 1990s. While I only launched it two hours ago, it's doing well...which, of course, makes my heart happy.

campaign.story:
The Book
How to Go Steady will teach you all about dating according to romance comic books of the 1960s and 1970s. Not only will you learn everything from what to do with a borrowed hankie to how to make the first move, you’ll learn how to develop the most attractive quality of all.
How to Go Steady will be a beautiful fully illustrated 6” x 9” softcover book (approximately 160 pages) full of gems from romance comic book advice columns, quizzes, and stories. The book also includes an afterword by former Marvel Comics staffer and Girl Friday, Suzan Loeb, discussing how she came to work for Marvel and write the advice column “Suzan Says.”
What's Inside 
Meeting the One
Preparing for the Date
Going Steady
Kissing, Petting, and Sex
Dealing with Parents and Friends
First Comes Love Then Comes..?
Jealousy
Heartbreak
For the Guys
Who is This Book For?
I’ve been lucky to have a truly wonderful audience composed of people from all walks of life. Though this book deals with dating as it was depicted in the postwar years, I think you’ll find that the advice is applicable to today’s modern dater no matter what their romantic situation. It is my hope that you will not only enjoy reading about dating practices of yesteryear, but you’ll find them thought provoking and even useful. No matter if you are already a fan of the blog, a comic book fan, an illustration fanatic, a history buff, a matchmaker, a lover of all things midcentury, or just a romantic -- there will be something in this book for you!
Our Story
Back in 2013, I wrote a fifty-page book proposal to shop around for an all-encompassing history of the romance comics of the 1960s and 1970s. I poured months into writing the proposal and a sample chapter and sent it off to both potential agents and publishers. I got some fantastic and encouraging feedback, but ultimately, no bites. It was then suggested to me by then boyfriend (now fiancé!) that I should just strike out on my own and self-publish. I was resistant to the idea at first but the more I thought about it and learned about the freedom that comes with self-publishing, I was totally on board.
Once I made the decision to self-publish, I figured that I would focus on one aspect of the romance comics to start out. Having myself just gone through a breakup and entering into the world of dating, I found the romance comic book advice columns really fascinating for how they dealt with navigating all things love and romance, especially in the beginning stages. It was also around this time that I had just learned that my grandfather, Mart Nodell, had worked on numerous advice featurettes for the early romance comic, Miss America. I honestly couldn’t imagine my grandpa doling out advice to teen girls, but it happened! The authorship of the comic book advice columns really intrigued me and I decided it was something I had to look into further.
Many of you know me (Jacque) from Sequential Crush, but I’m happy to introduce you to Jenny Cimino -- How to Go Steady illustrator extraordinaire! I’m beyond excited to have Jenny join me on this project as the illustrator and book designer. Her art is wonderful and not only that, her style complements and pays homage to the romance comics beautifully, don’t ya think?! In addition to illustration, Jenny is a professional graphic designer and brings to this project over ten years of pre-press experience assembling publications for print.
Jenny and I have known each other for years. Back when I was in museum school, I was the graduate assistant for the design department at the St. Louis Science Center where Jenny was a graphic designer. I immediately gravitated to Jenny’s art style and hilarious personality. After I finished grad school, Jenny and I stayed friends on Facebook. Back in 2013, I sent her a message inquiring if she’d like to work on an illustration project for me and here we are!  
Budget
In order to make this book a reality, we need to raise $21,000. The majority of the money will go toward paying Jenny to illustrate and design the book. Another sizable portion will go toward the printing process. I believe in paying artists a fair wage for their work and believe me, Jenny is definitely worth it! It is also important to me to print the book domestically. For this reason, I’ve decided to work with Thomson-Shore, a 100% employee-owned book manufacturer based in Michigan.
The rest of the money raised will cover the cost of production of the rewards, shipping, publishing and marketing fees (including a final proofing and ISBN), Kickstarter and credit card fees, as well as a small buffer should anything unexpected arise.
The completion of this book will not be possible without your help. Since 2009, Sequential Crush has been a not-for-profit educational venture run solely by me, Jacque Nodell. With the exception of a few generous donations from readers, I have paid for the site on my own. By backing How to Go Steady, you will be helping me usher in a new era for Sequential Crush and romance comics!
Timeline
The writing and editing are complete! Phew! The next six months will include Jenny finishing the illustration work and book design. Once the book is fully assembled, it will undergo a full professional proofreading. We anticipate that the book will go to print in early November and be ready to ship out in December along with the rest of the rewards. That way, you’ll have it in time for the holidays and well ahead of Valentine’s Day should you want to give a copy to a special someone!
Praise for Sequential Crush
“When we published the romance comics years ago, I never envisioned there would be an interest in them all these years later. But there is, and thankfully Jacque Nodell has preserved them with her blog, Sequential Crush. Though romance comics didn’t enjoy the same long-term success that the superhero books did, we are indebted to Jacque and her commitment to digging up treasures that may otherwise be lost. Jacque’s knowledge of, and entertaining insight into the romance comics of the 1960s and ‘70s is impressive, and the stuff that great books are made of. ‘Nuff said.”  -Stan Lee, comic book legend
“Kudos to Jacque Nodell and a lot of my gratitude, too. I’m going to have such a good time at her place.”  -Jennifer Crusie, New York Times bestselling author
“Basically, Sequential Crush is amazing and transfixing and, often, unexpectedly touching. Each carefully curated post is like a tiny, hilarious, ridiculous, and/or moving time travel vessel that shows the reader that everything both changes and stays the same. Haha, that basically says nothing. I don't know, but I love them (it?) so much. Something about the way the old comics try to speak to the naked yearning of the teenage girl's soul are really beautiful and messy and just, ah, I don't know. It speaks to the naked yearnings of everyone's souls? Well, maybe not, but there's something there that I still haven't put my finger on. Anyway, it's been an absolute delight to read these past couple years.”  -Edith Zimmerman, founding editor of The Hairpin and contributing writer to The New York Times Magazine
“Jacque Nodell balances keen insightful feminist perspectives with an almost unapologetic nostalgia for the romance genre.”  -Sam Kieth, comic book writer, illustrator, and creator - The Sandman, The Maxx, Zero Girl
Thank you so much for your interest in How to Go Steady!
I am so thankful to have gotten this far with the help of all of you, and I know that we can make this book a reality! I would be extremely grateful if you could help spread the word to anyone who might be interested! Thank you!!! You are truly the best!
xoxo
Jacque Nodell and Jenny Cimino
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges are inherent in every project. At this point in time, there are no foreseeable obstacles we need to overcome to finish this project. However, should anything arise, I feel that my long term commitment to Sequential Crush through the highs and lows of life makes me well-suited to finish a project of this scope. Since the book is already written, I am eager to get this out into the world. It is my hope that everything goes as planned and stays on schedule, but I will keep you in the loop of any delays. If you have any questions about the project, I'd love to hear from you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: HOW TO GO STEADY is Going Strong -- Thanks to You!
updates.update_content: As I stand here holding a paperback copy of How to Go Steady, I'm dancing around with joy. This book has been five years in the making! From an idea to this Kickstarter campaign to the decision to self-publish, creating this book has been nothing less than a journey. Everyone keeps telling me that the first book is by far the hardest and I sure hope they are right! I started working on this one way back in 2013 and there have been ups, downs, and every emotion in between. There's also been a huge learning curve to figure out all the technological ins and outs inherent in the publishing process, but I'm happy to report, I've lived to tell the tale!

campaign.story:
Mummy's Always Right is a gorgeously illustrated, premium board book, featuring a mischievous little monster named GAWS who learns all the many reasons he should listen to his MUMMY!
Thanks so much for helping me bring Mummy's Always Right and the Creature Cove universe to life!
   In the book, your little monsters will enter the world of CREATURE COVE, home to the Mummy Family. 
Say hello to GAWS from Mummy's Always Right!
  They'll follow a day in the life of Gaws, as his Mummy teaches him important life lessons that all of our little boys and ghouls should know...
The importance of cleaning your room and brushing your teeth...
Eating a hearty breakfast...
How to stay safe while exploring...
How to play nicely with other little monsters...
Staying away from strangers...
Quality time with Daddy...
...and so much more!
Have a look Inside!
Product Details
24-pages of gorgeous illustrations featuring GAWS, MUMMY and the BOO CREW and other creepy and cuddly denizens of CREATURE COVE!  
Mummy knows best... and she'll help you teach your little monsters how to stay safe and behave while still having fun with friends.
Durable, laminated, high-quality board book that will stand up to countless bedtime readings.
This book will literally have your kids saying the words "Mummy's Always Right!" Guaranteed!
Here's what actual readers are saying about Mummy's Always Right...
    Why Am I'm Making This Book?
I'm a comic book artist with two little girls at home... and I had a problem.
See, my kids love to watch their daddy draw...  
Unfortunately, most of the comics I do aren't really age appropriate for my little monsters. So I created Gaws, just for them.
My kids went crazy for this mischievous little mummy... For weeks, every day they'd come into my studio and ask for a new Gaws sketch.
Gradually, a story started to come together in my mind and MUMMY'S ALWAYS RIGHT was born.
The Creative Team
I'm Joe Mulvey. I'm a comics artist (SCAM, CounterTERROR) and a freelance illustrator and graphic designer. Mummy's Always Right is my first (but hopefully not last) children's book.
I'm joined by talented color artist Jules Rivera.  I've been working with Jules for a few years now, and she always makes my pencils and inks shine.
Lettering the book is acclaimed and multiple Eisner-award nominated letterer Deron Bennett. Deron has lettered books for many top publishing company's including Jim Henson's Tale of Sand and The Muppets Show books, and I'm thrilled to have him on Mummy.
I'm also very happy to be working with ComixTribe, the publisher behind the hit board book C is for Cthulhu. I'm excited to add Mummy Always Right to their growing line of books parents and kids love to read together, with equal parts care and scare!
Why Kickstarter?  
We're coming to Kickstarter to help raise funds for a large offset print run of at least 1000 copies of Mummy's Always Right. 
The book is 100% complete and ready to go to print. We've come to Kickstarter to help get the book into as many hands as possible, and would love your support to bring it to life. 
The Rewards  
Mummy-Back Guarantee
We'd like you to back our project with confidence that we'll deliver the rewards we promise in a timely manner. We're offering a 100% Backer-Satisfaction or your Mummy... er, money back. 
If you're not 100% satisfied with your pledge, we'll do what it takes to resolve your issue. And if we can't, simply return your reward, and we'll refund your full pledge amount.
The Project Timeline  
The Kickstarter Campaign: 4 Weeks (May 16 - June 17)
Kickstarter Funds Received: 2 Weeks (July 1)
Mummy Goes to Print - (Early July) 
Digital Rewards Released - (Early July)
Book Manufacturing and Freight - 8-12 Weeks (August-September)
Extra buffer time of unexpected delays - 2 Weeks (October)
Expected delivery to US Backers - 2 Weeks (Late October)
Expected delivery for International Backers - 4 Weeks (November)
PLAY
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my second Kickstarter project, and the publisher, ComixTribe's ninth project.

We're well aware of the many challenges associated with delivering on a Kickstarter campaign, and know that fulfillment obstacles are a part of every campaign.

We have taken the following steps to mitigate the risk associated fulfilling this project:

1) We're working close with KrakenPrint, a well-regarded US-based print broker to ensure a quality book production, and on-time fulfillment.

2) The board book is 100% complete, and ready to go to print.

3) We don't anticipate any problems working with our already selected vendors for all rewards. However, we've already sourced back-up vendors for all products, should a problem arise.

4) We will be using BackerKit software for better campaign management and integration with fulfillment partners.

5) Please review previous ComixTribe Kickstarters (OXYMORON, EPIC, SCAM, THE RED TEN, THE STANDARD, C Is for CTHULHU, C is for CTHULHU BOARD BOOK & PLUSH TOY) for evidence of our ability to communicate with backers post campaign, and deliver on campaign fulfillment.

We don't consider a project successful unless 100% of our backers have been fulfilled.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hope you're getting ready and excited for Halloween this year. (I know my girls are!) 
I wanted to send a quick message your way letting you know that I'm giving away a FREE copy of my new Digital Sketchbook to backers who help fund my newest book, WAILING BLADE, which is on Kickstarter right now!

updates.update_userinfo: Hey, Have You Checked Out My New Book on Kickstarter?
updates.update_content:
Hey, did you hear I have a new book? 
Guess what it's called?
Okay... here's a hint:

Hey Everyone,
                        I really hope you're 2017 has been off to a great start, it's hard to believe that April is almost over and it's even harder to think that it's been almost a year since we launched the MUMMY'S ALWAYS RIGHT campaign. I wanted to take this time to thank every single one of you for helping make this book happen. Over the last year, being able to share this book with a larger audience than just my two girls (Who still read almost nightly) has been one of the greatest and most eye opening experiences of my life. I've enjoyed seeing all the reviews and the massive amount of photo's with all of your loved ones enjoying the book. It's been the MOST satisfying thing I've ever done. Making a book that's so thoroughly enjoyed and appreciated by so many people is something that I, the great people at ComixTribe and my whole family are extremely grateful for.

You guys are awesome! 
I asked for your help boosting our Amazon reviews over the weekend, and we've doubled where we were... and are well on our way to 25 reviews by Dec. 25.

Hey there!
Not gonna lie, I literally can't get enough of these Mummy's Always Right pics.

updates.update_userinfo: Last Leg of the Mummy's Always Right Journey
updates.update_content:
Happy Mummy Monday! 
A quick shipping update... 
Last week, the Mummy's Always Right board book shipment finally cleared customs in Chicago. 
On Friday, the books were picked up for transport to the fulfillment center in nearby Joliet, IL.

Hey Everyone, 
           Hope you're having a great day. I just wanted to give you all a quick update to let you know that starting next week, your copies of MUMMY'S ALWAYS RIGHT are ON THEIR WAY! 
We had a MUCH longer delay in Customs than we had EVER envisioned happening but that issue is done now. Our printers have picked up the books and shipped them off to the Amazon fulfillment centers.

updates.update_userinfo: A Halloween Bonus from Mummy's Always Right
updates.update_content:
Good Morning Everyone,
                    I hope your week is off to a great start. I'm just getting back in the saddle after an AMAZING New York Comic Con and I just wanted to send out this update to give you some exciting news 
                     The BIGGEST news is that the books are IN THE COUNTRY! (Chicago to be exact.) So now we just have to wait for them to clear customs and then they will be on their way to the fulfillment center and out to ! We are on schedule and hope to stay that way. We want those books in your hands and the hands of those you bought them for by halloween. Although is a book that can be read all year long, Halloween is definitely a time to make your first venture into Creature Cove.

Hey Everyone,
                  Hope you're all doing well and enjoying your start of the fall season. I just wanted to give you all a quick update to let you know where we are at with the process of the fulfillment for MUMMY'S ALWAYS RIGHT. We're currently still on our original schedule to fulfill the campaign in time for Halloween. Our printer has told us the books will be delivered stateside within the next few weeks and head right to our fulfillment center and start being shipped out to all of our magnificent backers.

campaign.story:
GLADSTONE'S SCHOOL FOR WORLD CONQUERORS 2 BOOK SET
OWN THE TWO BOOK GLADSTONE'S SCHOOL FOR WORLD CONQUERORS SET TODAY!!!
'Gladstone's School for World Conquerors' is the critically acclaimed all ages graphic novel series created by Armand Villavert and Mark Andrew Smith.
OWN 'GLADSTONE'S SCHOOL FOR WORLD CONQUERORS' BOOK 1: VILLAINY 101' (180 PAGES) & BOOK 2: IN THE SHADOW OF SHIRAN.' (120 Pages) TODAY!!!
Gladstone’s School for World Conquerors is a Young Adult Graphic Novel series by Armand Villavert & Mark Smith about a top secret academy for the children of the world's greatest Super Villains to learn their trade.
Ever wondered if Super Villains go to school? Ah, you assumed they were born with their special skills. Think again, in Gladstone’s School for World Conquerors we find ourselves amidst the pinnacle of higher learning for the next generation of villains and masterminds honing their craft. 
The school curriculum includes the usual suspects of “public speaking” and “biology and chemistry,” and yet that’s only superficial child’s play. Classes like “unleash your hypnotic potential”, “intergalactic battle strategy”, and “ancient relics, spells & mystical arts” are added stressors for straight-A students like Kid Nefarious and Mummy Girl. 
Mock battles are unleashed to test their skills with the latest tools of the trade such as “orbs of tranquility” or “grim reaper’s breath.”
Join Kid Nefarious, Mummy Girl, Martian Jones, Ghost Girl, and the infamous Skull brothers unearth the School's and their parent's hidden past.
Gladstone's School for World Conquerors is co-created and co-owned by Armand Villavert & Mark Andrew Smith.
Matthew Weldon is stepping in for art on series 2 on art and Kote Carvajal is doing the colors. Armand is back in the Captain's chair with art on series 3 which will be in print later this year. This was done to build lead time on Gladstone's 3 and to give Armand a head-start to get Gladstone's back on a more regular schedule.
      GLADSTONE'S SCHOOL FOR WORLD CONQUERORS 1 & 2 HARDCOVERS
PICK UP OUR FANTASY ADVENTURE SERIES 'THE NEW BRIGHTON ARCHEOLOGICAL SOCIETY' 1 & 2 IN HARDCOVER FORMAT AS WELL TO SUPPORT THIS KICKSTARTER
What is this Kickstarting? 
This Kickstarter is to pay for the printing costs of Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Book 2 in Hardcover format.
What is the plan for delivery?
We have the books laid out for production.  This Kickstarter is to print Gladstone's School for World Conquerors 2 in Hardcover format. We have already raised $4,500 (after costs) to print Gladstone's School for World Conquerors 1 in Hardcover and the two books will be printed together. 
It should be about a three month wait for backers. The books will take about one month to be printed in China. One month for freight to the US. About two weeks to arrive in Amazon's inventory, and another two weeks to ship out to backers.
  See What People Are Saying About 'Gladstone's School for World Conquerors'!!!
"Smith’s writing is fast-paced and warm, his characters rich enough to resonate with all ages of reader, and the character design and outsider edge of surreality recalls Peter Milligan‘s X-Statix, and likewise Villavert’s pen explores the same subverted pop-art style of Mike Allred, albeit with the stylised touch of a Saturday morning cartoon." - Sci Fi Now
"We've been championing Gladstone's by Mark Andrew Smith and Armand Villavert since issue #1, but the last couple of issues have seen the series hit an early stride. In this installment, Smith plays with an enticingly fun and interesting take on superhero comics, challenging the notion of a hero's constant victory of his nemesis and how that would affect a child that is being educated in the ways of villainy. 
Watching Kid Nefarious and friends discover their parents losing over and over again in the pages of comic books (which are banned from Gladstone's, for these obvious reasons) is amazing. Like Miguel said in his review last month, Gladstone's never talks down to kids and remains all-ages accessible. Better yet, they just might learn something about the tropes of superhero comics in the process.
Gladstone's continues to impress, so if you've been neglecting this series for some oddball reason, it's time to stop doing so. You're missing out, and everyone's going to make fun of you for it." - IGN
"Mark Andrew Smith and Armand Villavert’s tween superhero ongoing stood out as the kind of title Marvel or DC wish they had, but would never be possible at the Big Two. A superhero dramedy set at a school for aspiring supervillains, the series is founded on the concept that the ongoing war between heroes and villains is faked, putting a new spin on the parent-as-supervillain metaphor. 
The students are waking up to the reality of their world, and the reader discovers with them, learning the dense mythology of Smith’s story while experiencing the thrill of Villavert’s kinetic artwork. Best of all, Gladstone’s is a title appropriate for all readers, with characters that look and sound like kids, but a plot that any superhero fan can appreciate." - AV CLUB
"Mark Andrew Smith’s tween-supervillain team is similar to the Runaways in that each member is pulled from a different corner of the superhero genre: a mummy, ghost, alien, etc. Smith’s story puts a new spin on the super-school concept that has already been tried in films like Sky High and Zoom. Armand Villavert’s sleek artwork would translate well to computer animation, and Smith’s clearly defined yet whimsical cast makes Gladstone’s a great fit for a studio like Pixar. The chance of a creator-owned superhero team launching a big-budget animated feature is slim, but if The Walking Dead can become the highest-rated show on cable, there’s always hope." - AV CLUB
ART FROM 'GLADSTONE'S SCHOOL FOR WORLD CONQUERORS: The Battle of the Superhero Archives' illustrated by Matthew Weldon.
                                                        Please take a moment to share 'Gladstone's School for World Conquerors' with your friends on Facebook and Twitter by clicking the 'Like' & 'Tweet' buttons above.
By sharing 'Gladstone's' you're helping us to educate the public about the project and helping us to get one step closer to our quest of 'world domination.'
'Gladstone's School for World Conquerors' TM & (C) Armand Villavert & Mark Andrew Smith.

Risks and challenges
The books are ready to go to the printers. Because the printers are in China it will take a month to print, a month for freight, a few weeks to get the books to Amazon.com which we are using for shipping and fulfillment for this Kickstarter, and about two weeks to deliver the books from Amazon.

*Disclaimer: The trailer was done a while ago and says 'Only on Kickstarter', it is not in any way exclusive to Kickstarter and may be sold later through diamond or Amazon.com at a higher retail price. For us Kickstarter is the prefered method of sale and we get more from every book sold through Kickstarter.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Book 3 Update
updates.update_content: Want to give a quick update. I finished graduate school for my Master's Degree teaching English to Speakers of other Languages. Didn't get a lot of writing done last year and it was mostly academic writing. I was planing on launching Gladstone's School for World Conquerors book 3 on Kickstarter this past month, but got busy with my thesis portfolio and job hunting. Working on my visa and should head to Saudi Arabia for another tour of duty teaching if all goes well and I hope when I'm settled in that we'll do the Kickstarter for Book 3.

Wanted to get the word out about my friends Michael and John's Series Unmasked:
Comic book creator, Michael Sarrao, has launched his latest Kickstarter campaign for his superhero series Unmasked! The series revolves around a young journalist on a mission to unmask superheroes that have gone bad! Check out the project, support and share! There are many rewards such as bookmarks, posters, original art and you can be drawn into the book!

Two Updates. A Short and Succinct Update and a Longer (But not that long) More Detailed Update. :)
THE SHORT UPDATE: If need Gladstone's for the Holiday Season, please email me, send me a message, or you can comment here below and I will get in touch with you. 
If you can wait until January, we are thankful for your patience.

I received preview copies of Gladstone's School for World Conquerors 1 and 2 around the end of October. Here are photos of the two copies. The books are beautiful and quality. 
On the printer's end there were some delays (as well as some of our end to be fair). We were pushed back in the queue for some larger orders. We had some file issues and had to swap some pages with correct versions for print. We worked around national holidays in China and there were some language barriers with the production staff. All in all, we took the time to get the books done right.

campaign.story:
THUNDER MONKEY The Young Years #1 a new ALL AGES comic.
THUNDER MONKEY, a superhero monkey with exploding skin! Think Curious George with superpowers. If you enjoy Pixar movies like the Incredibles then you will like THUNDER MONKEY. The downside of having exploding skin is constantly having everything blowing up in your face! THUNDER MONKEY lives in Summercity with his adopted family. Doc Phazer - the worrisome and distracted scientist who discovered THUNDER MONKEY, Addison - his trouble seeking daughter and Widget, the robot make up the family cast. The story hops right into an adventure featuring a young THUNDER MONKEY. Events are set into motion that will haunt THUNDER MONKEY'S future. One of THUNDER MONKEY'S unfavorable abilities is to create powerful enemies. Who is the mysterious super villain lurking in the shadows?
Cover THUNDER MONKEY THE YOUNG YEARS #1
   Thunder Monkey The Young Years #1 page 1

  Thunder Monkey The Young Years #1 Page 2
     THUNDER MONKEY Facebook page
Thunder Monkey The Young Years #1 Page 3
   Thunder Monkey The Young Years #1 Page 4
   Thunder Monkey The Young Years #1 Page 5
THUNDER MONKEY has been my baby since high-school. He appeared as a bootleg comic that I printed myself, came along as a college newspaper strip at the Savannah College of Art and Design and has appeared in published comics.  
WHY KICKSTARTER?
Publishing comics involves many hurdles. Unless tens of thousands of people order your unknown book from the get go, it will not survive. Kickstarter, however, only requires hundreds of backers instead of tens of thousands. In essence and here's the beauty of it that I love, you - the backer - become the publisher! The people decide themselves to help make a project come to life. You, like the big publishers give me the green light by pre-ordering. And just like a publisher your job is also to help spread the word. I only have one voice, but together the sky is the limit.
SHARE
My goal is for every backer to share the link to this Kickstarter on their Facebook and or Twitter. If you can do more, then you my friend are awesome! Don't hesitate to reach out to me, I'd be happy to have you on my team. That's what it's really about, building a community of people who want to see THUNDER MONKEY. Go to the THUNDER MONKEY Facebook page and share.
GOAL
Why is the goal so low? I am the writer and the artist, so production costs aren't as high. I'm not going to lose money because the rewards are built to cover the costs associated with each reward. I have quotes from $2.17 per book to $3.00 per book based on how many I print. Postage to ship one book costs around $2.60. And then there are envelopes, bags, etc... $5 per book barely covers those costs, that's why I rely on the other items to fund the project. Posters cost the least to produce, so if you're not sure what to order, know that posters will help a lot. I'm looking at 2 to 3 months of work when all is said and done. Above $2,000 and I will start to get "paid" for the work with about 10% going to the Kickstarter fees.
Thunder Monkey Poster and Variant Cover
STRETCH GOALS 
If the $4,000 Stretch goal is reached I will reveal the uber secret THUNDER MONKEY HANDSHAKE. This grants entrance to an exclusive elite secret society of fandom. I will also send out a How to Draw THUNDER MONKEY PDF.
If the $6,000 Stretch goal is hit I will add an additional comic to all the US rewards at or above the "Banana Split" level. International backers will get one also, if it does not increase their shipping amount otherwise they will receive a collector's card.
If $9,000 is hit, an additional BRAND NEW second issue of THUNDER MONKEY will be funded and ALL backers will receive the entire second issue in digital form.
Timeline
The script is written, the layouts are done and five of the 24 pages are colored and lettered. The colored sketches are also already in production. I have gathered quotes from printers and prices for shipping materials. Everything is ready to go. I expect to have the book printed by the end of July, but I gave myself a two month cushion.
Sample of Production Art - Layouts
This is a Kickstarter exclusive. As of now there are no plans to distribute the book by other means. I'm not going to order hundreds of extra copies.  
I really wanted to have a local aspect so I have partnered with the following stores located in my area, and will be printing the books locally. If you let me know in the notes WHERE you will be picking up your rewards I will personalize your copy of the book! Let me know the name you want on the book.
GRYPHON GAMES AND COMICS Fort Collins Colorado
GRYPHON GAMES AND COMICS Cheyenne Wyoming
TIME WARP Boulder Colorado
I WANT MORE COMICS Denver Colorado
MILE HIGH COMICS JASON STREET Denver Colorado
If you feel compelled to back my project, congratulations! You are now my publisher! DON'T FORGET to spread the word. If you have any questions I will do my best to follow up.
Thank you,
LEE OAKS!
Colored Pencil Sketch
   Be sure to indicate MENS, WOMENS OR YOUTH and which size.
   Womens T-Shirt
   Enhances your muscles to make you look even better. Men's Thunder Monkey T-Shirt
      Water Color Commssions
       NEW Ala Carte Add-Ons
These Add-Ons are a way for you to get the items you want. Simply add the amount for any extras you may want onto your normal pledge amount.
Simply select "manage my pledge" and change the dollar amount.
Once the Kickstarter is over, you'll receive a backer survey from me confirming both your total pledge amount and the number and type of extras you wanted. Please contact me with any questions!
See more of Lee'sPoster options by clicking on image
 HOW TO PLEDGE
Kickstarter is the world's largest funding platform for creative projects. Every month, tens of thousands of people pledge millions of dollars to creative projects in dozens of categories.
A person who supports a project is called a "backer." The process of giving money to this project is called a "pledge."
In return for your pledge, we (the creators of the campaign) are able to offer "rewards," depending on the amount you pledge.
Pledge levels vary from just $2 to several hundred dollars. And each different level opens up a new creative reward. (For a full list, check out the right side of this page).
You can become a backer in just three easy steps:
Step 1: Read through the pledge levels and rewards we're offering in the right sidebar of this page. Step 2: Click the large, green "BACK THIS PROJECT" button to the right of the trailer video at the top of this page. Step 3: Enter your pledge amount, and complete the steps for filling in your information. This process takes just a few seconds! That's it! It's really that simple! Thank you for backing!
Once you've backed this project, we encourage you to share this page on social media platforms, such as Facebook and Twitter, and to tell your friends.
Le SINGE DU TONNERRE Les Jeunes Années #1 est une nouvelle bande dessinée de 24 pages adaptée à tous les âges.
Le SINGE DU TONNERRE est un superhéros à la peau explosive ! Imaginez “George le petit curieux” en tant que superhéros. Si vous aimez les singes, vous aimerez le SINGE DU TONNERRE.
L’histoire débute en pleine aventure avec le jeune SINGE DU TONNERRE comme personnage principal. Les évènements qui s’enchainent viendront hanter le future du SINGE DU TONNERRE. Un des malheureux talents du SINGE DU TONNERRE est de se créer des ennemis puissants. Entre nous – il est très doué pour ça.
Le SINGE DU TONNERRE est mon personnage depuis le lycée. Il est d’abord apparu dans une bande dessinée que j’ai imprimée et agrafée moi-même. Il a ensuite fait partie d’une BD dans le journal de l’université au Savannah College of Art and Design and a enfin été publié dans des comics.
Mon nom est Lee Oaks. Je dessine des BD, c’est mon job. Voici quelques livres sur lesquels j’ai travaillé.
Publier des bandes dessinées comprend pas mal d’obstacles. A moins que des milliers de gens commandent votre livre inconnu dès le départ, il ne survivra pas. Kickstarter, cependant, ne requiert que des centaines de supporters, et non des milliers. En bref, et c’est ce que je préfère dans le projet, ce sont vous, les supporters, qui publiez le livre !
Et en tant qu’éditeur, votre boulot est de faire passer le mot. Je ne suis pas un génie du marketing et je ne suis qu’une seule personne. J’ai besoin de votre aide. Sans vous, ma seule promotion est mon statut sur Facebook, “Salut ! Je viens de lancer un Kickstarter !”
Mon projet est de dessiner les personnages dont j’ai toujours rêvé. Le fait de les rendre disponibles pour ceux qui veulent les voir est mon idéal.
Pourquoi le montant de mon objectif est-il si bas ? Contrairement aux campagnes qui incluent un des auteurs et artistes qui doivent être payés pour créer les livres, je fais tout moi-même.
Le scenario est écrit, les croquis sont terminés, et les 5 premières pages coloriées et lettrées. Tout est prêt.
Si vous souhaitez être supporter de mon projet, félicitations ! Vous êtes maintenant mon éditeur. N’oubliez pas de faire passer le mot ! Si vous avez des questions, je ferai de mon mieux pour répondre.
Merci d’avance,
LEE OAKS!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge I foresee is printing shipping labels and packaging the shipments. I have an eBay store and I know it takes 15 minutes per package to prep. On the production side, I have illustrated 7+ graphic novels and various comics professionally over several years and have never missed a deadline. I illustrated ESCAPE FROM TERRA the daily web comic for 4 years. No deadline can stop me. In the event of an unforeseeable natural disaster, you will be updated in a responsible manner.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Thunder Monkey is back, but this time he has brought some friends.  I have teamed up with 30+ independent creators that I know to make a Comic book Crossover.  It is written by long time friend and collaborator (not to mention Eisner winning) Mike Baron!
Creators were brought together for their unique characters and their talent whether they have worked for big companies or not.
Your support and help spreading the word would be greatly appreciated.

Thunder Monkey Release Party     Saturday Nov. 19th 6 - 9 PM.
The Thunder Monkey Kickstarter concludes with a little release party for the book, scheduled from 6 - 9 PM at Gryphon's Games & Comics store in Fort Collins, Colorado. They have an open cafe for drinks and some food items. You can pick up your rewards. I may have some extra copies of the book and other reward items available for purchase if you missed out on something. I might also have some new exclusives and news for what's to come. Mingle with other comics creators and enthusiasts from the area.  You are welcome to invite friends.

updates.update_content:
There is one week left in the THUNDER MONKEY KickStarter! I can't thank you enough for supporting me. Since this is the final stretch to the finish I'm adding some ADD-ON rewards to the campaign.
I am offering the T-shirt, and a 3" Die cut Magnet as add-ons. I have the magnets in hand and they look great. Simply select "manage my pledge" and change the dollar amount to add any extras.

We did it!  (We as in you and me.)  This is very good news for the future of THUNDER MONKEY!  But it doesn't mean our work is done.  Keep spreading the word.  Our next goal is to get THUNDER MONKEY out of the "invisible" section of the KickStarter list and into the highlighted section.  It makes a big difference of what will come next.  Reach out to friends and see if they can pledge $1 to get those backer numbers up.  If we hit the stretch goal it will be good news for everybody.
I am holding a contest outside of KickStarter to reward those who spread the word.  Prizes include a cover style drawing of your choice and runner up prizes are a never released print inked by the one and only Kevin Nowlan.  At the end of the campaign I will tally up the referrals and dish out the prizes.  Check the THUNDER MONKEY Facebook page for more:  https://www.facebook.com/theofficialthundermonkey/

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Fall of Anterra Issue #1 KickStarter Campaign 
Standard Cover Art for Issue #1
  The story for The Star Band Chronicles started over two years ago and was originally intended to be three separate books with the potential to go back through the story's timeline to the original war that started it all or to continue forward into the future with a new generation of heroes and their adventures. The first book is titled, The Fall of Anterra.  
  It was during the process of doing some of the initial concept art that many people suggested to me that my story would be perfect for a comic book or animated series. So after doing some research, I felt that doing a comic book series would not only be the best way to tell the story, but also the most cost effective for myself. 
  I have created everything that you see here and on my website while working another full time job. I initially did many of the sketches myself to help me describe the characters and many of the details in the story. Then I took my basic sketches and worked with illustrators  and graphic designers to help modify and clean up the characters. I enjoyed every step of the way and found that I was really good at the creative process. 
  My enthusiasm for this project became contagious as I found other people, including the illustrators themselves, drawn into the story and characters that I created. Here is an example of one of my creations:
Concept art for my very own space fighter design. Hope you like it - L.A. Franco
  It was things like the fighter above that most people found so incredible. How did you think of something like that or where did the idea for this crazy story come from were some of the most common questions. But what most people don't realize is that this story came to me at a very dark and troubling time in my life and was my means to escape reality (even if only temporarily).   
  Then this story turned into something greater than myself and my problems, it became a creative outlet for me and a way for me to inspire others. It became a way to show others that when things seem their darkest, you can shine your brightest. 
Meet the Anterrians of the Star Band Chronicles
 If you want to read more about the story and/or the characters, visit my website at http://thestarbandchronicles.com/book-1-the-fall-of-anterra/
Where does your money go?
Quality, Affordable Printing Made Easy
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
For me the biggest challenge has been slowing myself down. As I mentioned before, I also work a full time job and do this every night as soon as I get home so sometimes I feel that my progress hasn't been what it should be, but then I have to remind myself of the big picture and all of the steps that it took to get this far and I realize that I have already overcome so many obstacles and challenges. The story for the Fall of Anterra is a compelling good versus evil type of classical tale, but with the unexpected twists and turns of a more modern adventure story.

As far as risk and challenges for my backers, there is none. As you can see by my breakdown, the backer's rewards and prizes are already calculated into my cost. I don't make a cent unless I sell comics, but you still get your rewards regardless if I do or not and if I don't make my target amount, Kickstarter returns your money, so you don't lose either way. 

Be a part of the next exciting sci-fi action adventure series and get some cool exclusive prizes only available for our kickstarter supporters.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Infinity Fashion Shows are exciting events where Seniors have fun modeling Infinity fashions in front of an audience of family and friends.
Infinity models have the time of their lives and are presented with a beautiful bouquet of flowers at the end of the show.
PLAY

All Infinity product arrives with the customers name printed on the inside label giving it a personal touch along with making it easy to keep track of their clothing.
All Infinity orders come gift wrapped in a beautiful pink box with a hand written thank you card inside.
Hand delivering the Infinity orders is as much fun for our consultants as it is for our customers.
5% of all Infinity sales goes towards our favorite charities.
 Why $20,000?
$10,000 to develop the new Fall/Holiday line so the show can go on!
$5,000 for marketing and website development to spread the word.
$5,000 to offset a portion of the cost of going to Assisted Living facilities and putting on a completely "Free" Fashion Show for their entertainment as well as having them  model in the show and having the time of their lives.
This is one of the most rewarding things you could do with your money, bringing joy to seniors that have done so much for us in their lifetime.

Risks and challenges
Infinity is blessed with a team of highly qualified Apparel industry experts who have reached the point in their careers that they want to give back, by doing something extremely rewarding. The risks of supporting our cause are very small due to the amount of experience our team has, however currently we all work on Infinity in addition to our full time jobs in the apparel industry. updates.update_userinfo: We Have a Passion for Senior Fashion!
updates.update_content: Hello to all my fellow Senior Fashionistas!!!!!!!  It has been an exciting week, as we have been receiving requests for fashion shows from our new friends in Georgia, North Carolina, Florida and as far away as Canada.  Time is running short so please help spread the word!  Tell everyone you know to pledge to the Infinity Kickstarter site and help spread the fun to seniors across the

Back in September we had our very first Infinity Fashion show at the Watermark in Beverly Hills.  Today we returned for our Spring 2016 show.  It was very gratifying to see both familiar and new faces, all having such a wonderful time!  The show was twice as big, twice as successful and twice as much fun!  We could not do these events without our dedicated Infinity staff and you, our beloved backers!  Please continue to spread the word about Infinity to your family and friends!

Hi Backers - Thank you so much for your generous support! We are continuing to take our free Fashion Shows to seniors is Assisted Living facilities. We had two very entertaining shows last week and have two more scheduled for this week. They are so much fun, and so rewarding to see the joy we bring to these women. Please spread the word, we need additional backing, at our current rate we will not meet our goal, which means we will not get funded, Please remember, Kickstarter is an "all or nothing" campaign. We either hit our goal and get the funds, or we get nothing.  Thanks again
The Infinity project is continuing to gain momentum as the word spreads. We are up to 15 backers and adding more everyday, thank you for your support!

Infinity has had two great Fashion Shows this week, one on Tuesday and the other today and the response continues to be  beyond great! Everyone has so much fun at our shows, it is really an unbelievably rewarding experience. Please keep funding our project so we can continue to bring joy to as many seniors as possible! Thank you so much for your support. Team Infinity

project_data.project_name: Infinity ~ Fashion, Function & Fun for Senior Women

campaign.story:
From the company that brought you the RFID Blocking Cards, which was fully funded on Kickstarter in January https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/protectedcards/protected-cards-rfid-blocking-card-for-wallet-card
Introducing Protected Cards RFID Blocking V Wallet
Front, Back and Flat
The V Wallet is a super slim minimalist RFID blocking wallet that can fit in your front pocket. Because of its minimalist design the V wallet will change how you carry your cards and cash. The V wallet is made with exquisite top grade genuine pebble leather. It has 8 card holding pockets and a center "V" pocket for cash (each side has 4 card holders). 
Comes with or without a clear ID slot (ID slot V wallet has 4 card holding pockets on one side, 1 ID window pocket on the other side and a center "V" pocket for cash). 
Currently offered in Black and Camel color but will offer in other colors if the stretch goals are reached. 
We need your help with getting the word out about this project and funding to purchase the inventory to be able to bring this to market at a reasonable price. With this we are offering the wallets starting below half the MSRP of 39.99-49.99. Please ask any question you may have about this project and we will answer them as soon a we can.
STORY
It all started when my mother in law had her credit card information stolen while at an art fair in Kansas City, MO (not a large city, thieves are everywhere).  She did not lose her card or have it stolen by the thief.  They simply acquired the name, credit card numbers and expiration date with a RFID scanner.  These can be purchased for under 50 dollars online and now most smart phones can also receive this information with a free app.  Since then we started the Protected Cards Brand so others can stop this from happening for a reasonable price with different products. 
The V wallet by Protected Cards offers the same functionality and space as a traditional wallet but without the bulky design.  Shown in the picture above with 4 cards on each side and 15 bills.
Constructed with Exquisite Genuine Cowhide Pebble Leather
All of the V Wallets pockets are RFID Blocking to prevent credit card skimming
Minimalist V Wallets has 8 Card Slots (4 on each side, both sides are identical)
Wallet opens like a V in the middle to hold cash
Wallet tested with up to 16 cards and 15 bills and 2 keys
Size: 4 1/2 x 3 3/8 x 1/8 inches
Weight: ONLY 1.3oz
Size of V Wallet
Color: Black or Camel
Will provide more color options when stretch goals are met
Protected Cards Embossed on the Front of Wallet
Each wallet will come with a Protected Cards Dust Bag
Dust Bag Included with Each Wallet
 V Wallet with ID Window
V Wallet with ID Window
Minimalist V Wallets has 4 Card Slots on one side and 1 ID Window on the other side
Wallet opens like a V in the middle to hold cash
Wallet tested with 10 cards, 1 ID, and 15 bills
Size: 4 1/4 x 3 1/4 x 1/8 inches
Weight: ONLY 1oz
V Wallet with ID Window Size
 Stretch Goals
We will offer different colors for each stretch goal reached
Stretch Goal Color Options
If the campaign reaches $4,000 then we will offer a Blue color.  If the campaign reaches $6000 then we will offer a Wine Red color.  If the campaign reaches $8000 then we will offer a Cream color.  If the campaign reaches $10,000 we will offer a pink color.  Each stretch goal will be available in both the V wallet and V wallet with ID window.

Distribution
If anyone would like to distribute our V wallets please send us a message and we can work out the details for a wholesale price. 
TIMELINE
April: Lauch Kickstarter Campaign
June: Kickstarter Campaign Ends
Middle June: Survey and Finalize before Production
July: Start Production
August: Quality Control
September: Shipments to Backers
Stop RFID Signals So Your Credit Card Info is Safe
Watch this video to see how easy it is for your credit card info to be stolen by nearby devices.
 RFID Protection: The Secret to Keeping Your Data Safe!
Identity Theft is at All Time High! Unless properly shielded, your card-based data is readily available when any active reader is in range!
This RFID Blocking Card Protects Your Smart Cards from unwanted capture of data from contactless cards issued by banks, governments and other institutions such as:
* Credit or Debit (for example: MC PayPass, VISA PayWave, AMEX expresspay, INTERAC Flash, etc.)
* Enhanced driver's license, Hunting and fishing license
* Access / security control, Employee / School ID
* Health insurance, Medical ID
* Gift, Membership, Library
* Transit / Park pass
Protects against access by NFC-equipped Smartphones
Disclaimer: No RFID protection is 100% effective in all circumstances due to the constant changing in technology.

campaign.story:
Standing Tall Issue 1 Cover
  

Time To Stand Tall
Standing Tall is an entirely new action adventure story of epic scope and magnitude. Drawing upon both modern life and gritty realism, Standing Tall follows the after-effects and fallout of our anti-hero’s exploits as he unleashes his own unique approach to saving the day.
Issue 1, Money Money Money, opens with Kidd near to the start of his adventure; look forward to following him as he not only begins to find himself, but also as he sets his feet firmly upon the path that begins to open up before him.
But just who is Kidd? Some people are born into power, others grow into it. Homeless for as long as he can remember and with no knowledge of his previous life, the boy who christened himself ‘Kidd’ survived his formative years by stumbling and scrounging between gutter and wastebin. Possessing a natural talent for problem solving, the story begins to tantalizingly unravel exactly who he is, where he is originally from, and what, exactly, he has planned for those who Stand in his way!
A corrupt and dangerous cesspit, the City in which he lives is a dangerous place for anyone who lives there, but most especially for the downtrodden and exploited lower classes. Although about to experience unfathomable changes to their structure, the city’s social classes are split into three main groups:
The Replete – the rich and powerful; greedy, merciless, and corrupt beyond redemption.
The Proles – the overworked and self-absorbed; lifeless drones who endlessly toil for their masters.
The Unwashed – the homeless vagrants; those who do not fit neatly into societies strictures.
Our story unfolds with Kidd 'Standing Tall' to the life that people know and beginning to fight for the cause that he believes in. Releasing the pent up powers that had – until now – been held in check, he soon learns that he can earn a good wage with his newfound abilities. Making a conscious choice to become a vigilante, he soon becomes renowned for the merciless and unorthodox ways in which he works. 
A truly flawed hero, he has nothing but his own skewed conscience and ruthless determination to keep him going. The scum who is now the anti-hero, the torturer who has become the tortured, the weakling who has unleashed newfound power and strength; Kidd becomes a homeless man who could potentially want for nothing, yet never seems to spend a penny on himself. Who exactly provides his paycheck, how does he earn it, and what does he do with it? But most importantly, why has Kidd chosen to walk the cataclysmic road that he is?!?

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Problems

We all come across them, despite our best laid plans. Being a full-time freelance artist, however, involves working on comic book creation for 90% of my working day (and night!), which has lead to a veritbale panoply of connections to other comic book afficionados; I have learnt how to jump any number of unexpected hurdles when the time comes. 
We are a good portion through completing the first comic and fully expect everything to be completed within thirty days of this successful kickstarter, which also includes work having begun on Kidd’s second installment! Unanticipated delays, however, could possibly lead to us falling behind on page completion; if something unforeseen does happen, you have my word that this comic book WILL be made! It is a huge part of me, and I am passionate about the world getting to see it!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Right so issue 1 is finished! It will be printed and in my hand within 7 working days!  Merchandise/rewards will all be sent out as soon as the comic is in! The official release date for Standing Tall issue 1 " Money, Money,Money!" is 15th/16th October at Devcon Comic convention.But you guys will all have your issues by then both PDF and physical! 
I once again just want to thank each and every one of you for your pledges and patience with this project. I have learnt so much over the last few months, it has been a huge learning curve, but I am truly grateful to you all for your patience. 
Standing Tall Issue 2 "The Example" release will be a much smoother process and is all set to go!

Hiya everyone,
As you may know,  it's been an uphill sprint lately to get everything orderd, collected and packaged ready to go out! 
We have a main release date at same large event in Cornwall at Devcon comic convention. dates will be posted towards the middle of this month and I will be doing a tour of the UK promoting Standing Tall Issue 1 by attending events and making appearances in shops signing issue 1 and other merchandise!

Hi everyone! 
Just to let you all know we have had word from Riley the colourist that we should have the rest of the pages this week!!! 
I can only thank you for your patience and understanding with the problems and hiccups I have come up against with the release of issue 1. Silver lining is issue 2 will be a lot smoother!!

Hi all!  
Well to put it simply this hasn't run anywhere near as smoothly as we first hoped!! Artwork for issue 1 has been delayed due to personal difficulties with our A Ugo, then my mother passed away after quite a short battle with cancer, so I have a been doing an a lot of travelling visiting her and then for the funeral, also the colourist had to move house putting him out if action for as few weeks!  We are all back on track now and working very hard to get this issue out. I am so grateful to each and every one of you for your patience and support! Issue 1 will be with you by the end of August at the latest!! Sincere apologies for the delays!

As the days go by we get more and more excited at more and more rewards for Pledgers arriving!  
Its exciting to see them coming through the door and are being sorted into the correct pulls for each pledger! 
The comic book itself is on track and we can't wait to get this out to you!
