campaign.story:
//04.26.16. UPDATE//
NEW REWARD!
Want to support the campaign AND get a sweet cartoon drawing of your family in the process? Then you don't want to miss this last minute reward level we just added!
//$200 ELEVENTH HOUR FAMILY PORTRAIT PACK//
Signed copy of MOLEBASHED Season 1 plus a digital, 8X10 portrait of your family. Full-color and ready to print!
.PDF copy of MOLEBASHED Season 1!
FREE SHIPPING IN UNITED STATES!
Estimated delivery April 2017 (book will ship as soon as it arrives)
***LIMITED TO 10 BACKERS!***
ADD ON ITEMS!
Wanna add some extra value to your pledges and help us reach our funding goal at the same time? Check out these awesome pledge add-ons:
+ EXTRA BOOKS: Add additional copies of MOLEBASHED Season 1 for $10 each! Get signed copies for $15 each! (***ADD-ON AVAILABLE ONLY FOR PLEDGES OF $20 OR MORE.***)
+ SOCIAL MEDIA AVATAR: Want me to draw your social media avatar? Add $100 to your pledge and I'll make it happen! (***Avatar will include ONE person; head/shoulders shot only! ADD-ON AVAILABLE FOR ALL PLEDGE LEVELS.***)
Q: HOW THE HECK DO I ADD-ON TO MY PLEDGE?
A: To add-on an item, simply increase the amount of your pledge by the amount of the add-on. For instance, if you'd like to pledge $20 to get a book and add-on the social media avatar, simply choose the $20 book reward and adjust the amount of the pledge up to $120 to reflect the amount of the social media avatar add-on. If you've already pledged, click the "manage" button on your reward tier to adjust your pledge amount.
//04.13.16 UPDATE//
We've added TWO NEW REWARD TIERS and a NEW STRETCH GOAL! Here are the details:
NEW REWARD TIERS
//$35 ARTIST EDITION//
Signed copy of MOLEBASHED Season 1 with a drawing of all three Molebashes on an Artist Edition sketch card inside the book!
.PDF copy of MOLEBASHED Season 1!
FREE SHIPPING IN THE UNITED STATES!
Estimated delivery October 2016
//$40 ARTIST EDITION PLUS//
Signed copy of MOLEBASHED Season 1 with a drawing of all three Molebashes on an Artist Edition sketch card inside the book!
Signed print of your favorite MOLEBASHED comic strip!
.PDF copy of MOLEBASHED Season 1!
FREE SHIPPING IN THE UNITED STATES!
Estimated delivery October 2016
NEW STRETCH GOAL
If we hit $15,000, everyone who has pledged at the $20 level or higher will receive a copy of COMIX EXEGESIS: BIBLE SKETCHBOOK 1 at NO ADDITIONAL COST! A lot of folks have asked me to publish my Bible illustrations and I listened!
Hurry! I'm only making a short run of this book; once they're gone, THEY'RE GONE! Pledging to this campaign is your best chance to secure your copy!
//04.03.16 UPDATE//
I've had a few folks ask me what the Artist's Edition Sketch Cards will look like for the Artist's Editions of the book (starting at only $50!). Well, here they are! The cards will measure 5"X7" and will be printed on heavy card stock. They're gonna look SHARP!
----------
MOLEBASHED is a comic strip about fatherhood by Wes Molebash. It's about that season in a dad's life when he feels the responsibility of fatherhood but he's still getting comfortable with the title. The first season of the strip kicks off with the birth of Wes’ son, Parker, and - together with his wife, Kari - Wes must ensure that his child thrives in a warm, loving environment with plenty of food and water. Parenthood is hard! But it’s also hilarious! So at least it has THAT going for it.
Together, we’re going to raise the funds to publish the first collection of MOLEBASHED comic strips and essays titled MOLEBASHED Season 1! The book will collect the entire first season of the comic strip (August 2015-April 2016) and feature plenty of extras, including a foreword by Michael Jantze, creator of The Norm! Not only will this be the first MOLEBASHED collection, it’ll also be my first book in SIX YEARS! I’m psyched!
One of the nice things about self-publishing the book is that it will look exactly the way I want it to: a sturdy paperback cover with a matte finish and French folds, matte interior pages, Bluetooth… OK, it won’t have Bluetooth, but it’s gonna be a sharp-lookin’ book! Even if you never read it, your friends will be super impressed by how cool it looks on your shelf!
For you book nerds, here are the specs:
Dimensions: 9" X 9" 
Cover: 135 lb text, Matte, French Folds
Interior pages: 85 lb matte text, Full Color, Full Bleed
Page Count: 148
Wes Molebash is a first-time father in his mid-thirties. A big kid at heart, he wants nothing more than to be a great father and an attentive husband. Though it seems he’s taken to fatherhood quite naturally, don’t be fooled by his calm demeanor; he’s screaming on the inside.
SIDENOTE: The Cartoon Version of Wes is about 10% more interesting and 20% thinner than Real Life Wes.
Kari Molebash is an amazing wife and mother. Not only does she work part time, but she runs the household, manages the bills, and ensures the safety of both her “boys”.
SIDENOTE: The Cartoon Version of Kari is NOWHERE NEAR AS COOL as Real Life Kari.
Parker Molebash is an infant. He loves to sleep, drink milk, and spit up.
SIDENOTE: The Cartoon Version of Parker is pretty darn accurate.
You want rewards? We got ‘em! There’s a whole slew of reward levels that you can scroll through on the right side of the screen. Some highlights include a copy of the book for pledging as little as $20 to the campaign, and some nice premium awards for the hardcore fans and book retailers such as original MOLEBASHED artwork, custom social media avatars, and book packs with deep discounts! So make sure to check out ALL the rewards to see which one tickles your fancy!
“'MOLEBASHED' features a reliable narrator because he’s a real person. It’s Wes. And Kari. And Parker. It’s a window for Wes to shout from, but a mirror for the rest of us. We’ve been there, are there or will be there: It’s that simple."
     - Michael Jantze [from the foreword] (The Norm)
"Wes has created that strip the internet (and the world) needs right now: a funny, loving, crazy, silly, cute, adorable strip about young people making even younger people and surviving it one day at a time. If you've been there, like me, it will bring it all back, but if you haven't yet, it will make you want to be there! Oh- and it looks like Michael Jantze's and Bill Watterson's love child - how great is that?! "      
     - Tom Bancroft (Disney Animation Vet, Character Designer, Webcomicker, Author, Podcaster)
"I don't read many webcomics. If you know that, and you know me, you might not think that I'd regularly follow a slice-of-life webcomic about a mild-mannered, church-positive couple and their baby, but you'd be dead wrong. With MOLEBASHED, Wes has created something that he very clearly cares about, and he manages to make even the most mundane task or child-friendly observation funny. And I needn't say anything about the art; Wes' style has always been a draw, and his delicious color scheme on MOLEBASHED is icing on the art cake!"
     - Danielle Corsetto (Girls With Slingshots)
"MOLEBASHED is a comic I faithfully follow, and quite honestly I don't follow a whole lot. The artist, Wes Molebash, is a down-to-earth guy who keeps his strip clean, minimal, friendly and full of heart. It's just himself, his wife and baby... and a six-color color scheme. Webcomics have mostly been dominated by fanboy gamer culture and a swarm of disenfranchised misanthropes, while MOLEBASHED represents a rising revolution that returns to the beauty of everyday slices of life in the tradition of the Sunday comics we grew up with. It has my highest recommendation."
     - Matthew Paul Mewhorter (Cancer Owl)
"I can't think of many more occupations in life that need to be approached with a good sense of humor than being a husband and father. Wes' strip MOLEBASHED delivers all the charm and humor of raising a young family, but spares me from having to change the diapers."
     - Anthony Holden (freelance story and development artist)
“… sharp artwork, wry observations on being a parent and — to my mind — incredibly true-to-life observations about the supreme comedy of raising a human.”
     - Lucas Wetzel (Laugh Tracks GoComics Blog)
“[MOLEBASHED is] a delight, warm, funny and sweet.”
     - Richard Bruton (Forbidden Planet)
The primary goal for this project is to raise $12,500. With that money we'll be able to print a run of MOLEBASHED Season 1 books. But if we go above and beyond the initial $12.5K, here's what I plan to do with the moola:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are risks in everything we do in life, but I’ve done my darnedest to minimize them for this project. I’ve been putting the book together as each monthly batch of comics is created, so the book will be ready to go to print by the time this campaign concludes. There’s always a chance the books could get delayed in transit somewhere, but I’ve left some wiggle room in the estimated ship dates. If everything goes according to plan, everyone will get their books sooner than anticipated! How rad would that be?! That’s right! Pretty dang rad!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey, everybody!
Well, it took a little longer than I had originally planned, but I'm happy to announce that ALL PHYSICAL REWARDS HAVE SHIPPED to those folks who've filled out the survey! I just got back from the Post Office where I dropped off the last bundle of books, prints, and original artwork. If you're one of the few people still waiting to receive your copy of the book, you should receive it sometime in the next 2-5 business days. Thanks for your patience!

Happy Monday, everybody!
Here's a quick update on where we're at in the shipping process of MOLEBASHED Season 1!
So far, we have shipped the books from the following tiers:
$20 Book Tier
$20 Early Backer Reward Tier (signed copy)
$25 Signed Copy Tier
$35 Artist's Edition Tier
$50 Retailer Pack Tier

What's up, everybody?!
The surveys for MOLEBASHED Season 1 have been sent out to all backers who are receiving rewards in the mail. Check your email inboxes and junk mail folders to make sure you've received yours!
As for the books, it's been a little over a month since I received notification that they left the factory in China. I'm expecting them to arrive stateside ANY DAY NOW. Once they do, it'll be approximately before they arrive at my door. There's unfortunately no tracking information while the books are on the ocean, so I can only go by the shipping estimates my printer gave me when the order was placed. So far, my experience with Print Ninja has been AMAZING, and I'm not anticipating any hiccups in delivery!

updates.update_userinfo: A copy of MOLEBASHED has been spotted in the wild!
updates.update_content:
What's up, MOLEBASHED Backers!
Just received notification that MOLEBASHED Season 1 has left the printer in China and is now on a boat headed to the Americas! When it has landed on the shores of Califor-NI-AY, it will decide if it wants to be a banker from Boston or a farmer from Ohio. Once the choice is made, the shipment will name all the members of its party, buy some supplies, and head east toward my house. Will the shipment of books decide to caulk the wagon and fjord the river? Will its wife die of dysentery? If so, what will it write on her tombstone? The only thing I know for sure is that I should receive the shipment in approximately 6 weeks!

updates.update_userinfo: Take a good look at MOLEBASHED Season 1 because it's on a $%^@#$ BOAT!
updates.update_content:
Hey, everybody!
MOLEBASHED Season 1 is officially at the printer! We're a little bit behind schedule because I took some extra time to make a few tweaks and double-check everything. But the final product is gonna look SO GOOD, you guys! Be excited!
You may have noticed that you haven't received your survey yet. I was advised by a few folks who have successful Kickstarters on their resumes that I should wait until the book is ready to ship to send out the surveys. You'll confirm your address when you fill out your survey, so waiting a little longer will help keep things simple in case any of you move or change your shipping address this summer.

Hey, everybody!
Wanted to give you a quick update now that I've had a some time to process and plan the next steps!
You should all have noticed your debit/credit cards being charged. While these charges take place almost immediately after the campaign ends, I've learned it actually takes up to TWO WEEKS before I receive the funds from the campaign. So we've got about another week before I'll have the money in my account and am able to pay the printer for the books. Once I've sent the files and have paid the printer, we'll play a 3-month waiting game for the books to arrive.

campaign.story:
20 DAY KICKSTARTER TO RAISE FUNDS FOR LETTERING 'THE AMAZING JOY BUZZARDS & THE TUNISIAN LAVA SQUIRREL' ISSUE 1
The world's greatest rock 'n roll adventure band are back in this digital single issue series, with girl-magnet Biff on guitar and vocals, tough guy Stevo on bass, and four-eyed genius Gabe on drums - not to mention their mythical Mexican wrestler genie, El Campeon - the Amazing Joy Buzzards hop from one fast-paced adventure to the next, living life to the fullest!
This is a 'Lost Book' from the Amazing Joy Buzzards book that I started years ago with artist Cristian A. Gonzalez titled 'The Tunisian Lava Squirrel'. Mary Cagle did the colors, and Ryan Schrodt is scripting the dialogue.
We are doing digital single issues on Kickstarter to pay for the rest of the colors and letters for the book. There are 100 pages that are finished for art and 32 pages have been colored. There are about 40-60 pages left for story but we may bring in a guest artist with a similar style to finish the book if Cristian is unable to finish it. We plan to do digital issues a couple times a year to complete the book. 
For this Kickstarter the colors have been paid for on the first issue and we're trying to raise $600 to cover the lettering costs (and Kickstarter and shipping fees) on the first 26 pages so we don't have to pay out of pocket. 
Anything raised over this amount will go towards the colors on the next book. We're offering digital PDF files of other books and printed copies of New Brighton Archeological Society Books 1 and 2 in Hardcover format to raise funds to finish issue #1.
LETTERED PAGES FROM THE FIRST ISSUE (NOT IN ORDER)
You can pick up two beautiful Hardcover editions of New Brighton Archeological Society 1 & 2 for $35 to help fund this project (If we sell 17 sets of Hardcovers we got this)
Pick up New Brighton Archeological Society Books 1 and 2 as Hardcovers
 Or Pick up a Digital Package

campaign.story:
'The New Brighton Archeological Society' is the critically acclaimed all ages graphic novel illustrated by Matthew Weldon and written by Mark Smith.
OWN TWO BEAUTIFUL HARDCOVER BOOKS FOR $25.00
 We're raising funds by offering printed Hardcover copies of 'New Brighton Archeological Society' books 1 & 2 to print 'Gladstone's School for World Conquerors'. 
READ BOOK 1 'THE CASTLE OF GALOMAR' HERE FOR FREE: 
 ------> http://tinyurl.com/gsrr955 <--------- 
READ BOOK 2 'THE SWORD OF AZURE' HERE FOR FREE: 
 ------> http://tinyurl.com/jo3d2vp <---------
'New Brighton Archeological Society' is graphic novel with an innate child-like sense of adventure, wonder and humor. Smith incorporates fire-breathing dragons, talking slugs, old-style puppet shows, swarthy eye patches, crossbows and dashing sword fights where the bad guy gets tied up as if in an old western movie. There’s no blood and gore in these books, only Matthew Weldon’s sumptuously colored illustrations which transport the reader to fantasy locales.
Book One, The Castle of Galomar, follows Cooper, Benny, Becca, Jossie and a butterscotch-loving goblin named Mitch through the forest and into the bowels of Galomar’s castle. Book Two, 'The Sword of Azure', includes an epic zeppelin dogfight. Fairies, goblins and magic abound. These books are thrilling for young readers and adults alike. Come capture a bit of your own childhood on this wild ride with the 'New Brighton Archeological Society'.
Fantasy-Action-Adventure Novels meets the fun of classic Chris Claremont X-Men comics
New Brighton Archeological Society Book 2 Cover.
 'NEW BRIGHTON ARCHEOLOGICAL SOCIETY BOOKS' 1 & 2 ARE PRINTED AND IN AMAZON INVENTORY FOR SHIPPING
We're being very transparent that these books ARE PRINTED AND SHIPPING THROUGH AMAZON FULFILLMENT
This means after the Kickstarter you should receive your books in about a week if you live in the U.S.A.
Printed Hardcovers!!! Get your Printed Hardcovers!!!
What is this Kickstarting? This is a Kickstarter to recoup of printing costs for Hardcover Editions of New Brighton Archeological Society Books 1 & 2. 
The money recouped will go towards printing of Hardcover editions for Gladstone's School for World Conquerors.  $4,000 is our low goal to print the first book.  With this goal I still need to chip in and help fund printing. $8,000 is the secondary goal for printing Gladstone's book 1 to have enough money after Kickstarter fees and shipping. 
If we reach a higher goal of $16,000 we can print Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Book 2 in addition to book 1. (Gladstone's Book 3 is also finished but we'd have to raise a lot to print all 3 at once and better to take smaller steps.)
IN SHORT: The print copies of New Brighton Archeological Society Books 1 & 2 are Kickstarting the printing of Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Book 1 in Hardcover format.  If we reach $16,000 we can print book 2.  If not, it's not the end of the world; that's a Kickstarter for another day. 
THE PRINTED BOOKS:
Own them today!!!
Pick up New Brighton Archeological Society Hardcovers and join the adventure!!!
See what people are saying about "New Brighton Archeological Society"!!!
"NBAS is such a great book - it appeals to a really wide audience. And unlike some comic books targeted at kids, it doesn’t treat kids as fragile or unintelligent. All the main characters in New Brighton Archeological Society are very young, but also very capable." Geek Dad Blog
"It's great for younger comics fans looking for heroes who aren't wearing spandex. He also tosses in enough fantasy elements, including dragons, goblins, a giant frog and a magical slug, to pique the imagination." -Washington Post
"The New Brighton Archeological Society by Mark Andrew Smith and Matthew Weldon is one of the very best all ages graphic novels in years. It proves that there can be an outlet to introduce kids to the world of picture-based story telling without pandering to them or horrifying their innocent sensibilities." Boing Boing
"Mark Andrew Smith and Matthew Weldon have all the ingredients for success in "New Brighton": a spunky group of kids with lots of free time, a wild world ripe for exploration, fantastic creatures culled from various faerie tales, and dangers that manage to be scary without being truly terrifying. It's the sort of book we're quite certain we'd love when we were little, but get a kick out of reading now, too." Rick Marshall of MTV'S SPLASH PAGE
"I want to live in the world Smith writes. He’s also got a fantastic imagination and has created a fun world full of good goblins, evil faeries, man-eating house cats, evil treasure-hunters, sprawling mansions, enchanted estates, horrible monsters, secret rooms, and hidden libraries full of forbidden knowledge. And it’s up to four pre-adolescent kids to navigate their way safely through all of it in order to preserve their families’ legacies." Robot 6 @Comic Book Resources
2 Signed and Sketched Hardcovers by Matthew Weldon at the $60 Level!!!
2 Signed and Sketched Hardcovers by Matthew Weldon at the $60 Level!!!
Pages from New Brighton Archeological Society Book 2
Double Splash Page
More gorgeous New Brighton Archeological Society Book 2 Art:
Own them today!!!
Please take a moment to share 'New Brighton Archeological Society' with your friends on Facebook and Twitter by clicking the 'Like' & 'Tweet' buttons above.
By sharing 'New Brighton' you're helping us to educate the public about the project and helping us to get one step closer to our quest of 'world domination.'
'New Brighton Archeoloigcal Society' TM & (C) Matthew Weldon & Mark Smith.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
New Brighton is printed, in Amazon's inventory, and we know the prices for shipping. Money raised on this Kickstarter will fund the printing for a new series of books. Rewards are quickly deliverable and do not have to be made.

We did a Kickstarter for New Brighton a few years ago, and Image Comics dropped out as the publisher. We also made the mistake of Kickstarting when there were only 40 black and white completed pages of art and the book was far from completed.

We printed the books ourselves out of our own pockets and honored every commitment.

We upgraded the books to the nice Hardcover format and delivered all books to those who responded to an update of address, and shipped to the previous address of the original backers. 

Basically, they got a much nicer book as a thank you for the delay and waiting. It's now a personal mission to Kickstart faster and smarter with completed projects.

As of now with the books printed, this is a zero risk Kickstarter.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
A Vampire in Hollywood, And Other Tales of Supernatural Law by Batton Lash
Introduction by Jeff Smith
192 pages, b/w interior
Beware the creatures of the night—They have lawyers! Alanna Wolff and Jeff Byrd have an unusual law practice: defending monsters and the supernaturally afflicted! A Vampire in Hollywood is volume 7 in this ongoing graphic novel series that mixes humor, horror, and the law to produce a unique and fun reading experience. The previous volumes collect issues 1-40 and the spinoff series Mavis 1-4. This volume collects Supernatural Law issues 41-45 and Mavis 5.
Contents
Issue 41: “The Works Speak for Themselves” First Amendment issues come to the fore in an unusual way as Alanna Wolff and Jeff Byrd are called in when works of art begin to talk, make chit-chat, and sound off! This special free speech issue was also used as a fund-raiser for the Comic Book Legal Defense Fund. This issue also marks the first appearance of Desmond, the new receptionist.
Issue 41
Issue 42: “Werewolves . . . and the Women Who Love Them” and “Stakeout” In the first story, “Dr. Fill” interviews a woman who has a thing for werewolves, especially “Lawrence T,” one of Wolff & Byrd’s clients. The second story introduces fifth-generation vampire Christopher Leach who is trying to come to terms with his heritage while W&B protect him from the press. [Note: This story is also included in Zombie Wife in color.]
issue 42
Issue 43: “A Vampire in Hollywood” Vampire Christopher Leach has become a celebrity and heads to Hollywood to star in his own biopic but ends up being accused of murder, engaging in a high-speed freeway chase, and encountering a vampire lord. [Note: This story is also included in Zombie Wife in color.]
Issue 43
Issue 44: “Wolff & Byrd: The Movie” While they’re in Hollywood on behalf of their vampire client, Wolff and Byrd find out that a movie is being made based on their law firm. Who’s behind it? What’s got them frightened? In the course of the issue, we get to see four different movie pitches—each scarier than the next, and each based on true pitches Batton received from Hollywood producers.
Issue 44
What if a Wolff & Byrd movie was done in the style of Sin City?
Issue 45: “The People v. Toxic Avenger” Wolff and Byrd have a change of venue when they travel to Tromaville to defend none other than the Toxic Avenger! But can they prevail in a courtroom presided over by Judge Lloyd Kaufman?
Issue 45
Mavis 5: “Weird Eye for the Normal Guy” Mavis gets to leave work early for once and plans to spend the evening with her main squeeze, Taylor Christopher. But she has forgotten a prior promise to an old high school friend to attend a birthday party that has some surprise guests: “The Creeps,” a spooky trio of W&B clients.
Mavis 5
Funding for this book will be used to complete the production work (preparing files for the printer); pay for the printing, shipping, and storage of the books; and cover production costs of backer premiums.
What You Get
You can support this project by signing up to become the Hollywood player your choice, from gaffer to publicist to producer. At the “Supporting Player” level, you’ll get a set of six postcards depicting the covers of the six comics included in this collection. To get the book (signed by Batton) with the set of postcards, choose the “Key Grip” level. If you want a personalized drawing in your book, select the “Special FX” level.
Other premiums available include your choice from among the other Supernatural Law trade paperbacks (Tales of Supernatural Law, The Soddyssey, Sonovawitch, The Vampire Brat, Mister Negativity, The Monsters Meet on Court Street, A Werewolf in New York, Zombie Wife) and these special items (which you can also get as Add-Ons):
The Red Book: Wolff & Byrd Counselors of the Macabre first strip collection (64 pages 8 ½ x 11, b/w) Published in 1987 by Andrion Books, this book contains strips that appeared in The National Law Journal and The Brooklyn Paper in the mid-1980s. Wolff & Byrd defend a vampire dentist, go to L.A. for an est-like experience, encounter a young man possessed by Clarence Darrow, and deal with ghosts, witches, time travelers, werewolves, the undead—and Ronald Coleman? Plus: The introduction of Mavis!
Tales from the Vault (60 pages, 6½ x 9½, b/w) Contents include: three stories that originally appeared as Wolff & Byrd strips in 1993 in The National Law Journal: “The Twinkle Zone,” “Jeff in Heaven,” and “Here Come the Loppitts” (Batton is surprised to this day that the Law Journal let him run the Loppitt story—you’ll see why when you read it!); three strips published in Polyhedron magazine in 1990 and 1991; a previously unpublished Mavis story; the Ditko-esque “Griswell’s Demon” inked by Steve Ditko (!!), which appeared in Satan’s Six #1 published in 1993 by Topps; and “My Husband Killed Me and Now He Must Pay—Damages!” (originally published on supernaturallaw.com and reprinted in color in Zombie Wife). The color back cover is a Little Nemo parody.
Supernatural Law 2017 calendar: This 9” x 12” calendar will consist 12 images featuring Alanna Wolff, Jeff Byrd, Mavis, and your favorite monster clients.
French or Spanish edition: The French edition collects the first four issue of the Wolff & Byrd comic book series in color; the Spanish edition collects the first eight issues in black and white (same contents as Tales of Supernatural Law).
French edition
Spanish edition
Supernatural Law T-shirts Choose from five different shirts produced over the years by Graphitti Designs (so you know they’re high quality!): The popular movie poster-style shirt; “You’re Going to Hear From My Lawyers!”; “My Lawyers Are Scarier Than Your Lawyers” (image is on back with W&B logo on front); Zombie Wife; and the white cap-sleeve Mavis T (available in women’s sizes S, M, and L). Supplies are limited on some of these shirts; XXL is $4 more.
Back of shirt; front has Wolff & Byrd logo at top left
Two more designs to choose from
The Zombie Wife T
Add-Ons:
At any level, you can add on one of these items for the additional pledge amount listed. Just increase your total pledge to include the add-on(s).
pdf of The Werewolf of New York or Zombie Wife (both are full color): $8
The Red Book: $10
Tales from the Vault: $12
2017 Calendar: $15
French or Spanish edition: $18
T-shirt (your choice of design: $20 for S, M, X, L, or XL ($24 for XXL)
Personalized drawing in any book: $30
A 32-page pinup booklet, with color covers and black-and-white interior: $25.
The booklet features drawings that comics pros have done of Wolff, Byrd, Mavis, and their clients over the years. Artists included are Paul Pope, Frank Cho, Rick Geary, Roger Langridge, Shannon Wheeler, Donna Barr, Terry Moore, Michael T. Gilbert, Stan Sakai, Lea Hernandez, Brian Michael Bendis, and many more.
Pinup booklet
Bendis pinup
Jeff Smith pinup
ALL GONE!: The 100-page Supernatural Law Companion (6” x 9”): $17.00. This book, updated in 2015, provides synopses and background on every issue of the Wolff & Byrd/Supernatural Law and Mavis comic books and books, plus information on other appearances of the characters, cover sketches, and other goodies. NONE LEFT!
Original painting: At any level, add $150 to your pledge, and Batton will do a 9" x 12" acrylic painting for you, with your choice of subject! You can request Wolff & Byrd, monsters, even superheroes. (Be aware that paintings take time, so fulfillment of this item may take longer than the promised date listed for your chosen level.)
Here are some samples of past commissions:
What they’ve said about Supernatural Law
“Battonʼs keen sense of humor is what makes his work so good and so enduring.” —Will Eisner
“Supernatural Law gets me laughing out loud every time!” —Frank Miller
“Wolff & Byrd is funny and smart. . . . the finest funny supernatural fiction ever created.” —Neil Gaiman
"Few things in life turn out be a reliable source of intelligent delight. Supernatural Law has a secure place on that short roster." —Michael Chabon
“Supernatural Law is so good, so much fun, such an accessible, dynamite concept that I can’t figure out why it hasn’t been snapped up and turned into a TV series or a smash-hit movie and maybe even a theme park ride or two.” —Jonathan Ross
“I like Wolff and Byrd because they tend to do the right thing. They take on the system on behalf of the outcasts, the “different” ones, the rejects . . . They defend the sanctity of the individual and (as long as he, she, or it doesn’t initiate force) the right to be different.” —F. Paul Wilson
“At first blush, a book about lawyers representing classic monsters might be suspected of being as broad and slapstick as my cherished “Abbott & Costello Meet Frankenstein.” But instead, Batton has derived humor out of characters and those characters continue to grow and evolve, refusing to remain one-joke sitcom stars or pre-Stan Lee cardboard comic book heroes. There is not only humor in his work, but satire, sarcasm, and parody. It’s all just so damn clever, and has been so for more than thirty-five years.” —Michael Uslan
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our goal is to get the book printed in time for Comic-Con in San Diego in July. That means production will be on a tight schedule, but it also means that backers who are at the show will be able to pick up their book (and some of the backer rewards in person at the Exhibit A Press booth. The other challenge is fulfilling international orders, but having done a few Kickstarter projects, we think we have that figured out.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: The "Grandfathered In" Kickstarter ends tomorrow morning. So this is your last chance to back the project or to add backer rewards! How about that cool Graphitti Designs purple T-shirt? Or maybe you'd like to add the original, personalized drawing, the 16-month calendar, or the first ever SLaw Sketch Book. Seize the moment!

updates.update_userinfo: Only 66 Hours Left in the "Grandfathered In" Campaign!
updates.update_content:
Yes, less than 3 days left in the campaign, and just $162 needed to reach the stretch goal of $13,000! If you've already backed the project, thank you! If you've been meaning to back it but haven't gotten around to it, you have until Monday morning to do so. You can get just the new graphic novel, or you can choose from such backer rewards as the new T-shirt, the Supernatural Law sketchbook, the 16-month calendar, previous SLaw trades, and more . . .
Check it out!
Best,
Batton and Jackie

For the last week of the Grandfathered In Kickstarter campaign, we have a special treat: the first new Supernatural Law T in several years! These are high-quality purple men's-style shirts from Bob Chapman and Graphitti Designs, available in Small, Medium, Large, XL, and XXL ($3 more for that size). We're offering the shirts at a new level (Apparition, $40) or as an add-on ($20).
We'd like to raise enough additional money to produce enough shirts so that they can be available for sale on the Exhibit A Press website and at shows as well as being backer rewards. So who wants a shirt?

The campaign for the new Supernatural Law graphic novel was going great guns, but pledges seem to have come to a halt in the last few days, with just $300 needed to reach the initial goal of $11,000.
The campaign still has 8 days to go, and we hope to announce a new backer reward/add-on tomorrow. Meanwhile, if you haven't pledged yet but have been meaning to do so, please check out the rewards. And we encourage everyone to share the link on FB and Twitter if you are so inclined.

The Kickstarter campaign for the all-new full-color Supernatural Law graphic novel Grandfathered In has two weeks to go. Backers have pledged over $8,000, but we still have another $3,000 to go. Have you checked it out yet? There are several rewards to choose from, including other books in the SLaw library.
Do you have suggestions for other rewards? We'd love to hear them!
Thanks so much for your past support!

We're off and running with Kickstarter to raise funds for the new Supernatural Law graphic novel, Grandfathered In. Check out the campaign here, and feel free to share with friends!
Thank you so much for your past support!
Batton and Jackie

Later this month Exhibit A Press will be launching a Kickstarter campaign to fund the first completely new Supernatural Law graphic novel in 5 years! Before we do that, we would love your input on what would appeal to you as backer rewards. In the past we have offered notepads, postcards, bookmarks, pin sets, calendars, T-shirts, personalized drawings, and a pinup book, among other items.
What are your thoughts/preferences? Reply to this update, or email us at mail@exhibitapress.com . We look forward to hearing from you!

This link should work!
Jackie

Exhibit A Press published a new Supernatural Law collection "The Missing Links" as a limited-edition book just for this year's San Diego Comic-Con. The 80-page trade paperback contains three Wolff & Byrd stories that previously appeared in other places and are now out of print: “The Life-Partner of Frankenstein” (full color; W&B represent a Frankenstein monster and his “bride” who are refused a marriage license), “Bright Lights, Big Feet” (full-color Bigfoot story), and “Supernatural Law 101” (how Alanna and Jeff first met, and their first case!). And in honor of Will Eisner's centennial, the book contains tributes to him by both Batton (who had Will for a teacher at the School of Visual Arts) and Jackie (who administers the Eisner Awards).

campaign.story:
“Bloody, dirty, revenge. This isn’t your father’s talking rabbit, no this is 'Gears & Bones'. A high urban fantasy that is a mix of Final Fantasy with Conan the Barbarian (as a rabbit) making out with Princess Zelda, and with a touch of The Count of Monte Cristo.” - Andrew P. Anderson
Hi, I’m Andrew P. Anderson, and I am the writer of “Gears & Bones” here at Guardian Knight Comics. We’re here to ask for your help. One of our flagship titles “Gears & Bones” is nearing the end of its first story arc. The individual issues are coming out through Diamond Previews, but paying for a print run of a trade paperback is expensive. It’s even more expensive since this is a 144 page beast of a first volume.
“That looks WILD! Seriously, THAT'S how to open a story!”- Chuck Dixon, (Winter World, Batman, Airboy)
About Gears and Bones:
“In these pages are the blood soaked adventures of Bones, Pirate of the eight skies. Read on, if you dare, stories of murder, betrayal, mad kings and dragon gods who play the chess board of existence! Against all this, Bones fights to live free… and forge his fate. “ - The Teller
This story is something that we had to create, that we needed to. Our studio is a collection of nerds that grew up on a daily diet of awesome! All the major food groups were there.*Conan the Barbarian *Final Fantasy *The Legend of Zelda *Thundercats *The Pirates of Dark Water *Legend *The Lord of the Rings * Willow!
You put all that cool content into the young minds of future creatives and you're going to get a cool comic! And this first story arc is just the beginning. We have a ton of stories to tell, great adventures all embedded within the heart of our fandom.
So here’s the deal, The artwork is done, the last issue is being colored and lettered, and we’re currently assembling them into a trade. So hopefully there will not be any delays in getting the books to you because, well, the hard work is done. Also the first four issues have been released into stores and are available digitally already, so you can get a first hand look at exactly what we’re doing.
The Campaign
Most of the work is finished, the artwork is done. The hard part is over. This campaign is designed to raise funds to print the trade, and ship them out to the backers that supported us. 
Meet The Team:
Our team consists of amazing people who have worked in the industry for years.
Alfredo "Apple" De La Fuente Founder of Guardian Knight Comics & creator of 'Gears & Bones'
Andrew P. Anderson the writer has previously done some work at 215ink. He enjoys long walks in his mind.
Montos, the artist for 'Gears & Bones', previously worked on Poison Elves, but has really found his “voice” on this project.
Colorist/Editor In Chief Wes Hartman has worked for all the major and indie publishers (DC, Marvel, Aspen, IDW, Antarctic Press, Zenescope, etc) for 13 years and has created and written Sky Sharks and served as writer for I Hunt Monsters & more.
Colorist Tony Galvan lends his talents to coloring as well. Tony has also done numerous webcomics has also just completed coloring Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The High School Years, Freaks and Geeks from Dark Horse.
Editor Austin Rogers previously did Engines of Doom with 215ink and various anthologies and self published work. He is now one of the writers and co-creators on Moon Streak.

Preview Pages
Cover Gallery

Also included in this pack is a copy of the book as well as the pdf versions of the book and the artist edition, the cover gallery card set, signed book plate, and the original short stories by Andrew P. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
What are some of the risks?

Hardly any, like we said the artwork is done, so the hard part is over. now its time to raise the funds to print the trade. We’re not going to lie, we want to see this project get backed and we want these books in your hands, ours too, but mostly yours. There is very little risk to you. The book is in the final stages of assembling right now. Once the project is funded we will send it immediately to the printer and get them made. If the project is not funded we don’t get your money and we don’t make the book, or we try again later. We will be printing overseas, there’s always a chance for printing delays, but printing overseas does take a little bit longer to get the books shipped to us, 8-12 weeks as it is slow boated across the ocean, and when we get them we will send them to you. The only risk to you is if the ship sinks, then what can you do, but that doesn’t happen too often. There are no bells and whistles on the project by design, no t-shirts, posters, knick knacks, or thingamabobs, the book is what we all want and we are confident that it’s all that is needed. We did not want to slow down sending books out to you by waiting on the production of “other stuff” so as soon as they come in they go out.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

We would like to take this time to say thank you to everyone who backed our project and showed support. Thank you to everyone who spread the word and told your friends. Thank you to everyone who was just exploring Kickstarter and just so happened to stumble across our indie comic book "Gears & Bones" Vol. 1. Even though we did not fully fund our first project, we don't plan on giving up. We WILL be back with a relaunch, but that won't be until about April (maybe later). Looking into cutting shipping cost; cooler things to throw into each tier so you will get more "bang for your buck"; possibly more original artwork bundles; or even cooler crazy random prizes that will make you say, "Hmm... So crazy it just might work."

campaign.story:
This new edition of The Famous Monsters Chronicles is officially licensed and endorsed by Philip Kim and Famous Monsters of Filmland magazine. And we are proud and delighted to have Basil Gogos as our cover artist and the one and only Jim Warren, the creator and owner of Warren Publishing Company; supplying an unprecedented exclusive interview.
The Famous Monsters Chronicles is a celebration of the magazine that was an inspiration for several generations of writers, filmmakers, artists, directors, producers, publishers and an entire host of creative types.   
On a personal level, I can honestly say that growing up with Famous Monsters magazine was one of my reasons for starting FantaCo Enterprises and going into publishing. It (and Jim Warren) had a MAJOR impact on my life.
The original Famous Monster Chronicles book was published in 1991. Forry Ackerman was alive and graciously signed some of our hardcover editions.Those editions now command high prices on the collectors market.
Although we never announced it as such in 1991- The Famous Monsters Chronicles was actually issue #6 in the FantaCo Chronicles Series started back in 1981. We will be making that notation in this volume as there are more Chronicles issues planned.
The editor of this book, Dennis Daniel, is a CLIO Award winning writer, actor and director of radio and television commercials. During the 1980’s and 90’s he was also an active horror journalist, writing for publications like DEEP RED, THE DEEP RED HORROR HANDBOOK, FANGORIA, GORE ZONE, FILM THREAT, FILMFAX, PSYCHOTRONIC VIDEO, FILMS IN REVIEW, THE COMICS JOURNAL AND THE COMICS BUYER’S GUIDE. He was a flesh eating “Garage Mechanic” zombie in the Tom Savini 1990 remake of NOTLD. He appears in Roy Frumkes’ seminal Romero documentary THE DEFINITIVE DOCUMENT OF THE DEAD.
Editor Dennis Daniel battles Forry Ackerman over who would edit the original Famous Monsters Chronicles book.
Dennis has been hard at work getting ALL NEW interviews for this edition- such as the lengthy and informative interview with Tom Savini (photographed with his personal FM collection below). You will be delighted with the folks he has lined up!!    
Tom Savini with his complete Famous Monsters collection.
Plus for this new edition we have a very useful article on collecting Famous Monsters of Filmland magazines written by John Walter Szpunar, the author of the extremely popular Xerox Ferox book.
And of course there is the complete index to EVERY issue of the original Famous Monsters of Filmland magazine published from 1958 (#1) through 1983 (#191).   
This 8 1/2" X 11" book will be over 200 pages thick (and even larger if we exceed our goal). ALL BOOKS OFFERED THROUGH THIS CAMPAIGN ARE KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVES. They are strictly limited and designed to become treasured collector's items.
So join us in the celebration!! We are making these special edition books JUST FOR YOU!!
Click this link to listen to our radio commercial written and performed by the book's editor, Dennis Daniel. http://www.landfordproductions.com/WAF/dennyd/FM%20Chronicles.mp3
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
90% of the interviews are complete and are being transcribed. The index is complete. This means that much of what will appear in this book is ready for production at this point in time.
Our challenges are the final layout and production of the books as well as the lengthy time to print overseas and receive the books back here for shipment. The Leather-bound books are being assembled by hand in the United States and will require extra time.
Although we have estimated our delivery times accordingly- delays are always a possibility.

campaign.story:
My name’s Roger McKenzie and welcome to my world of TOTAL FRENZY! Like you, I remember fondly how comic books used to be. Fun. Exciting. Imaginative experiences that took us on a roller coaster ride of thrills!
Roger McKenzie's Total Frenzy Comics #1
Those days are back again, with the release of Roger McKenzie’s Total Frenzy #1. Which is where YOU come in. Because I can’t do it alone. I need your help. But more about that in a moment. First a little something about me.
I cut my professional “writing teeth” back in the day at Warren Publishing, with many stories appearing in Creepy, Eerie, and Vampirella. From there, I went to DC and Marvel Comics… where I put the devil in Daredevil… America back in Captain America… brought Battlestar Galactica to the comic page… and even used those aforementioned teeth scripting Tomb of Dracula!
For the last few years I’ve been helping launch a brand new comic book company… CHARLTON NEO, along with my partners in mayhem, Mort Todd and Paul Kupperberg! We have already released several outstanding comics, like The Charlton Arrow, Wild Frontier, Paul Kupperberg’s Secret Romance and Unusual Suspense available at Amazon, Indyplanet, and ComiXology!... with more on the way! We also do PIX-C Digital Comics… currently over 15 strips with new installments appearing weekly!
They'll remind you of a time back when comic books were… well, fun! I remember those days. When you opened that new comic, it was pure magic! But it seems to me, and I bet to you as well, that over the years the magic has dimmed.
That’s why I’m releasing my first new comic book in a quarter of a century- ROGER MCKENZIE’S TOTAL FRENZY COMICS! Featuring not one… but TWO… great new series:
SPOOKMAN, with art by Sandy (Men In Black) Carruthers, is a mind-blowing journey into growing terror as a creature once thought just an urban legend becomes all-too-real! Based on the original Charlton Comics character created by Pat Boyette, Spookman is a classic horror/adventure series!
KNIGHTINGALES, with art by Dærick (Excaliber, Code of Honor, BATMAN-'Two-Face Strikes Twice', Marvel's Cyber Comics, 'SPIDERMAN' ) Gröss, Sr. Their code is to "first, do no harm." All the time they must try to survive! When Cynthia Doyle and Betsy Crane, two angels of mercy, find themselves in a world gone to hell, they must fight for their lives—and their patients! A nurse saga the likes of which you have never seen before, and also based on a classic Charlton Comics series!
Spookman and The Knightingales!
Please check out our array of incentives which I hope will make your participation of this outrageous adventure an even better deal!
I think these comic can make a difference. A real difference. But I need your help to get our books into the public consciousness! So would you please consider joining me, and together we can Frenzy the whole Comic Book World as it has never been Frenzied before!
REWARDS!
Variant covers featuring SPOOKMAN & The Knightingales, signed by Roger McKenzie!
Limited Edition FRENZY Trading Cards!
 Roger McKenzie's TOTAL FRENZY Comics #1 is a 64-page extravaganza!
These prints can be signed by Roger and the images are also available on T-Shirts as rewards!
 SAMPLE ART FROM ROGER McKENZIE'S TOTAL FRENZY COMICS #1

updates.update_content:
An update, Frenzied Friends! I have (almost) all mailing addresses in now. Just a very few remain and I'll rattle your cages via Facebook messages or email very soon!

So...it's time to send the Total Frenzy Kickstarter edition to the printer! WHOO-HOO! From there, I'll get the books, sign the ones I need to, and mail 'em all out! So it won't be too much longer now! And this will indeed be a VERY LIMITED print run. Somewhere around 100.

I'll also get a hold of some of you to determine t-shirt sizes, and your choices on some of the incentives!
And, thanks again, everybody!

A quick update, Frenzied Friends: We've begun proofing the pages of Roger McKenzie's Total Frenzy Comics #1! ALL story and art pages are done. We just need to do an editorial page and a couple of pages to list all our great backers inscribed on the Friends of Frenzy Wall of Champions and the 64 page comicbook extravaganza will be ready for the printer! :)

So we're moving right along!
--Rog

Roger McKenzie's Total Frenzy Comics Kickstarter is fully funded...and all because of you awesome backers! KS informs me they'll be sending me emails and info in the next few days and I'll pass along any pertinent details.

But for now, THANK YOU EVERYBODY!
--Rog

...The deadline that is! This Kickstarter is almost over and still a bit to go to reach the goal! Thanks to all who have donated and let your friends know about this great project by sharing the link http://kck.st/1N77iNG where ever you can!

Just a quick note as we enter the last couple of days of the Total Frenzy Kickstarter. We're not there yet...but inching closer! And, whether we make it to funding or not, I wanted to thank all of you very much for your support!

It means a great deal to me!

--Rog

Pat Boyette was an larger-than-life comic book creator, filmmaker and radio/TV personality. He created the Sandman as a TV series in the 60s and adapted it into THE SPOOKMAN for Charlton Comics. Roger McKenzie and Sandy Carruthers have extrapolated the concept into a terrifying new series in The Charlton Arrow and as an innovative Pix-C web series... soon to be in print for the first time! Join the Kickstarter campaign for Total Frenzy Comics #1 before 12/16 and get rewarded copiously! See more at http://kck.st/1N77iNG

Evolution of the Charlton Comics nurses! Nurses Cynthia Doyle and Betsy Crane had their own series and now have been reimagined as angels of mercy hunting the undead in Roger McKenzie and Dærick Gröss Sr.'s Knightingales! Get a copy of the new Total Frenzy Comic #1 with a variant Knightingales cover when you join the Kickstarter campaign at http://kck.st/1N77iNG before December 16!

updates.update_content:
Roger McKenzie's Total Frenzy #1 Kickstarter campaign had an awesome first day! My thanks to our backers, and pledge that we won't let down! It's full speed ahead for Team Frenzy!

As some of you know, our comicbook company, Charlton Neo, was born on the Facebook page, The Charlton Arrow! As a (VERY!) small grassroots band of ragtag professionals and talented newcomers we've published 4 issues of The Charlton Arrow...Wild Frontier #1...Unusual Suspense...Steve Ditko's Weird Comics #1, Paul Kupperberg's Secret Romance #1...and many more! We've been selling them on Amazon and Indyplanet and by mail order. Now, with your help, we stand poised to take our books to the next level...to the comicbook shops themselves! http://morttodd.com/

campaign.story:
WELCOME! AND A QUICK "DIE KITTY DIE!" INTRO                   
Kitty Ravencraft, a beautiful and magical young witch, is the star of her own popular comic book. When her greedy, publicity-starved publisher wants to increase interest in her comic book, he does what many comic book publishers do nowadays... he sets out to kill his main character, Kitty! Even worse, he decides to REALLY spike sales by killing the REAL Kitty in REAL life! The question is though... how do you kill a witch? "DIE, KITTY! DIE!" is a funny, exciting, and often sexy story about a girl caught in both the supernatural world of witches, and the super-crazy world of comics!

DAN PARENT and FERNANDO RUIZ. WHO ARE THESE GUYS?
Creators Dan Parent and Fernando Ruiz pose with some of their artwork for "Die Kitty Die!"
Some of you may not know us but we've been in the comic business for over twenty years. We've produced many popular, high-selling comics for other publishers, e.g. Archie Meets Kiss, Archie Vs Predator, Felix the Cat, etc. Over the years, we've often talked about the possibility of doing something together that is creator owned, and the timing for this has finally arrived. "Die Kitty Die!" will be a collaborative effort where we'll share writing and art duties. This will be our first joint effort under own new label, Astrocomix (it just sounds better than Parent & Ruiz comics, you know?) We hope this venture will prove popular enough that we can produce more books and possibly launch more projects! You can read more about us individually at our own web-sites: danparent.com and fernandoruizeverybody.com  And for more Kitty info there's diekittydie.com and her Facebook page here
WHAT ARE WE TRYING TO FUND HERE?
Fernando's cover for Die Kitty Die #1
Dan's cover for DIE KITTY DIE #1 !
Gisele and Shouri's gorgeous pin-up which will be a print too!
With this campaign, we are looking to fund the printing of the first "Die, Kitty Die!" collected trade. We say collected as our plan is to first release this trade as four 24+ page digital issues that will be delivered to backers on a monthly basis until the printed trade is ready to ship. Each issue will include 20 page of story, funny ad pages, fashion pages, pin-ups, AND variant covers produced by our very talented and accomplished friends in the comics business. We feel this route will satisfy both print and digital fans.

We have set a lean, realistically-attainable goal of US$25, 000. This will help us pay for a print run of one thousand copies of the first trade, help us pay the printing of the art cards and posters we are offering, pay our collaborators/contributors, AND of course, cover the shipping cost for about half the print run. Speaking of collaborators inks will be handled by artists extraordinaire  J. Bone and Rich Koslowski. Colors will be handled by Dan and amazing color artist Shouri. Other contributors will include webcomics pioneer and creator of Menage à 3, Gisèle Lagacé, the fantastic Phil Jimenez, and pop culture artist phenomenon Glen Hanson! And the incredible Darwyn Cooke will be doing the cover to the trade!
The color version of J. Bone's pin up is spectacular!
Phil Jiminez draws a captivating Kitty!

  another look at Gisèle's work...we cant wait to see covers and stories from her!
Shouri's amazing work !
Glen Hanson is going to bring his super style to the world of Kitty!
Darwyn Cooke is doing the cover to the trade! Need we say more?

Here's some sample art from the first trade:
Kitty and her geek squad
how it all began over 50 years ago...
home sweet home....
Kitty's changed with the times...not that it will save her...

Along the way, you'll meet the nutty characters who inhabit Kitty's world. You'll meet her friends Rudy and Mara and her comic book co-stars like the funny phantom, Dippy the Dead-Kid and the fiery fiend, L'il Satan!) Plus, a whole slew of off the wall characters from the entire history of "Kitty Comics". Some good. Some bad. Some VERY bad.
Dippy and Friends!
Kitty's hangout!
If our supporters are especially generous with us, and we exceed our goal, we will reward everyone by growing our project to include more story pages in our collected trade. Gisèle Lagacé & J. Bone already agreed to provide additional material if this happens. Exceeding our goal could also lead to a limited hardcover edition, and more goodies!

Before getting into the rewards, we would like to thank you for your time, and send a shout-out to all the fans we've met at conventions and other venues. Many of you have become cherished friends, and very loyal supporters. We hope you'll follow us on this very personal and dear venture. Kitty is our own creation, and it makes this campaign a very personal and important undertaking for us. Your support means everything to us. Also! Big thanks to Justin M. Salvato for putting our video together. You did a great job, Justin, and helped these two cartoonists get their message across!  

STRETCH GOALS
ADD ONS!
 ADD- ON INSTRUCTIONS: 
THE REWARDS!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are comic book veterans with collectively over forty-plus years of experience in producing and publishing comic books. We have worked for numerous publishers and we have both published our own independent ventures. In order to keep our financial goals as low and as attainable as possible, we are not paying ourselves for own own efforts in this project. We will be producing "Die, Kitty! Die" as we maintain our output for other comic book publishers and clients. Our goal is to produce the Kitty series throughout the Spring of 2016 and have the collected trade volume by the Summer convention season later that same year. We are both battle-weary veterans who are no strangers to tight deadlines and a high workload. We are confident in our time table and are looking forward to sharing Kitty's stories with our friends and fans throughout 2016!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Just a few days ago, I didn't think I would need to talk to you about stretch run goals, but happily, it appears that my project has taken on a bit of momentum thanks to all of the folks sharing my project! So, here we are:
Yes! In my video, I foolishly read you the whole story! But, I have enough faith and trust that you liked it enough to want to find out how to get a copy.
About me and this project: 
I've been doing zombie caricatures for 9 years at comic book conventions and events. About a year and a half ago, my then 3-year-old son wouldn't come down to my basement studio. When my wife asked him why not, he said he was scared. And, when she asked what he was scared of, he pointed at all of my zombie artwork hanging from the walls.
With this inspiration, I wrote the manuscript for this story over the next hour, and I've been working on tweaking the rhyme and meter, the art, learning about the picture book industry, and publisher and agent submissions ever since.
With some very encouraging rejection letters under my belt, I'm happy to announce the self-publication of this book with your help!
Rewards:
$5 digital copy of the book AND a thank you on my website!
$10, I'll also send you a signed, limited-edition postcard 
Reward #3: Everything in Reward #2 PLUS this limited-edition, signed postcard
$25 you will receive everything in reward #3 PLUS the signed, limited-edition hardcover of the book (if you want more than one book, add $25 to your pledge for each book. See "add-on rewards" below). NEW: I will be giving all backers at the $25 reward level a downloadable companion video of the story narrated by the voice talents of me, my wife AND Milo, my son!
$45 you will receive everything in reward #4 PLUS a zombie girl t-shirt (available in men's, women's, youth, or toddler cuts, add $5 for XXL adult sizes or larger)

Additional subjects can be added for only $25 each - see "add-on rewards" below.)
$75 COLOR SKETCH: you will receive everything in reward #4, PLUS a Color zombie caricature or other color illustration hand-drawn into the endsheets of your book (1 subject only. Additional subjects can be added for only $25 each - see "add-on rewards" below.)
$65 PHILANTHROPIST: you will receive everything in reward #4, PLUS I donate two additional books on your behalf to your favorite library, school, preschool, or shelter, where you're listed in the book's Donor Bookplate or anonymously.
This will appear on the inside front cover of Philanthropist and Hero level backers' donated books

REDUCED: $600 HERO: You will receive everything in COLOR SKETCH (Reward #9), a t-shirt (add $5 for XXL or larger), zombie girl doll; PLUS 25 copies of the book donated to your favorite library, school, daycare, or shelter of your choice with a bookplate with your name as the donor (or anonymously), signed by me personally at a scheduled signing, where I will also do a dramatic reading and a monster drawing workshop. (Does not include travel costs outside of the Denver-metro area. I can alternately arrange to do a video conference).
$1000 I can make your pet a star! I will make your favorite pet a character and draw your pet into the book as many as 14 times, including possibly on the cover! You will receive everything in reward #4, PLUS you will receive all study sketches, finished artwork, and a custom color sketch of your pet in the endsheets of your signed book. Comes with a t-shirt and a doll.
Your pet could be here!

ADD-ON REWARDS (add additional funds to your pledge (only for initial pledges of $25 or more)):
$20 for each additional shirt (+$5 for adult or women's sizes XXL or larger)

NEW: $5 a DVD of the companion video of the story narrated by the voice talents of me, my wife AND Milo, my son, and the book PDF!
BUDGET:
My low initial goal is just $3000, which goes to cover the printing of the first 250 copies of this book, rewards, and estimated campaign and transaction fees.
For those of you who backed my first campaign, as you know if we exceed our goal, you know I will have some great incentives planned for each stretch goal we pass not to mention all of the campaign updates which may again include some FREE art tutorials, so make sure to spread the word: PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE Share this on Facebook, Reddit, Twitter or wherever you socialize. I will make it worth your while!
Sincerely,
Stan Yan
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I hope to have the remainder of the book drawn, printed and ready to delivery months earlier so long as I don't have delays related to required backer photos being e-mailed to me promptly; unforseen technology difficulties; intervening freelance work deadlines; and/or unexpected illnesses or other unforeseen family issues.

At that point, I will send the page files to the printer, so it'll depend on the turnaround with them. So, I don't plan on this being one of those campaigns you forgot you contributed to and years have passed before you receive anything. Delivery estimates are longer for rewards which included a commissioned a sketch.

I will keep everyone posted on the progress of completion and reward deliveries along the way.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hey, everyone!
Wanted to give a huge thank you for your support.
We didn't make the goal and that's okay. It's alright to try things and fail.
After the first week from projections I realized the goal had been set too high. I thought it best to run its course here and start it up again early 2016 with a goal of $6,000. I was also hoping to get by on Facebook and also with email newsletters, but it wasn't as strong of a boost as I'd hoped it would be.
Price was another factor and we probably priced the books too high. A lot of people are going through hard times and I didn't realize it.
We'll lower the price when we try again early next year, and do a two for one, with both books costing just $25. We'll try to figure out some nice extras for people that do want to support with more money.
All Ages fantasy is a hard sell in the comics medium. Most people aren't familiar with the book or the series, so it probably was a lot to ask to have people shell out $50 for a set of two hardcovers that they're not familiar with. A lot of people probably assume that the series is written lowly for children, but it is in fact for all ages, and for adults as well.
In my mind I have a way that I would like things to go, but people have different needs, demands, levels of interest, and rarely do what we want them to. That's okay, too. I'm not the boss of anyone.
We worked really hard on these books and it took us about 3 years to finish the second volume. We hope to build enough of an audience to finish the books and do two more, but at this point we don't know.
Because we printed about 2000 of each book it's better to sell more for less, and it also will raise cash for printing 'Gladstone's School for World Conquerors' which is a more popular books.
The Kickstarter is going to end in a few days. Because we didn't make our goal you won't be charged. You'll be able to pick up the books in 2016 when we launch again, and once this is over, I may lower the price on Amazon for the day, and let you pick them up there sooner.
It would be nice to start from day one in 2016 with 66 people, and then push and promote to reach the second half of the goal.
Thank you, again for your support! It does mean the world to us.
'New Brighton Archeological Society' is the acclaimed fantasy graphic novel illustrated by Matthew Weldon, written by Mark Smith, and published by 'Maneki Neko Books'.
DOWNLOAD AND READ THE FIRST BOOK HERE:
 ------> http://tinyurl.com/nl92pbe <---------
Out of the ashes of misfortune will rise the next generation of great adventurers! After their parents are lost on an archeological expedition, four children begin to unlock the secrets of their parents' mysterious lives, discovering a hidden world of mystical artifacts, mythical creatures, and arcane knowledge.
Soon they find themselves drawn into a conflict over a great library that has kept two kingdoms at war for centuries, the children must save an enchanted forest, the birthplace of magic itself.
Join us as these children become the latest members of the fabled New Brighton Archeological Society, and take their first steps towards their true destiny!
'NEW BRIGHTON ARCHEOLOGICAL SOCIETY BOOKS' 1 & 2 ARE ALREADY PRINTED AND IN AMAZON INVENTORY FOR SHIPPING.
We are being very transparent about that. Which means that after the Kickstarter you should receive your books in about a week.
What is this Kickstarting? This is Kickstarting a recoup of printing costs for Hardcover Editions of New Brighton Archeological Society Books 1 & 2. You can see the cost for printing here and for freight:
The money that is recouped will go towards printing of Hardcover editions Gladstone's School for World Conquerors 1 & 2, the second book which is drawn by Matthew Weldon and written by Mark Smith.
IN SHORT: The print copies of New Brighton Archeological Society Books 1 & 2 are Kickstarting the printing of Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Books 1 & 2 in hardcover format.
Any additional funds will serve as an advance for creating New Brighton Archeological Society Book 3.
From Book 1...'The Bath':
BOOK 1 COVER:
BOOK 2 Cover:
New Brighton Archeological Society Book 2 Cover
 'New Brighton Archeological Society' is graphic novel with an innate child-like sense of adventure, wonder and humor. Smith incorporates fire-breathing dragons, talking slugs, old-style puppet shows, swarthy eye patches, crossbows and dashing sword fights where the bad guy gets tied up as if in an old western movie. There’s no blood and gore in these books, only Matthew Weldon’s sumptuously colored illustrations which transport the reader to fantasy locales.
Book One, The Castle of Galomar, follows Cooper, Benny, Becca, Jossie and a butterscotch-loving goblin named Mitch through the forest and into the bowels of Galomar’s castle. Book Two, 'The Sword of Azure', includes an epic zeppelin dogfight. Fairies, goblins and magic abound. These books are thrilling for young readers and adults alike. Come capture a bit of your own childhood on this wild ride with the 'New Brighton Archeological Society'.
"NBAS is such a great book - it appeals to a really wide audience. And unlike some comic books targeted at kids, it doesn’t treat kids as fragile or unintelligent. All the main characters in New Brighton Archeological Society are very young, but also very capable." Geek Dad Blog
"It's great for younger comics fans looking for heroes who aren't wearing spandex. He also tosses in enough fantasy elements, including dragons, goblins, a giant frog and a magical slug, to pique the imagination." -Washington Post
"The New Brighton Archeological Society by Mark Andrew Smith and Matthew Weldon is one of the very best all ages graphic novels in years. It proves that there can be an outlet to introduce kids to the world of picture-based story telling without pandering to them or horrifying their innocent sensibilities." Boing Boing
"Mark Andrew Smith and Matthew Weldon have all the ingredients for success in "New Brighton": a spunky group of kids with lots of free time, a wild world ripe for exploration, fantastic creatures culled from various faerie tales, and dangers that manage to be scary without being truly terrifying. It's the sort of book we're quite certain we'd love when we were little, but get a kick out of reading now, too." Rick Marshall of MTV'S SPLASH PAGE
"I want to live in the world Smith writes. He’s also got a fantastic imagination and has created a fun world full of good goblins, evil faeries, man-eating housecats, evil treasure-hunters, sprawling mansions, enchanted estates, horrible monsters, secret rooms, and hidden libraries full of forbidden knowledge. And it’s up to four pre-adolescent kids to navigate their way safely through all of it in order to preserve their families’ legacies." Robot 6 @Comic Book Resources
Please take a moment to share 'New Brighton Archeological Society' with your friends on Facebook and Twitter by clicking the 'Like' & 'Tweet' buttons above.
By sharing 'New Brighton' you're helping us to educate the public about the project and helping us to get one step closer to our quest of 'world domination.'
'New Brighton Archeoloigcal Society' TM & (C) Matthew Weldon & Mark Smith.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The books are printed and in Amazon's inventory. We know the prices on shipping everywhere. The money made on this Kickstarter will print a new series of books. We are offering rewards which are quickly deliverable and that do not have to be made. 

We did a Kickstarter for New Brighton a few years ago, and Image dropped out as the publisher. We also made the mistake of Kickstarting when there were only 40 black and white completed pages of art and the book was far from completed. 

We had to print the books ourselves out of our own pockets in order to honor commitments. 

We upgraded the books to the nice Hardcover format and have delivered all books to those who have responded to an update of address, and shipped to the previous address of the original backers. Basically, they got a much nicer book as a thank you for the delay and waiting. It's now a personal mission to Kickstart faster and smarter with completed projects.

As of now with the books printed, this is a zero risk Kickstarter.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
I had just helped fund the exclusive Madman action figure through the Amazing Heroes Kickstarter campaign. Christian LeBlanc had just fascinated eyeballs everywhere with his conversion work on the Madman In Your Face 3D Special Starring Frank Einstein. He couldn't stop converting Mike's characters into 3D, and I was anxious to play in the Snap City Sandbox myself, so we joined forced to bring more swell Madman swag into the world. 
Luckily, Mike was able to come up for air long enough (between drawing Silver Surfer for Marvel, and seeing his comics co-creation iZombie hit TVs everywhere through The CW) to give us permission to go through 20+ years of Madman comics for a set of 3D trading cards!
Madman Comin' Atcha 3D Trading Cards come in a 44-card deck with 36 Madman and 8 Atomics cards. Included in each deck is a pair of card-sized custom Swell-O-Vision 3D Specs (seen below)!
To sweeten the deal, we're creating a 10-card set (shipped in a clear acrylic case) of other artists' renditions of Madman and his pals; not only do you see the work of Alex Toth, Jack Kirby, Frank Frazetta, and Darwyn Cooke converted to 3D--but also new cards (drawn for this set) by Dean Haspiel (The Fox, Billy Dogma), Simon Fraser (Doctor Who, Nikolai Dante), Terry Huddleston (Thaniel), Ethan Young (Tails, Nanjing), George Folz (The Roman Nose, Star Wars), and Bizhan Kodabhan (The Little Red Fish). The Artist Pack comes with a pair of plain 3D glasses.
There's an added level of bonus cards of Red Rocket 7, Madman Inks, and the (not in 3D) Madman Pencil Sketch Card, which is a printed card of a classic Madman pin-up's pencils--which only come in the Hangin' Out Mega Ginchy Fun Pack pledge level and up.
The pencils reproduced on the Pencil Sketch card.
Bump it up to the Comin' Along Mega Swell Pack, and we'll get Mike to sign the Madman Pencil Sketch Card!
NEW LEVEL!
The Madman Precognition Sneak Preview Pack features 7 laser-printed cardstock preview cards, one of which is the signed Madman! They'll be delivered in May, right after the campaign wraps up. 
You can either get it individually for $20 (limited to five):
NOTE: These are prototype cards printed on cardstock.
Or, you can get it as the Big Future Pack, which features everything from the Big Time Pack plus the preview cards. Like the other level, it's only limited to five.
NOTE: These are prototype cards printed on cardstock.
And if we not only meet our goal (but totally annihilate it, Daddio), we have even more cards in store for each of our two stretch goals. 
Images subject to slight tinkering and change
We just unlocked our stretch goal for $5,000, which will increase the main deck from 44 to 62 cards!
Come on and join the party. We're only getting started.
$5,000 gets us more cards for the main deck!
FOR INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING: We want to bring Snap City to anyone in the world with a mailing address. Unfortunately, it costs a few more clams (that's money) from place to place. If you don't see your home country in the Rewards, no worries: Message me through Kickstarter, and I'll get back to you with shipping costs.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've been lining up printers and working on the conversion and design process for two months already, so we're not worried about the actual production. We're going for a modest print run that will be hand collated and we're hoping to get these out the door to you within a couple to few months of getting funded.

Our biggest concern is in making a high quality card set that Madman and Atomics fans will dig like none other. Turning around a proof set will add to our time, but we feel it's a necessary evil in getting the best cards for you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

You can choose an reward level that gives you a chance to be get a digital OR signed, print edition of my special edition Vincent Price Presents book from BlueWater Productions; receive the ORIGINAL zombie caricature illustrations of the celebrities featured prominently on the cover of my book; receive ORIGINAL sketch cover comics by me; and even be drawn INTO my book as an extra, a cameo, a star or even the VILLAIN! I will even show you the cover-to-cover pages from the story so you can see which character each incentive level matches up with (*Spoiler Alert*).
GOALS:

More to come!
*These rewards will be delivered if I am able to get a backer for our last STAR level reward for the Flight Attendant character AND a backer for the original Vincent Price art from the cover, regardless of our funding number.
Here are also some things you can add onto your choice of reward to help push us to our next stretch goal reward:

About me and this project:
I've been doing zombie caricatures for 9 years at comic book conventions and events, and it's become quite a thing, as you can imagine. It was great! I was actually covering my event and travel costs and making money. Sadly, it was cannibalizing my comic book sales, most of which were geek culture, slice of life books that had little to nothing to do with zombies. 
So, in order for me to try capitalize on my growing zombie fan base and regrow my dwindling reader fan base, challenged myself to write a zombie comic book, the book that eventually was illustrated by Daniel Crosier and published by Bluewater Productions. The story? It was a story about me drawing zombie caricatures of folks at a comic convention. Since people that I was drawing kind of became a part of the story, I decided that each zombie caricature would come with this very meta book.
After a few years, I started to feel a little weird giving folks that I had drawn a book that I DIDN'T draw. So, after talking to Dan and Bluewater, with their blessing, I am now drawing the next edition of this book, a book YOU could have me draw you in! I can draw you in several different ways: as a background EXTRA, a larger speaking CAMEO (there's only 7 of these), a STARRING ROLE (there's only 3: the cab driver, the flight attendant, or the guy with diarrhea), or you can even be the VILLIAN! (which appears in the book about 2 dozen times AND on the cover and basically gets all of the incentives everyone else gets, including prints of all of the celebrity zombies pictured on the cover!)
Budget:
My low initial goal is just $2000, which goes to cover the printing of the first 500 copies of this book, the shipping and estimated campaign and transaction fees. Actually, I think that'll leave me $108 short of my costs, but I'm determined to make this go. In addition, if we exceed our goal, I have some great stretch goals planned for each stretch goal we pass, so make sure to spread the word: PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE Share this on Facebook, Reddit, Twitter or wherever you socialize. I will make it worth your while!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
At this point, I've pretty much completed all of the art for the book -- interiors and exteriors. I just need to draw YOU into the book! As soon as this campaign ends, I will start inserting all of the undrawn characters and background extras. 

Keep in mind that the estimate I have set for date of delivery is very generous. I hope to have the remainder of the comic book drawn, printed and ready to delivery months earlier so long as I don't have delays related to required backer photos being e-mailed to me promptly (I will contact these backers directly with pose requests); unforseen technology difficulties; intervening freelance work deadlines; and/or unexpected illnesses or other unforeseen family issues. 

At that point, I will send the page files to the printer, so it'll depend on the turnaround with them. So, I don't plan on this being one of those campaigns you forgot you contributed to and years have passed before you receive anything. We'll be talking 3-4 months barring aforementioned circumstances (or if you commissioned a zombie caricature with your purchase and you're not in the book).

I will keep everyone posted on the progress of completion and reward deliveries along the way.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Zombies from my book have new life!
updates.update_content:
Since my last update, Zac from the Hall of Doom Gallery at the Toad Tavern reached out to me about collaborating on a new venture, where they create limited-edition prints for display and sale at the Gallery on a monthly basis.
So, I've left it up to my patrons to help me decide which pieces of art to include and I've started with one from the Vincent Price comic! Check out the post about it here.

On December 27th, I was flattered to be sent a special e-mail invitation by Kickstarter as a "creator whose project we loved" to participate in "make/100." I went to Facebook to ask my friends, fans and followers if they might back such a project, and while there was a smattering of interest, it wasn't enough for me to uproot my plans for the year to do something I wasn't planning to do.
So, what precisely IS it that I plan to do?

I'm thankful for a lot of things, but this year, I'm particularly thankful for all of my kind and enthusiastic backers of my Vincent Price comic book, and those of you who also chose to support my current campaign for my zombie children's book. Only 4 days left!
