campaign.story:
Revisit the comic book industry of the 1990s—the era of Vertigo, Image, Dark Horse, self-publishing, the flourishing direct market, and other seismic changes—through hundreds of candid photos of the people and events of that important decade.
Comic Book People 2 is a follow-up to last year's Comic Book People: Photographs from the 1970s and 1980s, also funded through Kickstarter. The first book of photos was well received. Here are just a few of the comments from Amazon's listing for the book:
"Having read Comic Book People and returned to it every couple days since because its images are so compelling, I can't imagine this volume not being part of every serious comics fan and historian's library. I give it my highest recommendation."--Tony Isabella
"If you love comics, and the people who have created your favorite issues, then you will love this book!! This is a must have book for any serious student of comics and I mean all genres. Jackie Estrada, like no other person could, has brought everything together through her photographs and her insights."--Robert W. Cox
"As soon as I heard about this book, I made sure I was going to get a copy. Not only is it an important document about the history of comic books and a time capsule of the times, it is a fun romp showing the more things change ... the more things stay the same. This is a loving tribute. Thanks to Jackie Estrada. I will treasure this book and say a little prayer that you'll get to do more."--Dave Olbrich
The huge positive response to the first book made me realize I had to do a second book, focusing on the 1990s. As a companion book, it will have the same format (hardcover, 9 x 12, 176 pages, with a 16-page color insert).
The Contents
The photos to be included were taken mostly at the San Diego Comic-Con, but there are also images from such shows as the Chicago Comic-Con, WonderCon, the Alternative Press Expo, SPX, and various trade shows of the period. You can expect:
* Rare photos of such Golden/Silver Age creators as Will Eisner, Jack Kirby, Stan Lee, Vin Sullivan, Paul Norris, Martin Nodell, Chad Grothkopf, Al Williamson, Sheldon Moldoff, Bob Kane, Gene Colan, Marie Severin, Irwin Hasen, Harry Lampert, Ric Estrada, Bill Ward, Ramona Fradon, Bob Haney, Nick Cardy, Paul S. Newman, Dan Barry, Carmine Infantino, John Buscema, and Frank Frazetta.
Carrie and Marty Nodell 1991
* Pix of the big names in mainstream comics of the period, from Neil Gaiman, George Perez, Grant Morrison, Garth Ennis, Peter David, John Byrne, Chris Claremont, Kevin Eastman, Mark Waid, Alex Ross, Dave McKean, and Frank Miller to Todd McFarlane and Rob Liefeld.
Frank Miller, Neil Gaiman, Bill Sienkiewicz, Bernie Wrightson, Dave Gibbons 1991
* Lots of photos of writer/artists who were movers and shakers in the self-publishing/indie comics movement, including Dave Sim, Jeff Smith, Terry Moore, Linda Medley, Billy Tucci, Colleen Doran, David Lapham, Carla Speed McNeil, James Kochalka, Dan Clowes, Chris Ware, Dean Haspiel, Evan Dorkin, Sarah Dyer, Donna Barr, Shannon Wheeler, Scott McCloud, Paul Pope, Roberta Gregory, and lots more.
Jeff Smith at APE, 1998
*Photos of key people in comics publishing and retailing, as well as shots from behind-the-scenes industry events, such as the very first organizing meeting for Friends of Lulu in San Diego in 1993.
Some of the women in attendance at the first meeting to discuss the formation of Friends of Lulu: Cat Yronwode, Lee Marrs, (unidentified), Kim Yale, Martha Thomases, Maggie Thompson.
*Photos of authors such as Clive Barker, Harlan Ellison, Ron Goulart, Raymond Feist, and Nancy Collins, as well as a smattering of celebrities such as Mr. T and Julie Newmar.
Along with all the usual favorites who were fixtures at Comic-Con year after year, including Sergio Aragonés, Stan Sakai, the Hernandez Brothers, Trina Robbins, Steve Leialoha, Bill Sienkiewicz, Bernie Wrightson, Steve Rude, Bob Burden, Bob Schreck, Diana Schutz, Mary Fleener, Michael Kaluta, Dave Stevens, Charles Vess, Jill Thompson, Denys Cowan, Eddie Campbell, Len Wein, Matt Wagner, Jimmy Palmiotti, Rick Geary, Art Adams, Karen Berger, Michael Davis, Neal Adams, Bil Stout, Howard Chaykin, Jim Valentino, Lea Hernandez, Larry Marder, Walt Simonson, Kyle Baker, Bill Mumy, Paul Levitz, Batton Lash, and lots more!
Stan Sakai in 1991
As in the first book, every photo will be accompanied by a caption with personal anecdotes about my experiences with these folks and events.
Why Kickstarter?
To make this book a reality, I will need to raise funds to cover the design, production, printing, distribution, shipping, and storage of a high-quality hardcover publication, as well as the cost of producing the "Extra" booklet, the postcards, and other perks. If the goal is surpassed, money will go toward increasing the number of pages (and photos!), upping the print run, and possibly going back to press on the first book.
Backer Rewards
In addition to the book, you have a choice of a number of backer rewards. They include:
• A set of 10 postcards of images from the book
• A pdf of the first book, Comic Book People: Photographs from the 1970s and 1980s
• A 2016 calendar with images from the book
• An exclusive wraparound dustjacket
• A signed copy of the first book, Comic Book People: Photographs from the 1970s and 1980s
• The exclusive Comic Book People 2 Extra, a 32-page 8 1/2" x 11" booklet filled with "out-take" photos from the 1990s—shots from parties, panels, the exhibit hall, the art auction, and other aspects of comic conventions of the era
• Postcards and the "Extra" booklet for the first book, Comic Book People: Photographs from the 1970s and 1980s
• A signed copy of Renegade Romance #2 (1983), which contains one of the only two stories I ever wrote for comics: "Daydreams," with fabulous art by the late Barb Rausch. Also in the issue (with cover by Jaime Hernandez): stories by Colleen Doran, Trina Robbins, Steve Leialoha/Deni Loubert, and Bob Rozakis/Stephen DeStephano. A real collector's item!
Just Added!
• Custom 11 x 14 frameable prints of your favorite images from either of the two Comic Book People books, color or black and white. I have arranged with Chrome Digital, San Diego's premier photo lab, to make high-quality matte-finish prints from digital scans of the original negatives. If you pledge at the $250 level, you get five prints of your choice. You can also choose single prints as an Add-On to other levels—see $30 in "Add-Ons" below.
 The plan is for backers who attend the San Diego Comic-Con in July to be able to pick up their book at the Exhibit A Press booth (#1909). That worked out well with the first book last year, as backers were able to take their book around and get it signed by folks whose photos appeared in the book.The official publication date for the book is September 10, so most backers will get their books well before it is available via bookstores and Amazon, for instance.
Add-Ons
If none of the levels quite fits your needs, you can also take advantage of add-ons. Just increase your backer amount to include any of the following items:
$10—Set of 10 postcards from CBP2
$12—Set of 10 postcards from CBP1 (limited to 35 sets: I will remove this item from the list if/when we reach that level)
$15—PDF of the first book: Comic Book People: Photographs from the 1970s and 1980s
$20—Exclusive wraparound dustjacket
$25—2016 CBP2 calendar
$30—The exclusive "Comic Book People 2 Extra"
$30—A custom 11 x 14 frameable matte print of your favorite image from either of the two Comic Book People books, color or black and white. Each additional print is $25, and you can add as many as you'd like.
$40—A signed copy of Comic Book People: Photographs from the 1970s and 1980s (additional shipping costs will be required for international backers)
You can mix and match items; just keep track of which add-ons you are paying for.
Note that just for fun, the backer levels are named after photographers from comic books and comic strips. Which one would you like to be?
I am open to suggestions for additional levels or perks—please let me know what would you like to see or get.
Here are a few more samples of photos you can expect to see in the book:
Jill Thompson at the 1990 San Diego Comic-Con.
Chris Ware and Kim Thompson at the 1998 San Diego Comic-Con
Rory Root, Chuck Rozanski, and Jim Hanley, ProCon 1993
The burgeoning self-publishing movement: Jimmy Palmiotti, James Owen, Scott McCloud, Don Simpson, Larry Marder, Martin Wagner, and Dave Sim at the 1993 San Diego Comic-Con.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having done the first book, I'm in better shape to make sure that the production and fulfillment stages run smoothly. The biggest challenges are handling all the packaging and shipping (for which I will probably seek assistance), processing international packages, and producing the "Extra" booklet (which took more time than I thought it would for the first book).

The first big challenge will be getting the book done and off to the printers by early May in order to have books available for the San Diego Comic-Con in early July. I am already in the process of sorting through the hundreds of photo files to choose the images that will be included.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
**NEW** EVERY SUPPORTER will receive a PDF of ADVENT, the 150+ page Book One of Hand of the Morningstar REGARDLESS of whether we meet our goal!  We'll send it as soon as we receive notice of your support!!  Start reading now!!
Superheros and Super Villains Clash—but what happens when the villain becomes a Christian, and the Superhero carries an evil secret?
It’s a story like you’ve NEVER read, and will change your opinion and expectation of the Christian Graphic Novel art form forever…
Over 8 years from Concept to Completion, Hand of the Morningstar was released in eight volumes as Manga-sized 160 page books.  Now, through Kickstarter we are releasing it for the first time as an Epic story compiled into a Giant-Sized Two-Part Set -- Over 1200 pages!  (Page Size: 6.69" x 9.61") 
And since these books are ready to go, you can expect to receive your Kickstarter Rewards before Christmas! (Someone you know would love to find this under the tree!)
Read more about the story and our motivations below! (But be sure to check out these cool rewards for your support along the way!)
I remember it like it was yesterday.  Mike S. Miller (comic artist for DC’s Injustice, Game of Thrones) and I were talking about new projects to engage in.  Mike’s been a long-time friend and was my co-publisher in a comic publishing endeavor.

Mike says, “We need a BibleMan!”

Then it hit me. I said, “No! We need the opposite!”

Whenever I see a “Christian-Superhero” story, the premise is always (I will say “typically”, but to date I have never seen otherwise) that the main character is somehow endowed with super powers by God and sent off on a mission of righteousness with these powers. My view is that we ALL are given this mission—“…to do justly, to love mercy, and to walk humbly with my God.” (Micah 6:8)  

So how does that translate to a superhero such as Spiderman, the Hulk, or the Fantastic Four? Take a guy that happens to have super powers, then make him a Christian. How does he act?

The goal was to create a story more about people in extraordinary situations.  To take a man who finds redemption and and faith, and have to live out that faith in spite of the “super” things he can do.  In the end, we have a riveting, powerful story that holds it’s own in the Graphic Novel marketplace.

It’s not so much a “Christian” story than it is a story about a man who becomes a Christian, and an exploration into what “good” really means.  It’s not a glorified tract.  We won’t beat you over the head with the Bible.  It’s not in-your-face…it’s just an element of the story.  The reaction to the book has been incredible.  Here are some examples:

“I cannot recommend it highly enough. It has honesty, it has humanity, and it has hook.” Scot Eaton, Worship and the Arts

updates.update_content:
I just received notification that all of the books have been shipped out to me, and I should have them by early next week!
Once received, everything will be signed, packed, and sent out to you!
I expect everything to go out by the end of next week!
Thank you for being a part of this project!

It's been an exciting time around here!  All the pieces and parts are getting wrapped up quickly...each day something else is ready to go!
We received our proofs from the printer and they are beautiful!  I just finished going through them and they look great!  I am placing the order today for all the print copies.
The ebooks are done for Parts One and Two, and also the bonus Dead Sea Scrolls book.  I just found one change I have to make on Part One and it will be ready to send out.  I am setting up the best way to distribute those to you to make it easy (they are large ebooks due to all the art). You'll have the choice between .epub or .mobi (for your iPad or your Kindle...and both can be read on your computer).

Man!  Under the wire of the New Year, I have just uploaded all of the Final Files of the hand of the Morningstar series to my printer!

I spent a little extra time making sure everything was "just so", with lots of extra embellishments and treatments!  I know you'll be pleased with the final books!
Now I'll be hard at work finalizing the Electronic Versions and I'll be getting those out to you ASAP!

Just an update to let you know the progress on the the books: 
I am fine tuning the art and layout...7 of the 8 books are done and i hope to be finished with all the layout in the next couple days.
Hoping to send this to press within the week!
--Brett

We made it!  We have reached beyond out goal, and I am already hard at work finalizing all my files!
I just wanted to say a very heartfelt thanks for your support.
I will be in touch soon to request specific information and to keep you updated with progress.
Brett

Time for one last PUSH GOAL!
If we can get to $1300 in Pledges, EVERY supporter will receive a digital copy of the short graphic novel HOLY SCROLLS: The Origin of the Dead Sea Scrolls by Brett Burner (Creator of Hand of the Morningstar).
If we can get to $1500 in Pledges, EVERY supporter will receive a digital copy of the graphic novel DANIEL: Prophet of Dreams, a colorful 64-page Graphic Novel for kids detailing the life and story of the prophet Daniel.

We've surpassed our goal and we're on the home stretch!
If you want to raise your pledge, or spread the word to let others now bout this project, we have till the end of Saturday!

I hope everyone has enjoyed Book 1: Advent ... Feel free to share it to draw others in...

Thanks everybody for your support!!

We've surpassed our goal!
Thank you EVERYONE for your support!

I would still love to keep it going!  The more we earn the better...I will be planning new "push goals" that will benefit everybody!
Very excited!!

campaign.story:
About Our Project:
Welcome to our pre-order/fundraiser for Take Out The Trash, the debut album of my new project, Nate Allen and The Pac-Away Dots. Since 2006, I’ve been touring the US as Destroy Nate Allen. Take Out The Trash marks a new season and direction for my music. These 10 vulnerable and explosive songs will have you humming all day long.
Take Out The Trash has already been recorded, mixed and mastered. Your help is needed to finance the printing of CDs and 12" vinyl records. Our goal is to have every prize delivered in time for Christmas, with the exception of the vinyl which takes longer to produce. 
We came up with some original and fun incentives to make this fundraiser more interesting and to share one of our core values with you - COMMUNITY!
Laser Etched Mason Jar
The album lyrics "I want to be open to everything but I don't want to be broken" are being laser etched on 16 oz. mason jars by Tom Butler at Flying Eagle Gallery. Available individually, in a set of 4, or in combination with other rewards.
Greeting Cards
Nate has designed four original greeting cards with lyrics from the album printed on post-consumer recycled paper. Each card comes with an envelope and link to download the referenced song.
Some useful words about the album.
In 2013 Nate Allen found himself fresh off a long tour, unemployed, in his early 30’s, married and living in his parent’s spare bedroom. Everyone’s dream ...
His plan was to take a sabbatical from touring, get an "after college job" and let life reassemble. Instead, wrestling with how blind he had been to the racism all around him, he accidentally wrote and recorded an album documenting his process in that tenuous season of life.
What started as an acoustic solo project turned into a full band recording channeling the sounds of Social Distortion, Old 97’s, Johnny Cash, Pedro The Lion, Bright Eyes, The Pine Hill Haints, Against Me!, Violent Femmes, Larry and His Flask, and Slim Cessna’s Auto Club, to name a few.
We crossed the $4000 Stretch Goal! All vinyl will be upgraded to color and we'll also throw in an extra surprise on all non-vinyl orders.
If we cross the $5000 mark on our kickstarter, every backer will receive a custom designed Nate Allen and The Pac-Away Dots video game! Click the image above for more information.
Some useful words about the album.
In 2013 Nate Allen found himself fresh off a long tour, unemployed, in his early 30’s, married and living in his parent’s spare bedroom. Everyone’s dream ...
His plan was to take a sabbatical from touring, get an "after college job" and let life reassemble. Instead, wrestling with how blind he had been to the racism all around him, he accidentally wrote and recorded an album documenting his process in that tenuous season of life.
What started as an acoustic solo project turned into a full band recording channeling the sounds of Social Distortion, Old 97’s, Johnny Cash, Pedro The Lion, Bright Eyes, The Pine Hill Haints, Against Me!, Violent Femmes, Larry and His Flask, and Slim Cessna’s Auto Club, to name a few.
The Mixtape 
We've put together a diverse "mixtape", a peek at the many varied friends that we have made across the country. The independent artists on this playlist represent different genres and ideals, but the one thing that they all have in common is that they are friends of Nate and Tessa Allen. Through out the kickstarter Nate will post a blog on iamnateallen.com featuring a different artist on the mixtape. Every reward package will include a download of this playlist.
Who is on the mixtape?
Autry, The Bloodtypes, Bryan McPherson, Dead Ven, Dead Words, Desiring Dead Flesh, Divided Heaven, Doby Watson, Dollar Signs, Drybnz (featuring Jeff Suffering of 90 Lb. Wuss & Joe Mendonca), Garret Potter, Gnarboots, Googolplexia, Greg McKillop (ex-Speaker for the Dead), The Hollands, Insomniac Folklore, Jim Strange and The Proud and The Damned, Joel Kircher, Joseph Camuglia, Joshua Stephens, Kat Jones, Kevin Schlereth, Lauren Peacock, Levi The Poet, Nathan Leigh, No More Train Ghosts, The Maiden Name, McDougall, Sammy Warm Hands, Self Proclaimed Narcissist, The Pac-Away Dots (exclusive song), The Restitution, The Violent Psalms, Von Strantz, Where Division Ends & More.

campaign.story:
Superheros and Super Villains Clash—but what happens when the villain becomes a Christian, and the Superhero carries an evil secret?
It’s a story like you’ve NEVER read, and will change your opinion and expectation of the Christian Graphic Novel art form forever…
Over 8 years from Concept to Completion, Hand of the Morningstar was released in eight volumes as Manga-sized 160 page books.  Now, through Kickstarter we are releasing it for the first time as an Epic story compiled into a Giant-Sized Two-Part Set -- Over 1200 pages!  (Page Size: 6.69" x 9.61") 
And since these books are ready to go, you can expect to receive your Kickstarter Rewards before Christmas! (Someone you know would love to find this under the tree!)
Read more about the story and our motivations below! (But be sure to check out these cool rewards for your support along the way!)
I remember it like it was yesterday.  Mike S. Miller (comic artist for DC’s Injustice, Game of Thrones) and I were talking about new projects to engage in.  Mike’s been a long-time friend and was my co-publisher in a comic publishing endeavor.

Mike says, “We need a BibleMan!”

Then it hit me. I said, “No! We need the opposite!”

Whenever I see a “Christian-Superhero” story, the premise is always (I will say “typically”, but to date I have never seen otherwise) that the main character is somehow endowed with super powers by God and sent off on a mission of righteousness with these powers. My view is that we ALL are given this mission—“…to do justly, to love mercy, and to walk humbly with my God.” (Micah 6:8)  

So how does that translate to a superhero such as Spiderman, the Hulk, or the Fantastic Four? Take a guy that happens to have super powers, then make him a Christian. How does he act?

The goal was to create a story more about people in extraordinary situations.  To take a man who finds redemption and and faith, and have to live out that faith in spite of the “super” things he can do.  In the end, we have a riveting, powerful story that holds it’s own in the Graphic Novel marketplace.

It’s not so much a “Christian” story than it is a story about a man who becomes a Christian, and an exploration into what “good” really means.  It’s not a glorified tract.  We won’t beat you over the head with the Bible.  It’s not in-your-face…it’s just an element of the story.  The reaction to the book has been incredible.  Here are some examples:

“I cannot recommend it highly enough. It has honesty, it has humanity, and it has hook.” Scot Eaton, Worship and the Arts

“Hand of the Morningstar is good. Very good in fact.  I was pleasantly taken aback as I read through these, in one sitting no less, at how much took me by genuine surprise. And they do many good things from healing over-farmed land to saving the president from terrorist attacks. In the course of the first book, they meet a super-powered eco-terrorist named "The Tempest," who uses the powers of a storm (rain, lightning, and wind) to violently attack oil rigs, deforestation projects, and other things around the world which exploit the earth. Never mind that he often does more harm than good. Titan, the group leader of the Hand, defeats him and leaves him for dead. This, despite being at the end of Volume 1, is where the true story begins.

The Tempest, aka Michael Tempe, washes up on the coast of Argentina, near-dead and powerless, or so he thinks. He is nursed back to health by a missionary and his daughter, and in the process becomes a follower of Christ. During a hurricane, he rediscovers his powers and starts using them for good.

campaign.story:
ROBIN SNYDER AND STEVE DITKO are pleased to announce the publication of a new title in their 26th year of publishing. Thank you for your continuing support. But what have we been doing lately? We have been busy...
The Four-Page Series
The Comics!
The Ditko Public Service Package #2
Laszlo’s Hammer
#9 Teen
#20
Now comes one more book. Our next title is nearly finished. All we have to do is add your name to the list of Backers, carefully review it one more time and send it to the printer. That new title is Mr. A.
Mr. A. first appeared in Wally Wood’s witzend in 1967. The image I have included in this presentation is from the first story.
The mid-1960s were a tumultuous time of upheaval, transition, exploration and pressure. I have been reading and thinking about the men and characters and ideas in the 1960s in American Comic Book Chronicles: 1965-69 by John Wells (TwoMorrows). Here is a sampling of quotations from that book and that time...
“Over the course of a forty page story in His Name Is…Savage #1 (June 1968), a jailed U.S. spy was returned to action to thwart the cyborg General Simon Mace from murdering president Lyndon Johnson. Blood flowed freely in the story, punctuated by moments of shocking gore like a hand being crushed to an oozing pulp or a gun shattering a man’s teeth as it was shoved into his mouth.”
Charles Hauser, of the Greensboro Daily News, cancelled Dick Tracy and Little Orphan Annie. “It wasn’t that the strips contain a great deal of violence, but rather that they advocated it.”
“Did I make a mistake in showing Jackie as an American soldier without a single stereotype action, name, or word to mark him as a Negro,” Robert Kanigher wondered. “Did I make a mistake in not having him dance or sing or play a horn—to keep him in the usual typed roles for Negroes? Did I make a mistake in thinking that Jackie’s skin was khaki-colored like everyone in Easy? The silence then, makes me regretfully think so.”
“S. Clay Wilson completed the Zap Comix quartet and, in some ways, influenced the direction of underground comix just as much as Crumb had. Their content was undeniably not for children, interwoven as it was with profanity, drug usage, nudity and innuendo. Wilson, though, pushed barriers that shocked even his colleagues, creating images of grotesqueries, mutilation, and sexual deviancy.”
It was in this period that Steve Ditko created, wrote and illustrated the first story featuring Mr. A. Fan and journalist Don Thompson, in the pages of Comic Art #7, 1968, was one of the first to comment on Ditko’s new direction. Here is the opening of his editorial, The Word, for that unique publication.
“I have been increasingly disturbed of late by unpleasant developments in Steve Ditko’s work. I am an admirer of his artwork, and, until recently, of his plots. But his work since leaving Marvel has been propaganda—and badly done propaganda at that—for a frightening philosophy.”
On the other hand… Here is a reprint of an editorial of ours from the November 2012 number of The Comics!
THE MOST ORIGINAL NAME IN THE COMICS
Pioneering Wally Wood wrote of his new publication, witzend, that it “is a platform, a vehicle, for any idea in any form. Our theory is that an artist is his own best editor, and left to his own devices will turn out his best work.”
Wood wanted only first-publication rights to the work. All rights to the property remained with the writer and/or artist.
There have been a number of creator-owned concepts, titles or characters that have stood the test of time.
Jack Kirby produced half-a-dozen characters such as Captain Victory, Silver Star, Secret City, etc.
Batton Lash began publishing Wolff and Byrd, Counselors of the Macabre, in 1979.
Dave Sim’s Cerebus ran from 1977 to 2004 and is still going strong in reprints.
Steve Ditko introduced his new character, Mr. A., in witzend #3, 1967.
Consider the state of the hero in the comics and film at that time.
And compare that with the idea and character of Mr. A.
This is a unique achievement.
Why is that?
Mr. A. is not like just any other character.
Mr. A. and not his creator would set the standards.
The basics were there from the beginning.
In Masters of Comic Book Art, Ditko explained that “Mr. A. is based on Ayn Rand’s theory of justice, on Aristotle’s Law of Identity, his definition of man and his view of art.”
The value of Mr. A. has always been the Law of Identity, a basic law in metaphysics and epistemology, hence objective justice in ethics.
It is especially intriguing to realize there is no origin story for this character. He arrived full-blown and fully developed.
Imagine what must have taken place in the mind of his creator for him to be able to bring this character to publication?
Ditko, like his creation, takes ideas seriously.
The man and his creation are still at it 45 years later.
Mr. A is timeless because the morality of A is A is timeless.
Mr. A. is not locked into a particular idea, theme, format or publisher.
Mr. A. is at home in the 1960s or the 21st century.
Here then is our salute to the timely and timeless Mr. A. and his creator, the most original name in the comics.
                                                                                         Robin Snyder
                                                        ***
This brings ius to today and this announcement.
How many times have you been frustrated by a review that gave away the plot, theme, characters and surprises in a new book or movie?
One of the several hosts of Turner Movie Classics recently introduced a George Sanders picture by telling us the plot and revealing the name of the mystery murderer.
We will do no such thing. Here or in the pages of our newsletters, The Four-Page Series and The Comics!
We do have plenty to say about that which we have already produced. Look to right side of this Introduction and scroll down to the link that reads “See full bio”. You will find more paragraphs there about us than you can shake a stick at.
We invite you to place your Pledge for this unique publication.
This story, artwork and covers of this new book are already complete.  It will be in the same size and format (6 1/2 x 10 1/4, saddle-stich, black-and-white) as those in The 32 Series. The money you Pledge for the project will go toward the costs of printing, production and distribution of 1,000 copies of our new title.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are no risks and challenges in the production of The Return of Mr. A. As we wrote earlier, the book is complete but for your participation and the recording of your name in the Honor Roll. We are making arrangements for the printing and will be ready to handle any and all orders you give to us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Yes, it has been five years since the return of Mr. A. to the comics. You helped fund that presentation.
The book, Mr. A. no. 15, is one of the best-selling issues we have published. Not the best but one of the best.
Can you guess which issue has sold more than any other?

Mr. A. no. 15 continues to sell and attract attention. Thanks to you and your initial support which brought about the successful campaign in 2014.
We have been asked about a complete collection of this original character, reprints of issues that have gone out of print and whether or not there will be further issues and stories. 
We can tell you there will be further issues in the series.

This campaign of 2014 contained a new issue of Mr. A. after too long. Now we are preparing a new campaign and another book.
  Look for Mr. A. Returns in Kickstarter. Unlike the earlier issue, this one is a 48-page anthology comic. 
What do you think?

We have published a great number of titles through Kickstarter, more than 20. #9 Teen to Wha!? Which have been our best-sellers? 
  Keerect. Mr. A. Two are already out of print: The first number and no. 17. 
  Perhaps we should publish another and soon?
  We already have several titles in production for this year. We are now campaigning for the second issue of The Hero Comics. After that comes...?

Three years later and the book you helped fund, the first issue of Mr. A., is close to going out of print. Thanks again for your help with this work. 
  Yes, we will reprint this issue but not yet. We are working on our schedule for 2018 this weekend and on our next book, Mr. A. no. 7. This one is being offered in our current Kickstarter campaign. There are only three days to go before this one closes. Take a look and see how far we have progressed from the first issue to today.

You may be interested to know that we are publishing another issue of Mr. A. to coincide with his 50th anniversary. Look for
  Mr. A. by Snyder and Ditko
  in Kickstarter.
Thanks again for your earlier support for our work.

Two years later and we are now now in a campaign to publish another issue of Mr. A. 
  This will be the third issue since 2014.
  We will celebrate the character's fifty years in this issue. 
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1704592942/anniversary-by-snyder-and-ditko?ref=creator_nav

Thank you again for your support to bring Mr. A. back to the comics. This title continues to see for us.
  Foir those who came in late, here is an update. We are publishing another issue of the most original character in the comics.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1704592942/mr-a-returns-by-snyder-and-ditko

Kickstarter informs us it has been one year since you helped fund the Campaign to publish Mr. A. #15. 
  Thank you. 
  This has been our most successful Campaign to date. This title continues to sell to individuals and our distributors.

Lonnie Devin, Michael Manley and Kim Scarborough,
We need your addresses so we can mail your Rewards.
  May we also recommend:
  https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1704592942/past-present-and-future-by-snyder-and-ditko?ref=use

project_data.project_name: Mr. A. by Robin Snyder and Steve Ditko

campaign.story:
For a long, long time, goblins and fairies have lived in a magical world right beneath our noses. If you look hard enough, you can find rings of mushrooms, called “fairy rings”, which act as doors between their world and ours. Today, a gang of mischievous goblins escaped from the fairy ring, and it is up to YOU to send them back before they cause trouble! But an ancient spell of rhymes which transforms goblins into fairies and fairies into goblins makes this a trickier task than you might think…
David Sanhueza and Mike Maihack are once again teaming up, this time to create beautifully printed books based on the lively goblin and fairy characters from the hit family card game Goblins Drool, Fairies Rule! 
With your support, we're creating the Goblins Drool, Fairies Rule, Cool For School Coloring Book. We have recruited cartoonist Josh Ulrich to convert all of Mike's beautiful illustrations of mischievous goblins and adorable fairies from the game into B&W line art. They're being assembled into this deluxe coloring book for little artists everywhere.
We are also producing an unlimited, softcover edition of The Art of Goblins Drool, Fairies Rule! This 100-page full-color book is a doorway into our magical world of goblins and fairies, and peels back the curtain on how these charming works of art came into being.
This project is perfect for fans of children's fantasy, and for collectors of great art. Books like these helped us discover and grow our own artistic talents when we were kids. And we sincerely hope that, through this project, we can contribute to the nourishment of your children's creative abilities and imaginations. Welcome to our colorful world of rhyme and reason! 
Here's what we're making... 
The Goblins Drool, Fairies Rule, Cool For School Coloring Book will be an 8.5 x 11 inch, 50-page, softcover book. Whether using crayons, markers, colored pencils, or coloring on the computer, your children will be able to bring these whimsical characters to life in their own unique style. 
This book will far exceed the production quality you would expect from a typical store-bought coloring book. The pages will be clear white, on durable paper stock, encased by a perfect-bound glossy cover. This book, and the pages your family will color within it, will be printed to last. 
Above are just a few of the pages patiently waiting to be colored by creative hands. Between the cute illustrations and funny descriptions, coloring this delightful book will be an activity your family will enjoy doing together!
The Art of Goblins Drool, Fairies Rule! features all of the beautiful full-color illustrations from the game, raw sketches, insights into the world of fairies and goblins, interviews with the creators (us!), and a “behind the scenes” look at the creative process that went into the unique artwork. 
Backers who pledge for The Art of GDFR! will receive an 8.5 x 11 inch book, perfect-bound with a glossy softcover. 
We're bringing this softcover edition of the Art Book to Kickstarter, because we want to share it with a larger audience. We are very proud of the unique quality of Mike's illustrations, and the contents of this book that Mike and David put together.
If we successfully reach our funding goal, we will be able to print this book in larger quantities than the previous limited-edition. A larger print volume translates into a lower price point, making the book more affordable to more readers. The lower price point will also greatly increase our chances of getting the Art Book into wider distribution through book stores.
The hardcover version of The Art of Goblins Drool, Fairies Rule! was a limited-edition reward created for the GDFR game Kickstarter. Less than 150 copies were ever printed.  
This book is absolutely beautiful in person. Every copy reserved through this Kickstarter campaign will be personally signed and dedicated by either Mike or David (your choice!)
The digital books are an affordable and green way for you to support this project, explore our world of goblins and fairies, and obtain all of this amazing artwork. Every pledge level for physical rewards will also include digital copies of both books. 
Additional Rewards...
Coloring Books received from the "Old Man Sock", "Rhyme And Reason", and "I Am The Goblin King" pledge levels will come with a page hand-colored for you! You can pick the page, or leave it up to us. Just like the signed hardcover Art Books, you will have the option of choosing Mike or David to color and sign the page for you. 
By pledging at the "I Am The Goblin King" level, you become an official member of our team. Your name will be added to the credits of both the Coloring Book and the Art Book. In addition to the credits pages, you will also be thanked on the back cover of the Coloring Book. You can be credited as a "Special Thank You", "Executive Producer", "Goblin King", "Fairy Princess", or anything else you suggest that is in the creative spirit of these books. This is just a small way for us to thank you for bringing this project to life with your generous pledge. 
These colorful 11 x 14 inch prints are the perfect way to bring light and personality into the homes of fairy and goblin lovers like you. The "Rhyme And Reason" pledge level comes with 2 prints of your choice. The "I Am The Goblin King" pledge level includes prints of all 40 Goblins Drool, Fairies Rule! characters, the Team Goblin illustration, and a new yet-to-be-revealed illustration. We know that these charming images will be treasured artifacts in your art collection. Unlike the standard prints available through Society6, these limited-edition Art Prints will be personally signed by Mike Maihack.
___________________________________________________
Made In The USA
All books and rewards created from this project are being printed in the U.S.A.
Go Team  
Mike created all of the original illustrations for this project. He is in charge of coloring and dedicating books for the upper-level pledges, as well as personally creating the art prints.  
Josh is doing all of the inking for the Coloring Book, turning Mike's delicately-textured renderings of goblins and fairies into clean B&W pages for you and your children to color.  
David is the editor for both books. He creates the layout, does the writing and graphic design, and handles the file submissions to the printer. He is also the primary point of contact for this project.
Show Me The Money
The money you pledge to this project will be used for the following: 
Pay for the inking of the Coloring Book pages
Setup and proofing fees for the printer
Pay for the printing of the books
Pay for shipping all rewards to our backers
The Pledge Levels 
Shipping
Shipping and handling is already included in the pledge levels for U.S. backers. For our international friends (including our neighbors in the Great Wide North) please read the notes under each pledge level on the right, for additional shipping costs to backers outside the U.S. 
Add-Ons
If you would like to add extra books or prints to your pledge level, here's what you do:
If you have pledged $15 or more, you may: 
add $6 to your pledge for each extra Coloring Book. Please add an additional $2 for shipping to Canada or Europe, and $3 for shipping to any other location outside the U.S.
add $25 to your pledge for each extra Softcover Art Book. Please add an additional $2 for shipping to Canada or Europe, and $3 for shipping to any other location outside the U.S.
If you have pledged $48 or more, you may: 
add $50 to your pledge for each extra Signed Hardcover Art Book. Please add an additional $3 for shipping outside the U.S.
add $20 to your pledge for each extra Signed Art Print (no extra charge for international shipping.) 
You may add multiple copies of each reward, if you wish. When you have adjusted your pledge, PLEASE send us a quick message, to let us know:
How much money you have added to your pledge,
the specific add-ons you want,
and to which country they will be shipping to. 
Thank you!
Tales from Far and Near
Tales from Far and Near is another Kickstarter project, currently running, that is creating a beautifully-illustrated children's book of fairy tales. In addition to the book, the artwork is also being offered as prints (including a bonus "Little Red Riding Hood" print by Mike Maihack!), and as a set of 26 postcards featuring every fairy tale character from the book.     
The project creator has very generously donated multiple sets of the postcards for Goblins Drool, Fairies Rule backers!   
All backers who pledge for the Cuckoo Clock ($60) or higher pledge level on our project, will automatically get a set of the 26 postcards included with your rewards, free of charge!
If your pledge level is lower than the $60 level, you can still obtain these postcards as an add-on. Just add $20 to your pledge, and send us a message letting us know that you want a postcard set (no additional shipping charge for international backers.) 
_____________________________________________________
Thank You! 
Thank you for taking the time to look at our Kickstarter project. If you choose to support our hard work, we promise to deliver final products that we can all be proud to be a part of. 
Telling your friends about us is another incredibly helpful way you can contribute to this project's success. Every backer counts!
If you would like to find out more about Game-O-Gami, and the other exciting projects we're creating, you can follow us on: 
Our Website
Facebook
Twitter
                   Backer Badges
Proudly display your support for Goblins Drool, Fairies Rule! with these free profile / avatar images.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
More than half of the Coloring Book pages have been completed. Josh will be able to continue inking new pages through the duration of this campaign, and is scheduled to finish shortly after it ends. The files for the Art Book are already finished and ready for submission to the printer. From previous experience, we know what to expect from turn-around times for file submission and print proofing, and how long the printing and delivery of the books should take. 

Based on our past book-making experience, and the plan we have put into place, we are confident that we can finish this project and deliver all rewards to you by our early-December deadline. However, should any unforeseen events cause a delay in our production schedule, we promise to tell you about it. We will let you know what is happening, what we are doing to resolve the issue, and how much of a delay you can expect. We're in this together, and want you to know that you can count on us as much as we're counting on you. Thank you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Final 2 Days! - Immortal: An Art Book of Myths and Legends on Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Dear Friends and Backers, 
I hope you are doing well! For my fellow Americans, I wish you a very fun upcoming Memorial Day weekend. :) 
I wanted to give you all an update on my current Kickstarter project for the Immortal Art Book. Right now the project is at 82% funding, with a little more than 48 hours left to go. Based on our average pledge amount, that means we need less than 20 new backers to successfully reach our goal.

updates.update_userinfo: On Kickstarter Now! - The Art Book of Myths and Legends
updates.update_content:
Good morning, good afternoon, and good evening to our wonderful backers! 
The Kickstarter project for Immortal - An Art Book of Myths and Legends from around the World just launched today!!! Check it out HERE.

Dear Friends and Backers,
I am very excited to share with you the news of my next project coming to Kickstarter! Immortal is an art and game project, combining three of my greatest passions: games, world mythology, and amazing artwork! This is a project I have been working on for over 3 years, along with some incredibly talented artists: Xia Taptara, Monika Palosz, Kian Ng, Grant Griffard, and Milek Jakubiec.

Dear friends, 
I hope you and your families have been enjoying the Goblins Drool, Fairies Rule! books. Those of you who have yet to receive them, your rewards are on the way. The next item I am working on is getting the PDF books to you. I'm hoping to have that taken care of by the end of this week. 
I'm happy to announce that both the Coloring Book and the Art Book are now available for sale on !

Hello everyone! Just taking a quick break from holiday celebrating (i.e. eating and hibernating) to let you know that I really enjoy reading your reactions to the books. I'm looking forward to more of your comments, seeing the pages that your families have colored, and to sharing more news with you. 
- David L. Sanhueza
Here's a message from Mike:

Hello good people...  
The Goblins Drool, Fairies Rule! books are on their way! Some of you have already received your copies. Many more of you will be receiving them in the mail, in the next few days. So most of you will have your books in hand, about a month earlier than we planned. 
Now, we're probably not breaking any Kickstarter records, but I've got to believe that finishing early puts us in a pretty exclusive club.  :)

Hey everyone, I have a series of great news...
All of the final inked pages were submitted by Josh, and editing of both books is complete.
I submitted the files to the printer, for proofing before producing your copies.
The proofs arrived today... and they look and feel AWESOME!
I am very excited, and wanted to share this with you in a quick update. I'll take some photos and post them soon so you can see.

campaign.story:
OVER 120 pages full color pages, this edition collects issues 1 through 5 of the groundbreaking STEAM WARS series by Fred Perry.
PLAY

It's time to print and release the STEAM WARS TPB, which collects issues 1 through 5 of the Steam Wars color series. If you supported our other Kickstarters thank you very much (and we hope you support this campaign) but if you are new to Antarctic Press, we appreciate you taking the time to look over this new Kickstarter.
If you're not familiar with us, we are Antarctic Press, a small, independent comic company started in 1984. My name is Joeming Dunn and during those 30 years we have published some of the greatest and best independent comics. I personally have collected comics of almost every type and genre since 1974. The comic industry has changed over the years so we have started our Kickstarter program to help introduce new projects from our talented group of creators.
Over the years, we have published a number of series. Prominent among these is Fred Perry's ingenious title, Gold Digger. You may be familiar with Gold Digger which Fred describes as a mixture of Indiana Jones and Final Fantasy. It is the second-longest-running solo created title in the industry and in 2013, Fred was honored at Comic Con International in San Diego, where he received an Inkpot Award for his work on Gold Digger.
Steam Wars is another creation by Fred, putting his prodigious artistic talent to spinning a tale based on some his favorite SF/space opera epics.  Not so long ago, in a galaxy relatively close by began an epic struggle on a world seized in the grip of an evil Victorian empire. Only a ragged alliance of rebels oppose the emperor and his black guard, but hope is fading. While fleeing from the steam-driven war machines of her imperial pursuers, Duchess Imoen stumbles across the home of the last Dragoon: the legendary storm foil warriors of ancient lore! This new and unique steam-fantasy epic will give thrills that haven’t been felt since 1977!
If you haven't already seen or read STEAM WARS this is your chance to enjoy one of the best  series in comics! Fred is known worldwide for his work in comics. Here are some reviews
http://whatchareading.com/steam-wars-a-star-wars-parody-no-something-different/
http://www.geek-retreat.com/free-comic-review-steam-wars-1/
http://fanboyfactor.com/2014/04/comic-review-steam-wars-1-fcbd-special-antarctic-press/
I have included THE FIRST ISSUE of this great project for everyone to review. Just click on the link below.
www.antarcticpresslibrary.com/GDBrickIV/SteamWars1FCBD.pdf
What are we going to do with the Kickstarter money?
Plain and simple, we're going to print and ship the Steam Wars TPB.
To start with Kickstarter takes their cut of the project which is around 10% of the cost, then the Steam Wars TPB  is over 120 pages in FULL COLOR.  Printing the actual books is the biggest single expense. The first print run of a typical Gold Brick costs in excess of $5,000, as most printers require a minimum run to make it cost-effective, and we are using Kickstarter to help assists us with those costs. Another cost is shipping: First we will have to ship the books from the printer to our offices, and then once we get them, send copies to all our supporters and distributors. Several thousand pounds of books represents a significant shipping cost.
So what do you get?
The trade is about 7 x 10 inches and will contain issues 1 through 5 of the Steam Wars Series.  You can see the covers to all 5 issues above.
Here are the rewards we are offering.
 We have a nice set of stretch goals...
Add-Ons
We also decided to offer some Add-Ons!

Choose the pledge level of the highest-price item you would like. (E.g., if you want a extra copy, please choose the reward for the extra copy)

Increase your pledge level by the amount of the add-on you would like to add! For instance, if you pledged for the softcover reward level and also want a print, just add that amount.)

After the Kickstarter campaign is over, we will contact you personally and then ask what you want for your extra contribution.

Here is what you can currently add by increasing your pledge. (Please note that Kickstarter rules state that we cannot sell you any more than ten of any one item.)
This is a different type of Add-on...this book by Fred was offered through our normal distribution channels and with many things in the comic industry it is hard to get new and interesting projects out into the marketplace and it did not do well in the regular channels. So we are offering this book via Kickstarter in hopes of getting enough add-ons to help us get this book out. The added bonus of this add-on is that if you support it, it will help reach the stretch goals for Steam Wars
 Thanks for taking a look at our Kickstarter, books like these would be near impossible to produce and print without supporters like yourself. Make sure you check out the full first issue preview (check the link at the beginning) or here are a few sample pages from issue #1.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks inherent in any project. This project has very few risks; the book is already done, and all we just need to do is raise the funds, pay the printer, and get it made. Our biggest risk is that we won't get the funding, and then the book won't be made.

We have been printing and releasing books for close to 30 years, so we have a good relationship with our printer and do not anticipate any hiccups.

There is always the risk that we won't be able to get the books in on time due to a variety of factors, but again, we do not anticipate that sort of problem.

We believe in full disclosure and we will make sure to keep you all updated on the progress of the book and all the incentives.

We have COMPLETELY fulfilled and completed three other Kickstarters (including the Zombie Deck, Gold Brick III and Last Zombie Omnibus and fulfilled 35% of our Gold Brick IV Kickstarter (we are just waiting for the books to arrive to fulfill the rest). The printer we are using for this project is the same one that we have dealt with for many years so we do not anticipate any printing issues.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The time has come.... to fund a second volume of Penultimate Quest. Last year was a smash success and I'm happy to bring my next volume to Kickstarter.
Penultimate Quest is the story of Harald Nussbaum, an adventurer exploring a never-ending dungeon on a mysterious island. As he begins to search for a way off of the island he begins to unravel the very fabric of reality.
Penultimate Quest began in January 2012 as a way to have some fun with fantasy game tropes, but as I sat down to look for an explanation for a "never-ending dungeon" I began to develop a much wider story.
At this point Penultimate Quest is more than a parody of video game and fantasy tropes, it's also an exploration of philosophy and meaning without being long-winded and preachy. There are always monsters to be killed and loot to be had.
This book is now a reflection of all of my interests; the modern world, history, Plato, Tolkien, escapism, Christianity, Moroccan food, King Arthur, Final Fantasy and story ideas that didn't fit anywhere else.
As always all of my work, including this one, can be read online at my website. My comic is rated PG-13 for "Adult Situations, Language and Violence," the same as Lawrence of Arabia. Incomputech is the author of the music used in the video.
For any of the tiers it will be possible to add additional copies of Volume 1 or 2 for an additional $12.00, or a custom drawing outside of it's tier for $15. Custom drawings are of you (or anyone you want) fighting a barbarian as a fantasy class. Or we can work something out : )
Every book will be signed and doodled in. All levels will receive a link to download a PDF copy of volume 1. Next year I will finish the story with Volume 3. Cheers!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Last time I began with the plan of doing print on demand, but when I received so much more I upgraded to traditional offset printing. Offset printing has a much higher cost, but having already gone through one book I know what to expect. This does require that my starting goal be higher, but as long as I can hit this amount I can fulfill the orders and get everything sent out. Last time I was a month or two behind on fulfillment, but that will not be a problem thanks to past experience.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! Thank you for having backed Penultimate Quest 2.
I just started the Kickstarter for the final volume. Please check it out.

updates.update_userinfo: Most orders out, one tier left
updates.update_content:
Hey guys. I realize that I've gone over my time limit. I just finished the last custom drawing book and I'll be shipping out nearly all of those tomorrow, domestic and international.
The final tier will be the commission tier. I'm sorry guys, but I do put my all into these and they will be worth it.
I do apologize about any lateness and thank you all for your support.

updates.update_userinfo: Guess who has 14 boxes of comic books in his office?
updates.update_content:
Answer: me.
And you all can help me clear up some space by filling out the surveys : )
The PDF's are still going to take me a little bit of time.
For the original art tier I have already updated and made the page for selecting pages. I still have to go in order of backers, which is why I ask for multiple page choices.

It's been a little bit of time and I just wanted to give a quick update on the status of the books. I have been told by the printer that they are in a busy season, so even though I sent the order in a month ago I won't have the books until after August 11th. This is still within the posted date, but in the next few days I'll start the process of asking for addresses so that I can start making commissions and collecting pictures.
If you're in the tier for having a drawing of yourself in the book you'll want to make sure to have a picture ready to email to me. In general everything is good, but taking a little longer than planned.

Awesome job, everybody! I'm more than happy to have funded the book (and shipping) and gotten slightly more backers than the first book. 
It is also very gratifying to see the support I got. I know I'm going to miss some, but special thanks to Aaron Diaz, Kurt Busiek, Kris Straub, KC Green, Joe Decie, Sam Logan, Matt Nelson, Gabe Bautista, Gary Tyrell and everyone else who shared a link, reblogged or retweeted an announcement. All of my backers and supporters, you all rock!

Hey guys, I wanted to do a post highlighting some other good comic Kickstarters.
Skidmarks - https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1798663454/skidmarks-a-mini-comic-collection Derek gave me some of his mini-comics awhile ago and I remember them being quite funny. Now he's working on Adventure Time, which is awesome!
Cuttings - https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/746734715/cuttings-a-johnny-wander-collection Yuko's work is so great and this is just a big collection lovely work.

Once more, thank you everybody. We're nearly to the goal!
I'm considering adding a goal. I usually hold off in favor of a simple and streamlined campaign, but I'm willing to steal the additional content goal from Yuko and Anath's Cuttings. In this case there's a short story set on the island that I've been wanting to do.
For now though keep spreading the word and below I'm going to post some of the production thumbnails from book 2.

Thanks so much everyone, after three days the project is already halfway funded. If I get more than what I asked for it definitely helps me in making more comics. Especially this summer. Last year I lost my job and went back into substitute teaching, it pays enough but there's obviously no work during the summer. I've got the final book of Penultimate Quest and two other projects that I want to work on, so anything extra helps keep me at the drawing desk. 
The plan right now is definitely to be done with the last volume of Penultimate Quest next Spring, although from the notes it looks like it might be nearly as long as the first two parts together.

campaign.story:
The project: Arclight Volume One is my first art collection. I’m Joe Wight, a professional comic creator who’s written and drawn comics for the past 20+ years. Around 1988, I began self-publishing my own series called Twilight X. I published three issues as an independent before Antarctic Press approached me to do a miniseries
SAMPLE INTERIORS
Since then, I’ve worked with AP for many years doing not only Twilight X, but also working on Warrior Nun, Shotgun Mary, Robotech, Gold Digger, Ninja High School, and more recently The Last Zombie and Nazi Zombies. I’ve also done work for Dark Horse Comics’ Star Wars Manga and the French publisher Paquet’s Cockpit Collection, where I wrote and drew the book First Moon to tell the Apollo 11 story. I also colored covers and interiors for Marvel and Image Comics.
Some of the covers for Briane Keene's Last Zombie
Aircraft art for Flying Tigers Pilots' Association, First Moon, and Twilight X
This book shows off many different genres of (mostly) covers I’ve done over the years. While I’ve selected more than 100 paintings for the book, it’s a small fraction of all my work.
Covers for Manga EX, King of Zombies, Gigantor, Robotech, and Mangazine
This art book will focus on covers, not sequential/comic art, although it does contain a few sketches and panels from some of my books. I’ve planned this book for a long time, and many of my fans have asked me when they could get a collection just like this. I’ve hand-picked a wide variety of what I consider my best works in full color.
Over the years, I’ve collected many art books, sketchbooks, and ashcans from other artists to inspire me to enjoy, learn, and improve as an artist. I’ve also posted many of my works on Deviantart: 
http://joewight.deviantart.com/gallery/
Covers for various steampunks, fanart, and Planet of the Living Dead
What are we going to do with the Kickstarter money?
The money is going to be used to print and ship the ArcLight 01 book. The book itself will be 8.5 x 11 in size and in full color. It will be on gloss paper with a 10 pt printed cover. Printing the actual books will be the biggest single expense. I will be using a dependable printer who is experienced in printing books of this size and  in the quality that I demand. Another cost is shipping: First we will have to ship the books from the printer to our offices, and once we get them, send copies to all our supporters and distributors. Shipping books represents a significant expense.
Here are some more examples of what will be in the book.
Hammer tribute, Shotgun Mary, a little more steampunk, and Twilight X
Here are some of the rewards we are offering:
Add-Ons
LAST ZOMBIE ORIGINAL PENCIL ART
Go behind the scenes of the first graphic novel THE LAST ZOMBIE: Dead New World. These are my ORIGINAL pencils. I scanned each of these penciled pages and then painted and toned them in Photoshop. They are actual comic book sized (6.5 x 10), so they’re smaller than the big 11 x 17 boards I usually work on. I drew most of The Last Zombie series on these smaller, semi-gloss sheets to help keep the pencils from smudging. If you add-on $25 per page, you will receive a hand-selected original art page from The Last Zombie. Shipping is free!
At the end of the campaign, I’ll try to accommodate requests for specific pages. At that time, I will contact each person who pledged individually, and you may request the specific page(s) you want, and if available, it’s yours! The pages will be allocated to those who first pledged for the add-on, so I can’t guarantee every page request, but I’ll sure try! Feel free to send me a note with any questions. The choices aren’t limited to the sample pages below. If you have a specific page in mind, you can tell me the issue and page number from either series, and I’ll let you know if it’s available!
ORIGINAL COMIC ART
Many of you have asked about original art as an add on and here it is! I’m offering a limited number of original art pages from my Twilight X and Nazi Zombies series.  If you add-on $200, you will receive a hand-selected original art page from either Twilight X or Nazi Zombies. At the end of the campaign, I’ll try to accommodate requests for specific pages. At that time, I will contact each person who pledged individually, and you may request the specific page(s) you want, and if available, it’s yours! The pages will be allocated to those who first pledged for the add-on, so I can’t guarantee every page request, but I’ll sure try! Feel free to send me a note with any questions. The choices aren’t limited to the sample pages below. If you have a specific page in mind, you can tell me the issue and page number from either series, and I’ll let you know if it’s available!
Increase your pledge level by the amount of the add-on you would like to add! For instance, if you pledged for the softcover edition level and also want a print, just add that amount.)
After the Kickstarter campaign is over, we will contact you personally and then ask what you want for your extra contribution.
Here is what you can currently add by increasing your pledge. (Please note that Kickstarter rules state that we cannot sell you any more than ten of any one item.
WE MADE OUR FIRST STRETCH GOAL!
See below for the next stretch goal news!
 NEW STRETCH GOAL!
This is a great graphic novel I did withsome spectacular artists like Fred Perry, Brian Denham, Rod Espinosa, Kelsey Shannon, and David Hutchison!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks inherent in any project. This project has very few risks; the book is already done, and all we just need to do is raise the funds, pay the printer, and get it made. The biggest risk is that I won't get the funding, and then the book won't be made.

I have been involved with printing and releasing books with AP for almost 20 years, and I have a good relationship with the printer and do not anticipate any problems.

There is always the risk that we won't be able to get the books in on time due to a variety of factors, but again, I do not anticipate that sort of problem.

I also believe in full disclosure and I will make sure to keep you all updated on the progress of the book and all the incentives.

updates.update_content:
As we close out the year and I try to keep up with work and holidays, I want to send all of you my very best wishes to you and your families!
I know there's just one or two things left to mail, but I'd like to ask everyone to send me a note if they are still waiting for anything from me.
You've all been so patient and enthusiastic, I can't say what that means to a dumb artist!

I really can't express how grateful I am to you all for your support, generosity, enthusiasm, and your patience with Book One.
It's been a steep learning curve for me, as a dumb working artist, to handle the logistics of printing, distribution, and customer service on this project. Your backing and understanding attitude can't be overestimated, and the great book we've created is proof of this.
Next time, it'll be much more streamlined and efficient.

campaign.story:
Beware the creatures of the night—They have lawyers! Alanna Wolff and Jeff Byrd have an unusual law practice: defending monsters and the supernaturally afflicted!
This 160-page fully four-color trade paperback contains seven stories featuring the attorneys and some of their most bizarre clients.
The Contents
The lead story, Zombie Wife (aka: “My Husband Killed Me and Now He Must Pay . . . Damages!”) focuses on Mary Lou Henderson, who has come back from the dead to sue her husband for “wrongful death” (he thinks he’s gotten away with murder!). See how “Gracie Nance” covers the case on “Trial TV.” (The story was originally serialized online.)
Next up is “Werewolves . . . and the Women Who Love Them.” In a segment of the “Dr. Fill Show,” a woman calling herself Diana X talks about her desires for a werewolf, “Larry T,” a client of Wolff & Byrd. (This story appeared in black and white in Supernatural Law #42.)
Also from issue #42 is “Stakeout,” in which the attorneys are at a home on Long Island trying to protect Christopher Leach, who has been “outed” as a vampire and is now being hounded by the press. That segues into “A Vampire in Hollywood,” as Leach decides to accept his vampire heritage and has gone off to LaLa Land to seek fame as the star of his own biopic. Wolff & Byrd tag along to negotiate his contract, but then end up having to defend Leach when he’s accused of murder! (This story appeared in black and white in issue #43.)
That is followed by “The Gods Must Be Litigious,” the longest story in the book. The Immortal Medusa has come to Earth and written a bestselling book, How to Talk to a Mortal (If You Must). During an author appearance, a detractor targets her with a pie, and she turns him to stone. He recovers but sues, and Wolff & Byrd take her case. They must also deal with cartoonist Red Thrall, who has been skewering The Medusa in his newspaper strip. Lawsuits fly—will Zeus have to descend from Mount Olympus to intervene? (This story originally appeared online; it was reprinted in black and white in paperback form, which is now out of print.)
The last two stories feature a demon and a witch. In “This Man, This Demon?” mild-mannered Corman Ferly is accused of turning into a demon on a subway train and injuring dozens of people. 
And in “Something Wiccan” this way comes, wiccan Winter Thyme wants to stop the local Halloween parade because of its stereotypical treatment of witches. (The demon story originally appeared in black and white in The National Law Journal; the wiccan story originally appeared online.)
This book is the only way to get all of these stories in color, and the color work on these stories has received high praise.
The Foreword
The foreword to the book is being written by Michael Uslan, who has produced all the modern-era Batman movies beginning with Tim Burton's 1989 film. He has also produced a number of other films, has written comics including the recent Archie Marries Veronica, taught (with Roger Stern) the first accredited college course on the serious study of comics, and published his autobiography, The Boy Who Loved Batman, in 2011.
About the Project
Zombie Wife is a companion book to The Werewolf of New York, using the same cover and paper stock, and it is 7” x 10 ½”, the same size as the other Supernatural Law trades.
The money raised for the project will go toward the costs of printing and production of 1,000 copies of the book; production of premiums such as the trading cards, mousepad, calendar, T-shirt, pinup booklet, and Supernatural Law Companion; shipping; and Kickstarter and Amazon costs. 
The idea is to have the book out in July, in time for Comic-Con in San Diego. That way many backers will be able to pick up their copies at the show. 
The Backer Rewards 
 (Note that the backer reward levels are all named for characters in the book.) 
 In addition to the book itself, premiums include:
*A set of six trading cards, featuring the Supernatural Law cast. These will only be available to Kickstarter backers. 
*A Supernatural Law mousepad. Stay tuned for the design. 
*A pdf of The Werewolf of New York, the full-color 112-page Supernatural Law trade paperback published in 2013 wih the help of Kickstarter. 
*A Zombie Wife T-shirt, with design taken from the cover of the book. It will be black with this design:
* A 2015 Supernatural Law calendar, with artwork taken from the stories in the book. 
* A 32-page pinup booklet (comic book size) with color covers and black-and-white interior, that features drawings that comics pros have done of Wolff, Byrd, Mavis, and their clients over the years. Among artists to be included are Paul Pope, Frank Cho, Rick Geary, Roger Langridge, Shannon Wheeler, Donna Barr, Terry Moore, Michael T. Gilbert, Stan Sakai, Lea Hernandez, and Brian Michael Bendis. 
Paul pinups: A page from Paul Pope, and color art for the back cover by Paul Guinan
*The 100-page Supernatural Law Companion (6” x 9”), which provides synopses and background on every issue of the Wolff & Byrd/Supernatural Law and Mavis comic books and books, plus information on other appearances of the characters, cover sketches, and other goodies. 
*(Limited to 5 ALL GONE!) A handcrafted Supernatural Law pocket watch with fob; Wolff & Byrd are on one side and Mavis is on the other. These watches are made by Debbie Luccareni-Hogan and they include a necklace chain, a pocket watch chain, and a wooden box. These are absolutely beautiful and unique and we are fortunate to be able to get them from Miss Debbie.
New Level ADDED:
At the Desmond Vaughn level, you get the Supernatural Law Library: All seven current trade paperbacks plus Zombie Wife:
BACKER ADD-ONS
We've just added some add-ons! (May 2)
Here's how add-ons work: (1) Click on the "Manage Your Pledge" button for this project. (2) Increase your pledge in the Pledge Amount box by the total of the add-ons you want to add. (Do not change the tier you are currently pledged at, unless you really want to do so.) (3) At the end of the Kickstarter campaign you'll receive a survey that will allow you to indicate how you want the add-on money assigned, along with providing other information for fulfilling your pledge.
Werewolf pdf: At any level except Dr. Fill, add $10 to get a pdf of the 112-page 4-color graphic novel of The Werewolf of New York.
Another book: At any level, add $20 to get your choice of an additional Supernatural Law trade, choosing from Tales of Supernatural Law, The Soddyssey, Sonovawitch!, Vampire Brat, Mr. Negativity, or The Monsters Meet on Court Street.
The Supernatural Law Companion: At any level up through the $70 level, add $25 to get the Companion.
The Pinup Book: At any level up through the $70 level, add $25 to get the Companion.
Original painting: At any level, add $150 to your pledge, and Batton will do a 9" x 12" acrylic painting for you, with your choice of subject! You can request Wolff & Byrd, monsters, even superheroes. (Be aware that paintings take time, so fulfillment of this item may take longer than the promised date listed for your chosen level.) Here are some samples of past paintings:
We truly appreciate your support and hope you will let all your friends and colleagues know about this project. The book is howling to see print! And when you get your copy, you'll howl--with laughter!

If you will be at the Denver Comic-Con next weekend, be sure to stop by and say hello!

For your edification and enjoyment:
Foreword
by Michael Uslan
I grew up in a different era of monsters than kids and fans of today. Oh sure, there were those that scared the crap out of us—The Horror of Dracula, The House on Haunted Hill, Invaders from Mars, The Tingler—but there were an awful lot that mixed horror with comedy and did so brilliantly and effectively . . . and all those late-night TV monster movie reruns hosted by the scary/funny likes of Zacherle and Sammy Terry and The Cool Ghoul. There were those monsters who terrified us, and we wanted to see them die horribly—Dracula, The Blob, The Wicked Witch of the West—and those monsters we found misunderstood and sympathetic if not downright adorable: Gorgo, Rodan, The Creature from the Black Lagoon. Even later, in the era of blood ’n’ guts horror flicks, we could always find clever humor in such schlock horror movies as or (where “half-off” is only the beginning!)
