campaign.story:
A must for any fan of Brian Keene, zombies, or horror in general! 
It's time to print and release the infamous THE LAST ZOMBIE OMNIBUS, which collects all 25 issues of the LAST ZOMBIE comic series. 
If you're not familiar with us, my name is Joeming Dunn, and I run Antarctic Press, a small, independent comic company started in 1984. I have personally collected comics of almost every type and genre since 1974, and I can say that during the past 30 years, we have published some of the greatest and best independent comics out there. Our publishing history includes titles like Gold Digger and Ninja High School.  The comic industry has changed over the years, so we have started this Kickstarter program to help introduce new projects from our talented group of creators.
Prominent among our recent titles is Brian Keene's comic book series THE LAST ZOMBIE. Brian Keene is a two-time winner of the Bram Stoker Award and a Shocker Award-winner whose novels include THE RISING, JOBS IN HELL, GHOUL and CLICKERS.  He has also worked on a multitude of comic series for Marvel and DC, including Dead of Night: Devil-Slayer for Marvel. Over the past few years, we have had the pleasure of working with Brian on the LAST ZOMBIE series. The series itself has received numerous glowing reviews, a few of which you can find here:
http://blogcritics.org/comic-book-review-the-last-zombie1/
http://www.forbiddenplanet.co.uk/blog/2010/the-last-zombie-not-just-another-zombie-comic/
http://www.geeksofdoom.com/2013/01/01/comic-review-the-last-zombie-before-the-after-2
The series itself follows the frantic journey of Doctor Ian Scott, a man seeking his one ray of hope in a post-apocalyptic-nightmare United States. The zombies have come and mostly gone, but the disease is still out there threatening the survivors. The country swarms with roving packs of wild animals and worse, the most desperate of humans, who are ready to do whatever it takes to survive.  Through it all, Doctor Scott and a small team of soldiers and scientists must drive from Colorado to West Virginia to reunite him with the woman he loves...before its too late for either of them.
Over the course of the series, Brian has teamed up with artists Joe Wight (Twilight X, How to Draw and Fight Zombies, Star Wars: The Manga) and Fred Perry (Gold Digger, Zombie Kid Diaries), Brian Denham (Iron Man: Hypervelocity, X-Files, Crawling Sky), and Chris Allen to present this action-packed adventure.
If you haven't already seen or read THE LAST ZOMBIE, this is your chance to enjoy one of the best and longest-running zombie series in comics! Brian is known worldwide for his novels and short stories of the shambling undead and is recognized as one of the major forces behind the new era of zombie popularity.
I have included THE FIRST ISSUE of this great project for everyone to review. Just click on the link below.
http://issuu.com/antarcticpress/docs/lastzombie1
What are we going to do with the Kickstarter money?
Plain and simple, we're going to print and ship the Last Zombie: Zomnibus.
The Last Zombie series started in 2010 and ran for 25 issues. Many of the original printings of this book are now long sold out.

All told , THE LAST ZOMBIE series is over 600 pages, close in size to a phone book.  Printing the actual books will be the biggest single expense. The first print run of a typical trade this large costs in excess of $7,000 at least, as most printers require a minimum run to make it cost-effective, and we are using Kickstarter to help assist us with those costs. If the amount seems high, you must remember that we are printing at least 500 copies of a 500+ page book. Another cost is shipping: First we will have to ship the books from the printer to our offices, and once we get them, send copies to all our supporters and distributors. Several thousand pounds of books represents a significant shipping expense.
So what do you get?
The Last Zombie: Dead New World
The Last Zombie: Inferno
The Last Zombie: Neverland
The Last Zombie: Before the After
The Last Zombie: The End
The Zomnibus will be 6"x9" and contain all 25 issues of The Last Zombie which includes the following series. 
The Last Zombie: Dead New World
The Last Zombie: Inferno
The Last Zombie: Neverland
The Last Zombie: Before the After
The Last Zombie: The End
Here are the Rewards!
Add-Ons
We also decided to offer some Add-Ons!

Choose the pledge level of the highest-price item you would like. (E.g., if you want a signed edition please choose the reward for the signed edition level.)

Increase your pledge level by the amount of the add-on you would like to add! For instance, if you pledged for the signed edition level and also want a print, just add that amount.)

After the Kickstarter campaign is over, we will contact you personally and then ask what you want for your extra contribution.

Here is what you can currently add by increasing your pledge. (Please note that Kickstarter rules state that we cannot sell you any more than ten of any one item.) 

Again check out these great add-ons.
- $10 Signed Card from creator and writer Brian Keene
- $15 11x17 Print of the Zomnibus cover, signed by artist Joe Wight
- $25 24 x 36 poster of the Zomnibus cover, signed by artist Joe Wight
- $25 Copy of a Last Zombie TPB signed by creator and writer Brian Keene
- $25 If you ordered a regular printed edition already you can upgrade your edition to a HARDCOVER edition
-$35 For anybody who pledged $35 or more for a copy of the regular or hardcover edition...you can add on another copy of the regular edition Zomnibus for only $35...what a great gift idea for all your Zombie friends.
 IF WE PASS OUR GOAL...
Well we were thinking of doing a hardcover edition of the book, though we don't want too look to far ahead. We hope to be able to print this book, and once we surpass our goal (as we have with our other Kickstarters), we will immediately go to press so that the books will reach you as soon as possible. ADDENDUM: HARDCOVER NOW AVAILABLE 
 THE STRETCH GOALS
We have some really cool stretch goals, now most of these goals are quite ambitious. We appreciate all those who have supported this campaign thus far, maybe help us get the word out to help reach these goals. 
 $20,000 Goal: WE MADE IT!
  $22,500 Goal: You betcha we made it! Thanks all!
$25,000 Goal: Wow...can you believe it, if we hit this goal get ANOTHER never before seen Brian Keene short story.
These next few goals are also pretty ambitious, we have not seen the short stories yet but after hearing about these cool new stories, we know they are going to be fantastic.  They deserve to be illustrated in comic book form. Well as many know putting a comic together is not an easy task, we have to pay all the creators, letterer etc...but we'll put the work into it if we reach the following goals. 
$30,000 Goal: Make us do more art!
$35,000 Goal: Make us do even more art!
$40,000 Goal: We can do even more art!
 And finally, if we hit this final goal we will print the art for all three stories in one comic book with an exclusive only can get through Kickstarter cover. I know it is a stretch but that's why they call them stretch goals.
$45,000 Goal: It can never hurt to ask goal...
Now one caveat to these stretch goals...they may take some time to get completed (writing and artwork) so if we make these goals they may take a bit of time to get completed and may arrive after the books are sent.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks inherent in any project. This project has very few risks; the book is already done, and all we just need to do is raise the funds, pay the printer, and get it made. Our biggest risk is that we won't get the funding, and then the book won't be made.

We have been printing and releasing books for close to 30 years, so we have a good relationship with our printer and do not anticipate any hiccups.

There is always the risk that we won't be able to get the books in on time due to a variety of factors, but again, we do not anticipate that sort of problem.

We believe in full disclosure and we will make sure to keep you all updated on the progress of the book and all the incentives.

There may be some who are concerned that our previous Kickstarter (Zombie Deck) has not been completed. As we speak about 99% of those rewards have been filled (with the remaining due to bad addresses or other logistical problems). While I do not want to make excuses, we ran into some issues that we did not anticipate which included not getting approvals in a timely manner and/or multiple changes that were requested on the character cards which delayed submission of the completed deck. This should not occur with this project. There were also some hiccups with the printer, this was the first time dealing with this particular playing card printer and we had to make adjustments accordingly which also caused delays.. The printer we are using for this project is one that we have dealt with for many years so we do not anticipate any printing issues.

For those supporters of our previous Kickstarter (Fred Perry Color Gold Brick). We have already begun to fulfill those rewards. Three reward tiers are already complete and the challenge with this Kickstarter was the overseas printer. The books are being shipped from overseas as we speak and should arrive on time in mid February so we do not anticipate any delays in getting the books out to supporters on time or even early.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
We need your help to partner with us as we record our final album. We want to make the album of our life. We have so much to say on this record and for this one, we have no boundaries to make a label happy because you are the label! Our time at Tooth and Nail has come to an end and we have so many amazing stories and memories from our time there. Instead of signing with another label and starting the machine up again, we,  along with our management team at Triad Music, feel it's time to pour our hearts out like never before and to do that, we need you. The fans.
Have no doubt, this will be the most rockin and better yet honest Children 18:3 album we've ever recorded. The world needs honesty. The world needs hope. The world needs amps turned to 11!
We are shooting for a financial goal of $25,000. This will cover the recording, mixing and mastering of our final album. Anything over that set goal will be used for videos, publicity or anything else we can do to continue reaching the world and giving you, the fans special access to everything Children 18:3. 
You have been there for us since 1999 and we want to give you the absolute best album of our lives. Thank you for checking this out and we cannot wait to partner with you! Thank you for so many great years and we are blessed to partner with you in our final chapter of what is Children 18:3!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Clear communication with backers is key. The most obvious challenge we could face would be producer schedules. If the producer we have chosen is not available during the time we have allotted, we will seek alternatives from our list. If we have no choice but to wait and be delayed, we will make sure the backers are well aware of the situation and new delivery schedules.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Got an email yesterday from management informing me that:  "Vinyl manufacturers are like the sloths in Zootopia."
 Just passing that along.
 -CH183

Hello!
We finally received a test pressing for the vinyl! It's exciting.
There were still a few problems(skips,etc) that needed to be fixed, but I believe we are still looking at AUG sometime.
 Thank you for your patience,

Hello!
 The latest we've heard is that we should have vinyl in AUG.
Just wanted to let you know that we are still waiting to receive the vinyls  from the company making them, and will let you know more when we know more. So sorry for the wait! :(

Hello!
 So, we were told the vinyl would be done March 1st AT THE LATEST, and probably earlier. But as you can see.....yeah.
Still in production. So sorry :(

So we just got word that the vinyl will be done March 1st at the latest and probably earlier.
We will then send them out!
 If you missed the last update, this is the 2nd company we're working with to print vinyl. The first company just kinda disappeared on us a few months back :(
So sorry for the super long delay :(

campaign.story:
The Story 
Faces of the Stranger will be the third installment in our Decisions series. In this story we follow Jack … a man standing at a crossroad. He is wrestling with his place in the world trying to come to terms with his own sexuality and future. But these questions are tied to his past … a past that he has tried hard to forget but has never moved beyond. As an early teen Jack was molested in what he remembers as a loving relationship that was ruined by his parent’s intervention … but the time has come for him to face the truth of what actually happened.
Jack - the central character of Decisions: The Faces of the Stranger
This story was conceived by Cosmic Times creative director Zach Bassett as a tale of hope for those dealing with similar issues. Great care was taken to be as honest as possible and to some it may be hard to handle, but the truth often can be. This is not meant to be exploitative or “shocking” but uses cold terms and taboo subjects to tell a story of healing and new beginnings.
There is still hope for Jack ... but only if he is willing.
The Project
We are asking you to support this project so that we can bring Zach’s story to the world. We need your backing to help cover the final production costs as well as the printing costs. This is a bold story and possibly one of the most important books Cosmic Times will publish and that’s why we need your help. In the general marketplace this book will be a hard sell, but thanks to Kickstarter we can present the project to people in a more descriptive way.
We tried to break down the reward tiers in a way as to not be confusing but to offer a variety of options for every level of interest. The $30.00 “Decision Collected Edition Level” is a unique item to Kickstarter and will only be produced for this campaign. Also the “Sketch Cover Levels” will not only feature amazing original artwork by Zach Bassett or Jeramy Hobbs but will also be items ONLY available though Kickstarter.
All THREE Decisions Covers
The Stretch Goals

Now that we have exceeded the minimum funding goal of $850.00, there are opportunities to add to the rewards available as we reach higher levels of funding.
If we exceed $1,000.00 – A special copy of the Decisions: The Faces of the Stranger Production Script will be added to all tiers $20.00 and above!
If we exceed $1,200.00 – An original one of a kind sketch card (created by Zach Bassett or Jeramy Hobbs) will be added to all tiers $20.00 and above!
The Team
Zach Bassett – Writer and Creative director for Cosmic Times
Zach (a SCAD graduate) has been with Cosmic Times from nearly the beginning. Zach’s work with us includes providing the artwork for Decisions 1 & 2 as well as From Blood issues 1 & 2 where he co-wrote the story and script. He also worked on the mini series Souled. Beyond his work with Cosmic Times Zach has worked with 215 Ink, Big Dog Ink, Creature Entertainment and Blue Water (where he worked on the Bill Gates biography with Martin).
Martin T. Pierro – Co-Scripter and Publisher for Cosmic Times
Martin has worked in the entertainment industry for years working behind the scenes in film, stage, television and even music production before starting Cosmic Times in 2008. As Publisher of Cosmic Times Martin has overseen many projects as well as creating and promoting the hugely successful PalmCon Comic Convention, but this marks his first solo attempt at Kickstarter.
Jeramy Hobbs – Artist
Jeramy joined Cosmic Times last year when his one-shot What I.F. was picked up by Cosmic Times. What I.F. was a smash hit for Cosmic Times so when it came to selecting an artist to take over Decisions Jeramy was the obvious choice for Martin and Zach.
Ted Woods – Letterer
Zach selected Ted for this project and though this is his first work with Cosmic Times, his skill and speedy turn-around has already made him a vital asset to the team.
Jeff Dekal – Cover Artist
This will be the second Decisions cover for Jeff who has worked with Creature Entertainment and Marvel Comics as well as some recent work for Valiant. Jeff is quickly becoming THE sought after cover artist in the industry.
 The Previews
PAGE ONE
PAGE FIVE
PAGE SIX
Thank you for your time and support. We do also ask that you help spread the word about this project through your social media outlets. You can find links to all of Cosmic Time’s social media through our website CosmicTimes.net and remember to STAY COSMIC!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Cosmic Times has been involved in comic publishing since 2008 and has a great track record of delivering everything we have promised, we don’t foresee any issues in delivering all of the rewards in a timely manner. At the launch of this Kickstarter campaign Ted Woods only has to finish lettering the last five pages and Jeff Dekal is currently working on the cover, we expect to have all of the files delivered to us by the first of the year. If on the off chance any unforeseen issues do arise – we have a great team ready to handle any problem. Cosmic Times has a record of 100% customer satisfaction and we expect to continue that tradition.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everybody - I just wanted to let you know about something new!
Zach Bassett and myself have teamed up for a brand new adventure - The Good, The Bad, and The Prehistoric - now funding on kickstarter! 
It’s an exciting tail about the old west … but not as you know it. In our story dinosaurs and men exists side by side in the wild untamed frontier. In this time bending tale, horses and other beasts of burden have been replaced by dinosaurs and the indigenous people are now represented by mysterious cavemen.

Hey Everybody,

The Deep Space Tragedy Black Light Free Fall Collectors Box Set Kickstarter launched on January 12th and is doing great. Though we did fund we are looking to go that extra mile and in the process unlock a few stretch goals. We are very close to our first goal of $2,750, once we cross that line all backers who backed at a physical reward level will receive a killer holo-foil sticker. These stickers are 3 x 1.5 and feature a haunting image of Jerrick digitally painted by Mike Wagganer. The image looks great by itself … but as a holo-foil sticker - it’s stunning!

Hello Friends,
Today (September 15th) at 12:00 PM (EST) I will be launching a new Decisions one-shot entitled Decisions: A Minor Variation. I would invite you to join us for this special launch to become a Day one Backer!

Thank you for supporting Decisionson Kickstarter! If you missed your chance to support From Blood, now is the time! The final chapter is ready, and the full series will be available for the FIRST TIME in full color. You will be able to get From Blood: The Complete Series, the entire story of Patient 27 in three chapters. This epic final From Blood Kickstarter launches Tuesday May 12th, 2020, we hope that you will join us for the complete From Blood saga.
CLICK HERE TO GET A REMINDER AT LAUNCH

updates.update_userinfo: Halfway There … Living on a Prayer …
updates.update_content:
Hello Decisions Bakers,
Just dropping an update here to say that From Blood: Chapter Two is halfway through its funding cycle. With only ONE WEEK left we still have 11% left to fund and we can sure use your help.
Click HERE to Support From Blood on Kickstarter!

Hello Decisions Supporters,
We are at it again … the From Blood: Chapter Two Kickstarter is now live! Escaping the Grove Mental Institute was only the beginning for Patient 27. Separated from Doctor Reese, 27 is taken in by a sinister group looking to exploit his strength and invulnerability. But Doctor Reese is not alone, she encounters a mysterious man from 27s past … who just might hold the key to his future.

campaign.story:
The Redheaded Zombie Show is a monthly event dedicated to showcasing music and art from Colorado. From new and unexperienced acts who have never performed outside of their room, to mature and seasoned artists who have built a career around their talent.

2014 RHZ Awards!
Last year we hosted our own awards show presenting art and music from talented people all over Colorado on our website. There were many nominees for each category and we let the fans and people at home vote for their favorites before announcing them live at our Awards Show event this past January. We had 5 performing acts and 15 artists with tables and booths to showcase their work and it was easily the biggest event we'd ever hosted!
 This year we're getting ready to do it again, but this time we'd like to make it as big as possible, not just for the artists participating, but for you, the fans! This campaign is to raise funds to book and promote next year's awards show and to produce and ship RHZ merchandise to our backers and fans who attend the show!
 For updates on the 2014 RHZ Awards and our monthly RHZ Show, check out our website or facebook for more information!
The Details So Far...
The show is set for January 31st 2014 and will be hosted at Sunshine Studios on 3970 Clearview Frontage Road.
The Bands have already been booked and the lineup includes: A Bad Night For A Hero, Knight in Colors, Still Catchin' Wreck, Passing Out On Porches, and Joe Johnson!
As for artists we're currently booking tables and will keep you up to date as our roster continues to grow!

Rewards!!!
We're trying to bring you as much cool rewards as possible including shirts, buttons, stickers,commissioned RHZ Birthday Cards (from our September show), an 8 1/2 x 11 book of fliers and RHZ artwork, backstage access during the show, and even private shows from A Bad Night For A Hero!
The Shirts
This year we're bringing back some of our original shirt designs as well as new ones, but this time we're having them made professionally  on cotton Tees. So not only will you look extremely cool wearing one of these, you'll be comfy too!
 #1-RHZ Girl by Cassidy Messinger, #2-My Gal by Dan Connor, #3-Dead Love by Joe Oliver, #4-RHZ Rocker by Lura Douglass, #5 Hole In Your Chest by Joe Oliver, and #6 RHZ Valentine by Joe Oliver
Buttons & Stickers
We're selling buttons and stickers in a 4-piece set, featuring new designs, but for smaller donations you can select the design of your choice and receive a 1 1/2 size button!
RHZ Girl by Jennifer Lotharius
RHZ Girl by Cassidy Messinger, Rock On RHZ by Elias Hambey, RHZ Valentine by Joe Oliver
B&W Commissions from Elias Hambey
Our resident artist will be drawing black and white inked commissions for backers. You can see some of his work below!
 The Birthday Cards
We made these for our September RHZ Birthday Bash using a design created by Elias Hambey and we're making them available for our fans to celebrate with their friends and families. Each card we ship will come with a commission from Elias inside.
RHZ Birthday Card by Elias Hambey
Private Performance From A Bad Night For A Hero
Besides hosting/running the Zombie Show, Brandon Arnold and C.J. Hackett also perform in the band A Bad Night For A Hero (ABNFAH) as a thank you to our backers we're offering a private show to those who donate on this tier. The band will bring their own gear and set up to play an hour long set in your home. The date of these shows will be determined after the campaign has come to an end, but any tangible rewards on this tier will be shipped in January
A Bad Night For A Hero at 2013 RHZ Awards
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As soon as the project has been funded, we'll be working to get the rewards produced and shipped as fast as possible. It's possible some items may be lost or damaged but we will do everything in our power to remedy such problems and make sure everyone gets what they paid for. We have an amazing crew and street team behind us and we'll make sure this event goes smoothly and is a fun time for everyone involved!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The Show must go on! Eventually...
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone, in case you haven't heard already, the show was postponed due to extremely inconvenient weather. We apologize to everyone for this setback. We had everything ready to go, but the one thing that could go wrong did.
 But all is not lost! On March 22nd we'll try again to host the event, with the same lineup and roster of artists. So all of you who purchased tickets will still be honored at the makeup show. In the meantime we will be delivering/shipping your rewards as soon as possible. And optionally if you'd like to pick up your package from me personally, you can contact me at Manta0917@gmail.com

Here it is! The night we've all been waiting for! Come on down to Sunshine Studios at 3970 Clearview Frontage, tonight at 5:30 to see what all of your donations have gone towards. We did our best to put this together and I'm sincerely hoping this is one of the best, most entertaining, shows you will attend this year. Tonight will be a night to remember!
 All the merch has arrived, but I didn't have time to ship before tonight, so if you come to the show tonight, your name will be on the guest list, so you can get your ticket(s), and all the merch you ordered will be held at our merch table during the event.

Contrary to the last update, which was actually supposed to be posted last week (not sure how that happened...) everyones shirts, pins, and stickers should be ready today or tomorrow if everything continues to go smoothly! Obviously, shipping before the show would be next to impossible at this point, but we'll have items, packaged and ready to go for everyone who attends the Awards show this Friday, and afterwards we'll be shipping out to everyone who couldn't make it. For those of you who purchased tickets, you'll be able to pick them up at roll call during the event. Just give them your name and verify i.d. fr your ticket and head to the RHZ Merch table for your Kickstarter package!!! I want to thank all of you again, for helping us pull this off. We've all been working hard to make this happen, and we'll do everything we can until the last minute to make sure everyone has a good time.

updates.update_userinfo: Processing!!! Expect a few items this week!
updates.update_content:
So the funds have finally been processed, which means we can finally start getting merch made and ready for the show! We thank all of you for patiently waiting and despite losing our largest donation, we're going to do our best to make sure everyone gets what they ordered by the end of the month. If you're coming to the Awards show on Jan 31st, we can give you your items then, or we can ship them to you. We'll be posting surveys and such, soon to find out your shirt sizes and which designs you'd like to receive.
 And later this week, we'll be sending out the PDF for the RHZ Comics preview and the RHZ Art book as well, so keep your eyes peeled!

updates.update_userinfo: The Show Will Go On! (Thanks to all of you!)
updates.update_content:
So here we are just a few days after the success of our first Kickstarter! All of us from the RHZ Crew appreciate what you've done and words just can't express how much this means to me. Not only will we be able to take the RHZ show to the next level because of you, you've also shown that you trust and believe that we can accomplish something amazing in a town, some people would argue is dead and void of talent and entertainment. We're proving them all wrong!
 Your donations are still being processed, so if you have any issues with your card or bank account, please make sure everything is in working order, so we can make this process as smooth as possible! Once it clears we can start producing the shirts and pins, you all crave. And we'll be emailing backers PDFs for our Monster Falls comic and the RHZ Art Book, as soon as possible, along with the signed lithographs from my band "A Bad Night For A Hero"

updates.update_userinfo: 100% !!! (New Artists, Sponsors, and One Very Slick Guitar!)
updates.update_content:
So yesterday we reached our goal of $1000, which was a pleasant surprise for all of us at Redheaded Zombie Productions. We never expected to make so much, so fast! BUT, we know our work is far from done and we're still looking to get as many backers as possible for this awards show. We think with the musical lineup, and the growing list of artists featured at the RHZ Awards, that everyone in Colorado Springs will definitely want to buy a ticket, and you can get them before anyone else by donating here and you'll get exclusive rewards!
 With that said, here's a few things I'd like to announce that should get you excited for our show. Escape Velocity Comics has officially agreed to sponsor us, and hopefully there will be many more local sponsors as well! We'll also be featuring, Ryan Davis (Creator of Pulp Cult Comics, Unknown Society, and Velvet Garden), Joe Oliver(Artist for Velvet Garden,RHZ Merch, and various projects across Colorado), and Rio Herrera (Lair of Wonders Productions) among other artists at our event. They are all very big supporters of the RHZ Show and I am honored to have them. And I know they're stoked to attend!

campaign.story:
For the past eight years, I've been working on a web comic called "LVL UP"
It's based on the adventures my character Calcula Mihgo, has with all her friends in the Final Fantasy 11 campaign setting.
I've done tons and tons of comics, but I've always felt a little sad that I didn't have all those stories in print format. 
Not a retail book for selling in stores or online, but a nice personal book in print format. (So the only way you could actually get this book is through kickstarter or by seeing me at a convention.)
LVL UP page 2
Well, this year I decided to call around to varies printers, put the prototype together and try to produce the one book I've never been able to produce before.
LVLUP Page 05
I hope you all will help support this effort. It's something that I've wanted to see since I first scribbled down Calc's adventures in 2005!
Here's a little preview...http://issuu.com/frederickperry/docs/lvluppreview1
If you're unfamiliar with LVLUP you can check it out here at lvlup.tsunami-art.com Though there is even more available on my deviant art account as well. fredgdperry.deviantart.com 
I love LVL UP so much, I even animated a music video with some of the characters!
*******Update:20130909
Thanks so much for everyone's support thus far. I'm really happy to see my pet project come as close to becoming a reality as it has, and it's pretty exciting.
I did want to point out some additional facts.
This book will NOT be available through retail of any kind. No online. No comic stores. This kickstarter and meeting me personally at conventions will be the ONLY, ONLY, ***ONLY*** way you can get ahold of this book.
It's a personal project that I want to share.
Thanks again for everyone helping me out with this.
*******Update:20130911
I've made some upgrades to the tiers of rewards since I've started so I'll list them all here...
(10$)LVL ONE Support: For this contribution, We'll email you (or send you a link to) a pdf of the LVL UP Dojin
(25$)LVL TWO Support: With this contribution, we'll send you the pdf version of the dojin then package and ship you a printed copy of the LVL UP black and white 160 pg dojin!
(50$)*upgraded*LVL THREE Support: With this contribution, you'll be sent the pdf version of the dojin and you'll be shipped *two signed copies* of the LVL UP black and white 160 pg dojin with a sketch of calcula on it's special edition dust jacket!
(75$)LVL FOUR Support: Includes all options from the LVL THREE Support and a Signed 11x17 poster based on the LVLUP dojin's Calcula and friends cover.
(200$)LVL FIVE Support: Includes all the options from LVL FOUR Support and your role playing game character in a digital commission inked by me and sent to you as a pdf file as well as a 8x12 B&W Print.
(600$)*upgraded*LVL NINETYNINE Support: Includes all of the options from the *LVL FIVE* Support option and in addition to your B&W rpg character action pose commission, you recieve another commission of your role playing game character (Doesn't have to be from Final Fantasy) Inked and colored by me. The commission of this character is sent to you as a 8.5x11 print as well as a pdf of the digital image file. The digital colored commission is also included on the special edition dust jacket which covers the 10 copies... There are only 8 positions available!!! And 10 copies of the dojin included so you may pass some out to your friends! (10 copies, not 12. Sorry about that.)
------------------------------------
I just checked with the printer and I can improve this project with a little more help. 
Stretch goal 21,000: I can add 32 more pages to make the book 192 pages long. The 30 color sketches I'm doing throught this month and october will be used for these images as well as some of the new lvlup comics I'm doing with Calc's daughter!
New comics sample
 Loooong term stretch goal 32,000:
Everyone who contributed 50+ will have there book(s) upgraded to a hard bound edition.
To help meet these goals I'm going to start submitting add-on for you to invest in.
-----ADD ON Section...
For those who add on 25$(shipping and handling included) to their investment, they get 17x11 *signed* wall poster of the first WesH poster I created.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Fortunately, I'm pretty experienced when it comes to producing and preparing comics for printing and getting them to the folks that order them. I've been working on Gold Digger for over 20 years.

The only hang up I have for this project is funding.

It's a personal project and I just don't have enough to do it on my own.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Well, that's that. The last of the packages (Except a few who still need to send me their info... and they've been notified) are safely away!
Thanks so much on making this Kickstarter successful.
If you haven't received yours in four weeks (6 for foreign) notify me and I'll check the shipment data. and make sure your package or a replacement is sent to the right place.
F.
(Ohhh, I almost forgot to mention: Joe Wight is starting his art book kickstarter! His art is rare and wonderful and he hardly has a chance to show it in comics or online! So this is a pretty unusual sighting!)

The only problem I foresee with mailing off the last of the orders I have addresses for (3 or 4 folks still need to send me their addresses and I'll resend their reminders right after this update.)
Is getting the foreign lvl99 orders precisely weighed.
It's just a matter of getting them to the post office though. They have those super precision scales.

Well, it's a good thing the staff didn't send those packages out, because I need to sign all of lvls 4,5, and 99's posters! 
But shoot, I can get that out of the way in an hour.
(I would have hated to have to resend 70 posters.)  Off I go to do that, break for lunch then get Gold Digger started. But first I need to post the emergency bulletin for the APForums site, and check my new facebook.com/fredperrygolddigger forum.

updates.update_userinfo: Mail order completion push this weekend.
updates.update_content:
Well, after visiting the office I discovered that the mailing staff at AP were swamped with the Gold Brick orders and were unable to handle any of the level up orders while I was away.
Over 400 orders is a pretty good run, but I want all of them shipped at once so this weekend I'll be taking time away from GD to handle packaging and mailing the last of the orders personally.
I should be able to finish everything by monday morning.

I'm back from florida but seem to have come down with some con crud.
I'm going to take a quick trip to the office to ascertain the status of the few remaining orders and I'll report their status. (I suspect they've all been mailed off, but I've been gone for the week and the mailing staff *is* busy with lots of other package orders.)
Thanks once again for your patience.

updates.update_userinfo: The last of the printing is all done!
updates.update_content:
Just got the dustcovers in, folks.
Sorry for the delays but now the packaging and mailing is well underway.

updates.update_userinfo: Thanks for the rapid survey responses!
updates.update_content:
Thankfully I've used excel and spreadsheets plenty of times while working on my commissions so using a spreadsheet to keep orders straight is right in my comfort zone.
But everyone who filled in the surveys made it much easier!
Right now I'm still sorting the add-on requests and linking them to their orders on the spread sheet. The printers are busy with the posters and dustcovers.

updates.update_userinfo: How kickstarter helps me organize things.
updates.update_content:
Since this is my first kickstarter there are going to be some things that trip me up that experience could have helped me out with in the beginning...
Starting with the survey.
Surveys are used to collect all the order data into one list: An excel document that's automatically created with the information I'm suppose to have to completely fill all the orders.

Digital Add-Ons for any Tier

Armikrog art by CreatureBox

We’ll also discuss past projects like The Neverhood and Earthworm Jim! This Add-On is not offered in any reward tier.

$20 - The Chumpy Cam: You’ll get access to live streaming video on one of our stop-motion sets. See the building and lighting of the sets, and watch animators create the animation—all from the comfort of home! Access will be for the duration of the project. This Add-On is not offered in any reward tier.

Doug TenNapel, creator of Earthworm Jim™ (Interplay) and The Neverhood™ (Electronic Arts) has partnered with Pencil Test Studios, to create what some have called The Neverhood's "spiritual successor" -- a clay and puppet animated adventure game called ARMIKROG.
The founders of Pencil Test Studios, Mike Dietz and Ed Schofield (also from Earthworm Jim and The Neverhood), have assembled much of the original Neverhood development team to create a brand new game that blurs the lines between art and technology, using stop-motion animation and sculpture to bring this project to life.
The Story
Without giving too much away, Armikrog follows the adventures of a space explorer named Tommynaut and his blind alien, talking dog named Beak-Beak. They crash land on a weird planet and end up locked in a mysterious fortress called Armikrog. Then...the adventure begins!
The Game
Armikrog is a point and click adventure game that features all of the characteristics of TenNapel's unmistakable style:
Quirky and lovable characters
Unique worlds
A compelling story
Mind-bending puzzles
Great animation
Tons of clay!
The Music
Terry S. Taylor -- the award winning composer of The Neverhood soundtrack, will be composing and performing an entirely new original soundtrack for the game. Hooray!!!
Armikrog will be available DRM-free for PC (WINDOWS), MAC OSX and LINUX, and distributed though GOG.com, The Humble Store and several other digital distribution platforms. For those of you who prefer Steam, we are now on Steam Greenlight. Click the link below where you can vote YES for Armikrog and boost our popularity!
Armikrog on Steam Greenlight
Making this game will be a labor of love, and a "thank you" to all Neverhood fans and adventure gamers.
Armikrog is being developed by Pencil Test Studios, an independent game development company located in Lake Forest, CA. Along with Doug TenNapel, the team includes core members from The Neverhood, as well as puppet fabricators, sculptors, and animators that will help to create the stop-motion that makes this project so unique.
Armikrog will also feature the voice talents of:
The Neverhood was conceived and created from the ground up over a 12 month period. Armikrog will be developed using the Unity engine for PC, MAC and LINUX in order to secure the goal of completing the project within one year. We'll also be using many of the same animation, modelling, sculpting, set building and clay & puppet fabrication methods we've used before—keeping the overall game design scalable so that we can create a fun and exciting experience within our targeted funding goal, but still have the flexibility to expand, should the opportunity present itself.
Of course, none of this happens without your support, which is why we are reaching out to you through Kickstarter. Why Kickstarter? Funny you should ask...
Kickstarter is our most direct link to you, the fans. This is your opportunity to express whether or not you'd like to see another clay and puppet, stop-motion adventure game. Armikrog is a unique and creative project that we would love to make for those of you who have, over the years, dreamed of the chance to immerse yourself in another world made of clay. We're here to offer you the opportunity to make this project a reality.
While our funding goal is considerably less than The Neverhood cost to produce in 1997, it is still our biggest hurdle. But in light of what it will cost to create, the real question is this: Would you support and play this game for $25?
If enough of you support it, you will get this game.
The Armikrog game will be comparable in size and scope to The Neverhood. It's been noted that our initial funding goal is significantly less than the cost of the original Neverhood game--this is possible since we are now utilizing technology that was not available to us 15 years ago (Unity engine, post-production and editing software, etc) which will allow us to create this game more efficiently with a overall higher level of quality.
In addition to our more conventional game production pipeline, we are also utilizing many of the same stop motion techniques used in such feature films as Paranorman and Nightmare Before Christmas. A significant portion of our budget is allocated toward puppet fabrication and sculpting, set building, lights, cameras, and lots and lots of clay!
Stop motion animation is an art all of its own. Each puppet, set and prop is individually hand-crafted by artists, while each and every frame is painstakingly animated. This specialized process is what makes this game unique--and we feel the time and talent that it takes to bring a project like this to this to life is worth every penny.
100% of the funds that are raised will go directly into the production of the game. To date, we’ve invested over $100,000 into the preproduction, design, and development, and we can see how fun and amazing this project will be. We want to deliver an incredible experience to all of you who support us, and applying 100% of your contributions toward development is the only way this will happen.
Illustration by Earthworm Jim poster artist, Mike Koelsch
Rewards fall into two basic categories: Digital Rewards that are distributed though Steam and/or comparable download venues, and Physical Rewards that will be distributed through the mail. Note that all physical rewards under $1000 have an additional shipping cost for supporters with addresses outside of the United States.
Rewards that are not dependent on the production of the actual game will be fulfilled before the date specified in the reward tiers. Since we can't predict the amount of rewards that will need to be fulfilled, all rewards have been given the same fulfillment date as the game's ship date (July 2014). Once the campaign has ended, we will notify you of the fulfillment dates for those rewards that will ship sooner.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Pencil Test Studios has an experienced crew developing this project. Having many of the original members of The Neverhood team is a tremendous asset, as we already have the experience of creating this type of game. All games face unforeseen challenges throughout the course of production, but we have yet to face a challenge that we couldn't overcome. We have already begun to detail the entire scope of the game before production begins, which will help to define and minimize risks--which is key to the successful development of any game.

We've already invested a substantial amount of time and money into preproduction, laying the groundwork for an amazing game and we hope that you are as excited as we are about this project. Ultimately, we want to bring the magic of Armikrog to all of you who support it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Beware the creatures of the night—they have lawyers! Wolff & Byrd, Counselors of the Macabre, have had a lot of interesting supernatural clients over the years, but this one warranted their longest story ever!
The Werewolf of New York originally appeared online in the Supernatural Law webcomic (www.supernaturallaw.com).  It is the story of Leon Reed, a werewolf who was stalking New York until he was arrested. Thanks to attorneys Alanna Wolff and Jeff Byrd, Leon catches a break. However, a shapeshifter advocacy group disagrees with how Wolff & Byrd handled the case and influence Leon to make a decision that has the counselors putting their reputations on the line as they try to save their client.
The Werewolf of New York has plenty of plot twists and introduces some new characters, such as Sister Mary Maledict who runs a 13-Step Program in her Halfway House of Horrors, for monsters who want to get “clean” and go “human.” Plus longtime Wolff & Byrd fans will be treated to more of the antics in the office with some wacky clients and, of course, the trials and tribulations of Mavis, their intrepid secretary.
Meet Sister Mary Maledict of the Halfway House of Horrors.
It's time this story became available in print. The book will be 112 pages, 7" x 10 1/2" in full color. (As anyone who got to read the story online will tell you, the coloring on this story is terrific and is essential to reproducing it in print.)
The money raised for the project will go toward the costs of printing and production of 1,000 copies of the book; production of premiums such as the bookmarks, calendar, and T-shirt; shipping; and Kickstarter and Amazon costs. The idea is to have the book out in July, in time for Comic-Con in San Diego.
Every level comes with your choice of (or all of) of these cool bookmarks:
As an example of the other goodies that backers can get, here's a sneak peek at the T-shirt that will mark you as an official "inmate" of Sister Mary Maledict's Halfway House of Horrors, which you'll get at the "Pure of Heart" level and above:
And here's a mock-up of the 16-month calendar that backers at higher levels will get:
Here's a mock-up of the notepad you'll get at the Wolfbane and higher levels:
And that's not all! You get these nifty "wolf tags" at the "Wolf-Man" and higher levels:
At the "Urban Werewolf" and "Alanna Wolff" levels, you will have your choice of an original art page from the book, with the option of having Batton handcolor the art for you. Here are four sample original art pages:
We truly appreciate your support and hope you will let all your friends and colleagues know about this project. The book is howling to see print! And when you get your copy, you'll howl--with laughter!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
To have the book out in time for San Diego, it will need to go to the printer before the Kickstarter campaign is completed. Production is already under way, so needless to say, we really need this fundraising to reach its goal.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
With less than 19 hours to go in the Kickstarter campaign, we are happy to announce that the foreword to the book is being written by Michael Uslan. Uslan has produced all the modern-era Batman movies beginning with Tim Burton's 1989 film. He has also produced a number of other films, has written comics including the recent Archie Marries Veronica, taught (with Roger Stern) the first accredited college course on the serious study of comics, and published his autobiography, The Boy Who Loved Batman, in 2011.
if you are not already backing this project, it's not too late to get onboard! There are lots of exclusive backer rewards to choose from. The Kickstarter campaign can be found at: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1379875462/zombie-wife-and-other-tales-of-supernatural-law

Only 5 days left in the Zombie Wife, And Other Tales of Supernatural Law Kickstarter campaign!
If you've been planning to back this project, there's no better time than now. Check out the campaign page for a number of "add-ons" that have been created for backer rewards in the last few days. You may find something just for you!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1379875462/zombie-wife-and-other-tales-of-supernatural-law

Hello, Werewolf of New York backers! Many of you have jumped onboard to support the new campaign for the 160-page full-color Zombie Wife, And Other Tales of Supernatural Law. We're happy to say we've passed $5,000 on the way toward the goal $10,000 goal. At the top level we're offering a handcrafted Supernatural Law pocket watch, and 4 of the 5 available are already gone (so if you wanted the watch, don't hesitate much longer!).
Most recently, a new level has been added for those who want the complete Supernatural Law trade paperback library. We are always open to suggestions for backer rewards, so please let us know if there is something you'd like to see.

If you liked The Werewolf of New York, you'll love Zombie Wife! It's in the same size and format as Werewolf, in full color, and 160 pages. Check it out: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1379875462/zombie-wife-and-other-tales-of-supernatural-law
Thanks again for all your past KS support!
Batton and Jackie
Here is the correct link: http://www.exhibitapress.com

Several packages have gone in the mail this week or will be sent off early next week, leaving only a handful of backers waiting for all their goodies. Of 264 backers, all but 6 are taken care of. And of those 6, there are 3 who have not responded to our requests for addresses and choices of premiums.
The only remaining premiums to be completed are individualized watercolor paintings for folks at the Talbot and Alanna Wolff levels, and the plan is to have them done within the next two weeks.

Now that most of you have received your books, could you take a moment to post of a review The Werewolf of New York on Amazon? It would help the visibility of the book and let other potential readers what they have in store if they were to purchase it.
Thanks for your support!
http://www.amazon.com/The-Werewolf-New-York-Supernatural/dp/0981551939

The Supernatural Law 2013 calendar that is a reward at the top levels for backers of "The Werewolf of New York" is currently in production. It should be ready in a week or so, and then we will be able to start sending packages out to the 14 remaining backers who have not yet received their books and reward items. Thanks for hanging in there!
Meanwhile, the book was officially published on October 29 and is now available online and in select bookstores and comics shops.

Out of 264 backers, all but 44 will have their books and other goodies by next week. Those at the higher levels who get original art are being saved for last, as are several international packages.
Batton is currently doing drawings in the books for everyone at the Lycanthrope level, and the workers at two different post offices are getting to know Jackie pretty well ("Media Mail, right?").

The first batches of packages are all going in the mail this week. As promised for August fulfillment, the Full Moon, Silver Bullet, and Gypsy Curse mailings to U.S. backers are going out by Media Mail; international mailing will follow soon.
Other levels with promised August delivery are slated to ship next week.

campaign.story:
Like most comic book readers, I dreamt of making my own comic books.  Thanks to 21st Century technology, my dream came true with my self published comics "Kidnapping Kevin Smith" and "Astonishing Adventures"! But, self publishing can be expensive...luckily Kickstarter has come along. 
My goal for this project is not too lofty or pie in the sky, I am simply asking for money to cover the expense of self publishing a graphic novel. 
This story is important to me, it touches on many passions of mine and fellow comic book readers.  It's gonna be funny, suspenseful, and address creator owned rights!  Without giving too much away, the story revolves around a (ficticious) comic book innovator, Bernie "The Legend" Romero.  In the early 1960's, Romero created characters that would become the backbone for the entire Spectacular Comics line.  And while Spectacular Comics would reap a fortune from Romero's creations, he saw very little of it.  And in the end, Bernie Romero left the industry he helped build, penniless and disenfranchised.  Now, his grandson is given a unique opprotunity to right the wrongs of the past and finally get his grandfather the exaltation he deserves.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge will be getting the book solicited by Diamond Distribution. My first book, Kidnapping Kevin Smith was solicited to some moderate success. But by second book, Astonishing Adventures didn't get picked up by Diamond. So, if The Con Job doesn't get solicited by Diamond, it will be up to me to sell the heck outta it at cons!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
This Kickstarter is to fund a small print run of my new book, Penultimate Quest book 1. My plan is to distribute it on my website, larsbrown.com, and conventions that I'm able to attend. It is 90 pages long.
I started Penultimate Quest in January 2012, at the time I conceived it as a jokey, stand alone mini comic. That mini comic turned out quite well, but later in the year I started to kick around the idea of making it into a full length story. The idea of a never-ending dungeon was tantalizing and it carried with it a special challenge of explaining its origin and placing it all in a satisfying story. With my notes in place I began work on the full story in December and now have the first part complete.
I have already planned out the remaining two parts and will start working on them immediately. My hope is to have the next volume done either in the Summer or Fall and complete the next volume by Spring 2014. I also plan on putting out each part as a stand alone book, especially to backers so that they have complete sets.
Everything I make I post for free on my website larsbrown.com.
If you would like to read the comic it is all available online at my website, larsbrown.com. Thank you.
A few notes on rewards.
For all of the tiers the signatures or drawings will go on the title page which includes a fierce, level 1 rat. The margins in the image are not correct however, the title is centered the rat is not cut off.
For the $25.00 and up tiers I will need you to send me a photo of you that I can use as reference to draw from. Also let me know your class (I can work from rogue, wizard or warrior, if you go more specific I'll need some reference) and if you want to specify a weapon or such let me know. If you only send a picture the other details will be random. Please email me as soon as possible at larsonus@gmail.com. Thank you!
For the $60.00 level it will absolutely be in order of when you funded the project. I will message you on Kickstarter and only about page selection. All pages are on bristol and are drawn with green pencil. All pages have inked word balloons with only green penciled words if that. Not all blacks are filled in, I will work on filling in character blacks but backgrounds may remain as is. Some images may not fully match the printed books because I edited it. If there is a large difference I will try to let you know. Here is a page with the pages listed with numbers, I will try to keep this as up to date so it may be necessary to give me 2 or 3 selections.
Every book will be signed.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I am doing a small run and have a few options for printing depending on the success of the Kickstarter. However even reaching my small goal will more than allow me to get a book to everybody who funds the print run.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello,
I just wanted to send out a short update to backers of Penultimate Quest 1. I am currently midway through the Kickstarter for the final volume of Penultimate Quest. Please check it out, thank you.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1209024922/penultimate-quest-3-final-volume

Hello everyone!
I just put up a Kickstarter for the next part of Penultimate Quest. 
It is being done under my own name due to how we structured Lavapunch when it was formed. 
If there were any problems with your order of the original Penultimate Quest please let me know. If you want to try out the new book please read it at my

Thanks all for your patience. Sending out the first batch of 20 books today, I hope to be done with all shipping by the end of next week.
Thanks again for all of your support. I anticipate the next book being done for a Kickstarter in the fall and delivery by Christmas. I'll also begin updating my site larsbrown.com with new pages in a few more weeks as well.

Hey all, a few quick updates. The production has started on the printing of the first book, I've received the stickers in the mail and my son was born (healthy and well).
Also I was able to get the chapter pages for the next book done and I'm sharing them here since they tell their own story. The first books chapter pages tell their own story, any guesses what these stories are?

Hello again.
I've selected and talked to a printer and I'll be compiling the book this morning. Originally the book was 92 pages long, which you can do when you print digital, but with offset printing books are in blocks of 16 pages and so I needed to add four more pages to bring the total to 96 (this is one reason why old paperbacks have blank pages and Hellboy volumes have a random number of sketch pages in the back). I had some art from making the mini comic to add to the back but I still had a page to fill up. I decided to draw a page of the inspiration for Penultimate Quest for the final page. This is in line with the back of the book where instead of a written description I drew a comic describing the contents of the books.

Okay, so, again, learning this all from the bottom up.
The first step is.... getting the book printed. I had a printer in mind when my goal was low, but now I've got to step out to look for another printer. I've got some good options open.
So the next update will be with the final sticker designs and when I find the printer to go with. At that point I'll start sending out survey's collecting addresses. I was going to jump the gun on surveys but it's definitely better to wait until we all know the book is on it's way.

Thank you everybody.
This is my first Kickstarter and so there have been some big learning experiences, but this has really turned out beyond what I was expecting.
I'm also learning how robust the tools are on Kickstarter for communicating with everyone and collecting information. I'm very impressed so far and it makes me look forward to more projects.

project_data.project_name: Penultimate Quest by Lars Brown - Book 1

campaign.story:
What is Jazu the Wanderer about?

Jazu the Wanderer is the story of Jazu, a 12 year old boy from space, who arrives on Earth after his people, The Wanderers, are attacked by their mortal enemies, the Nectarus. Jazu crash lands in El Giza, Egypt in 1926 and makes fast friends and even faster enemies as he begins to search for a way home. The first three chapters of Jazu, which will be featured in the finished graphic novel, follow Jazu as he meets Asima, a curious Egyptian girl with a love for adventure, and Henry, a hot headed British lad. Henry and Asima have followed their parents to Giza for a risky archaeology dig.  When a mythical amulet is discovered to be real, Jazu and his friends must work together to escape the pyramid and Giza before a team of greedy eyed cowboys can snag the amulet from them.  With writing from Jaysen Headley (The Class) and full color artwork from L.W. Marks (Tattered) Jazu shows what people, even those from different backgrounds and beliefs, can do when they work together.
Follow the creation of Jazu the Wanderer at the creators podcast:
Who is Jazu for?
Jazu the Wanderer is an all ages comic, which means it’s for EVERYONE! The story is historical sci-fi and is meant to be diverse enough for both parents and children to enjoy together. Jazu is an adventure story with action, comedy and the important connections we make with people.  

What are the details on the finished book?

The finished book will have 6" x 9" dimensions, 100 pages and full color.  In addition to the first three exciting chapters of Jazu, the book will also feature plenty of behind the scenes extras including concept art, pages from the script and interviews from the creators giving an in-depth look at the creative process.

Kickstarter? What’s that?

For 30 days you will be able to pledge your support for Jazu the Wanderer.  We have set up a variety of reward levels for you to pledge at.  The more you pledge, the more you get!  You won't be charged at the time of your pledge, but rather once the full 30 days of the project has passed.   Payments are accepted through Amazon. In the unfortunate event that the goal is not reached, you won’t be charged.  Of course, the biggest part of Kickstarter is you! Any support you provide is hugely appreciated.  Whether you pledge or simply help spread the word, we need and appreciate your generosity to make this dream into a reality.
We also look forward to kicking it forward.  Find out more here.

 I’m a Merchant or Advertiser. Are there options for me?
Yes.  We have deals involving a price cut for vendors and advertisement bundles to help you spread the word of your own projects. 

 When will I get my book and swag? 

Jazu the Wanderer is set to officially launch in April 2013. All books and swag will be sent out together approximately at this time.  We will be staying in touch over the course of the project in order to update you on when things will be shipped.  This is why we ask that you provide a valid e-mail address.  This will allow us to keep you up to date on the latest Jazu news.  

What's in it for me?
We have several levels of great stuff just for you, our backers!  Check them out below.  
We have also provided an A La Carte menu, allowing you to pick extra items that may not be in your pledged level or to order extra items. 
Check out all the A La Carte level options at the link below:
What if you surpass the goal of $3000?

If we hit goal, EVERYONE who donated will get the downloadable gratitude pack at no additional cost some time before the book's official release.  This includes wallpapers, gifs and exclusive images TBD. This will be exclusive to backers and backers ONLY.  there will also be several levels of stretch goals including extra items in every order and other rewards to be announced when the time comes.

Prepare for the Journey!
More About the Writer: 
The other half of this project is Jaysen Headley, the writer.  Jaysen has spent the last two years writing for the popular comic. The Class.  Jaysen is originally from Denver, Colorado, but now lives in New York City.  He survived Hurricane Sandy and also Co-hosts the Rabblebytes Podcast.  Want to know more?  Follow Jaysen on twitter.  
This duo is excited to bring you Jazu the Wanderer.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with all projects, real life has a funny way of getting in the way of things (Like Super Storms or Personal Emergencies). We currently have a production time line to adhere to, and are going strong and on the mark. We know the time line of all of our printers, and we have given ourselves a grace period on those (both with creation, and printing/shipping to us), but as we are all human, that's where the challenge will arise. 

Jazu WILL be a web comic, the only foreseeable problem would be a delay to the April 19th premiere at Denver ComicFest and ultimately the delay at getting the product to you. Book One is inevitable, barring some act of god >knocks on wood<. We encourage our backers and supporters to follow this project and be involved with it coming to life.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Good Day,
Jazu is still chugging along behind the scenes, sorry for the drop off the radar for a bit. Both Jaysen and I have had exciting life changes happening that we will be able to go more in depth later. We wanted to drop you a quick line to let you know we are still plugging away, and making progress, albeit slow progress. I hope you will bear with us and enjoy the first book. We are really excited to share the story of Jazu with you and are grateful for your continued support.

Hello all,
I'd first like to apologize for missing our Sunday Update schedule.  As often happens when visiting a convention, time got away from me and sleep deprivation finally caught up.
This weekend we attended Denver Comicfest, marking Jazu's very first convention!  We tested out some merch and even met a few people who had already read Jazu and loved it!
During the weekend we held a panel all about Kickstarter and our experience.  Check it out here.

campaign.story:
The Prelude
On May 27th 2009, I decided to step out on faith and create my own comic book. The first thing I did was jot down a bunch of different abilities. Soon I would attach these abilities to specific characters, and Lightweightz was born. 
Inspired by 1 Corinthians 12:7 ("Now to each one the manifestation of the Spirit is given for the common good"), Lightweightz is about eight teenagers who after discovering they have unique abilities, must now decide how they are going to use them. With Lightweightz I set out to tell a different kind of superhero story: One where each of the characters' abilities would have direct implications for how they relate to others, and one that was told from a Christian worldview. 
The Plan 
The Lightweightz saga will consist of at least three releases. The first two will be anthologies introducing readers to the characters, and the third will be a graphic novel (with the possibility of telling future stories). The first release, Lightweightz: The Anthology Part One came out in July 2012, and so far has received some good feedback. 
Here are a couple of videos featuring other indy creators talking about what they like about Lightweight: The Anthology Part One and why you should support Lightweightz: The Anthology Part Two:
“I like how with a few pages [Justin] developed these characters and tugged the reader’s emotions with the teens' lives and issues. Also the cliffhangers were great."
- Melchizedek Todd, Creator of Allegories of the Way, Faithland, and The United
“With me, the comic has to have a combination of great story and great art, and this one has both…[Justin's] work honors God and contains elements based on Biblical principals that believers and non-believers could understand.“
- Justin Swartz, comic writer and blogger
It is drawn and colored by the extremely talented Przemyslaw R. Dedelis and Lya Cuello respectively. I'm blessed to have such a talented team, and to say I'm excited to be working on the second release, Lightweightz: The Anthology Part Two is an understatement. What started as an idea has become much more. It's a movement.
And now I'm asking you to join me.
The Pitch
The purpose of the campaign is to raise funds to cover the production and printing costs of Lightweightz: The Anthology Part Two. Specifically, the funds will go towards paying the artist and colorist to draw and color the remaining pages, and to do a small print run of the comic once it's complete. Something I said in the video regarding the print run may be misleading, so let me clarify: If the campaign is successful, there will be print runs for both anthologies to cover all of the backers' rewards.
The Preview 
Here are the characters featured in Lightweightz: The Anthology Part Two:
Name: Qasim
Gender: Male
Age: 15
Ethnicity: African American
Ability: Revealer
Name: Ayden
Gender: Male
Age: 17
Ethnicity: Caucasian
Ability: Pusher
Name: Gabriel
Gender: Male
Age: 16
Ethnicity: Mexican American
Ability: Inscriber
Name: Emi
Gender: Female
Age: 15
Ethnicity: Japanese American
Ability: Adapter
Thank You
A huge thanks for checking out the campaign, and I hope you consider backing and spreading the word. You can check out the media page to learn more.
With Gratitude,
Justin Martin
Creator and Writer of Lightweightz
A couple of quick notes to backers:
(1) The reward schedule is based on the anticipated completion and printing of Lightweightz: The Anthology Part Two. All other rewards, including digital and print copies of Lightweightz: The Anthology Part One, will be processed (in the case of print copies) and distributed immediately following the campaign. 
(2) For backers who have already purchased a digital copy of Lightweightz: The Anthology Part One, another digital copy will not be included in your reward package unless you request it.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having already completed a comic, I have a better understanding of what needs to go into a finished product, and how long a project takes from being "done" in terms of fully-drawn, colored, and lettered, to being ready to release to readers. But if a challenge or obstacle arises, it will be addressed it immediately, and backers will be fully and consistently updated every step of the way.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Greetings everyone!
First off, I wish you and yours a safe, happy, and blessed Thanksgiving and holiday season. Among the many things I am grateful for this season, one of the recent events has been the completion of the Ph.D. That's right...after years of battling the dragon, it is great to announce it has finally been slayed.
Delays in finishing my dissertation were the primary reason R-Squared Comicz has been on hiatus the past two plus years. Slowly but surely, I have been picking things back up. The first order of business is to launch the Kickstarter for Pathways, which myself and co-collaborator Takeia Dunlop hope to launch within the next 2-3 months. The comic is done, and the purpose of the Kickstarter will be to recoup the out-of-pocket production costs while partnering with any ministries and organizations that are interested in using Pathways as a conversation starter. Although it has been two plus years since launching a campaign, my hope is that the Pathways Kickstarter to have the same success as the Lightweightz one.

updates.update_userinfo: WooHoo! Don't Panic! anthologies are shipping!
updates.update_content:
Hi gang!  Andy here- It's been a fantastic first week of spring:  My Wichita State Shockers are doing well in the NCAA Basketball Tournament, and we've been hit with a few snowstorms lately.  (Snowdays rule!)  It's an exciting day for me as Flying Fortress (Eric Weathers' and my vintage WWII pulp adventure comic) announced a new 'vintage webcomic' format.
But there's been an even more exciting update today for the Don't Panic! Anthology project:  after contacting and vetting a few new printers, I found a US-based one that will make a great book for us.  I'm pleased to announce that the Anthology is officially in production!  (FINALLY!)

Hi gang!  It's been a great and busy holiday season, and the Anthology is almost wrapped- I'm going to move the backer surveys live this afternoon, so start filling them out when you get the chance. I've included a sneak peek at the endpapers of the anthology to this update.
In between visits from family, Super Mario Brothers on the NES, feasting, and running, I've gotten 214 of the 220 pages paginated for the anthology.  I hope to have the .pdf download ready for everyone in a few days, and I'll have a press proof of the book in-hand soon after.

Oh man.  I'm burning the midnight oil working on book layout for the Anthology and just ran across a stop motion video from 2002. 
This video: "The Dangers of Watching TV" is included in the PDF of Issue #4 and I'll try to sneak it and some other goodies into the Digital version of the Anthology!
-Andy

campaign.story:
Help FIF Make the Album of your Dreams!
We need your support now more than ever. The inspiration and energy to create an amazing record is there but this time we will be working without the support of a label. This gives us incredible artistic freedom, but it also means we need to raise our own financing. Our hope is to release an album in 2013, ten years after our initial final show.
We are shooting for the financial goal of $30,000.Your pledges will be used to pay for demoing new material, recording, mixing, mastering, and associated travel expenses.Keep in mind, this budget covers making the album only. Every dollar we raise over $30,000 will be used for such things as promotion of the album once it's released because we think it would be great to have this album reach as many people as possible! Additional funds could also enable us to play some shows, because yes, we would love to play shows!
Thank you so much, every one of you for all the love, kindness, support, humor, prayers and friendship you have shown us since 1995. To our absolute joy this band continues to be more than just a band to many of you....and you are more than just folks at a show to us. If the past is any indication of the future we may all be in for a very wild ride.
We will keep you posted every step of the way.
Sincerely yours, Five Iron Frenzy
PS) If you aren't familiar with our band and would like to donate, thank you very much! We hail from the land of ice and snow; Denver. You can ask some cool people about us and keep up with our ventures at www.FiveIronFrenzy.com and www.facebook.com/5ironFrenzy


We can not thank you enough for making this happen. I got a little teared up when I saw the goal reached so fast. Our fans are incredible.

THIS ALBUM IS REALLY GOING TO HAPPEN GUYS!


If you have suggestions that you would like to see as a pledge item, please send a message. We will see if we can make it happen.

.

Here is the T-Shirt design. PRETTY COOL! The Hoodie will be similar.

Saturday, morning.
I’ve got my coffee,
I like it dark and black,
like I like my...
frostbitten hands.
I like to warm myself,
by lighting things I have found on fire,
that I have found inside the trash...
I fricking love this morning, Saturday morning,
I’ll put my favorite record on, 
it’s Chumbawumba, 
Dikembe Mutumbo and me,
dancing in our underwear, 
what is that thing that’s over there? 
I think it’s Carl Malden, 
he said your party’s baldin’, 
I think he means it’s fat. 
What’s that? It is a cat. 
A very special frisky friend, 
It sometimes wears my pants. 
And comes and does a dance, 
Dikembe Mutumbo,
and my cat and me. 
Don’t forget Carl Malden. That’s a wrap.

campaign.story:
What is Mindset Vertical? 'Mindset Vertical' is the first solo exhibition of artist Jerrell Conner (creator of The Red R) in over 5 years. It will be the most ambitious art show that the artists has ever put on. This project is about the characters of the book... more specifically their thoughts, ideas, and perspectives. Story is key, but rich characters make the story. The artist wants to create an art show exploring the lives, experiences, and beliefs of the diverse and eclectic mix of characters from the books. His goal is to create 13 large portraits (5' tall) painted of each of the main characters from the story. Coupled with the paintings will be brief descriptions and quotes from each character, delving a bit deeper into their psyche. Along with the paintings there will be animations breaking down the evolution of the characters over the years, as well as a process book documenting the steps of each piece and the story behind each character. But this project is more than just creating art that hangs on a wall and writing up an explanation to be pinned next to it... It seeks to bridge the gap between the artist and the art patron and art fans. YOU the patron and the fan not only have the power to help this dream project become a reality, but you can get involved in the actual creative process directing the artist as he creates some of the pieces, and depending on which reward option you go with you can even have custom artwork of YOU created by the artist for the show!
What is The Red R?  The Red R is an art movement that Jerrell has been working on for over 10 years now. Initially Jerrell's first Kickstarter project was going to be to complete the next issue of his Graphic Novel series called 'Revelations', but some interesting doors have opened up for him to pursue the story and characters in a different light. The 'Mindset Vertical' show has now become his FIRST Kickstarter project and will be an important piece in gaining momentum to start up the book series again, which has been an off-and-on project for the past few years as Jerrell has been immersed in 9-5 art jobs and clusters of freelance gigs and development projects. The funding of this project not only means new Revelations art in an exhibition again, for the first time in years, but it also is the FIRST major step back into the realm of Graphic Novels and Comics for Jerrell, to complete his post-apocalyptic trilogy.
